loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina de 50 años, es viuda, pero tiene 3 hijos. Ellos viven juntos en el centro poblado de canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Marina recuerda aquellas tardes de su juventud en las que observaba a sus padres en como se debe cultivar cacao, desde entonces decidió continuar con esta actividad, de esa manera logró sacar provecho todos los conocimientos que había adquirido. Ahora estas técnicas lo aplican junto con sus hijos. Por otro lado nos comenta que cuando enviudo tuvo que afrontar sola los problemas de su familia, trabajar muy duro para mantener a sus tres menores hijos en ese entonces. Ahora ella cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de sus peones quienes lo apoyan en la limpieza y extracción de los productos que ella cultiva. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que marina se compromete hacer puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Además es una persona que se lleva bien con los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles, contratará peones para que se encarguen de limpiar y sacar la maleza de su parcela de cacao.
texts.en: Marina is 50 years old and he is a widow, but she has 3 children. They live together in the community of Canayre in the district of Llochegua. Marina remembers those days of her youth when she observed how her parents managed the cocoa cultivation. Since then she decided to also take up this activity. This is how she managed to took advantage of the knowledge that she acquired. Today she applies these same techniques together with her children. She also tells us that when she became a widow she had to support the family by herself. She had to work very hard to support the three young children since them. Today she now enjoys the support of her children and from farmhand that help cleaning and harvesting the products which she cultivates. This is her second loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). Marina is committed to be on time with her payments. In addition, she is someone who gets along very well with the other members of the communal bank. With the 1000 neuvos soles she will hire farm hands to help her clean and rid her cocoa plantation of any pests and disease.

loans.use: to hire farmhands to help with the cocoa plantation.

loans.name: Mandalbayar

texts.en:
Mandalbayar is 43 years old and lives with his wife in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. His two children attend a local secondary school while his wife works at a private company. He manages a taxi service business, which was started in 2009. Since then his business was quite successful which allowed him to improve his living conditions. 

Mandalbayar is a polite man who is planning to expand his business. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a car for his wife in order for her to start taxi service business too.

loans.use: to purchase a car.

loans.name: Namsrai

texts.en:
Namsrai is 55 years old and lives with her husband in a house in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband, 63 years old, retired recently. 

Namsrai manages a grocery trading business at a rented stall at a local market. She started her business in 1990 and is planning to continue it in the future. With years of business operation, she has been able to gain much knowledge and experience. She is planning to repair her house soon. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventories.

loans.name: Altansuh

texts.en:
Altansuh is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a house in Sansar are of Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. His mother-in-law babysits his two children, aged 1 and 4 years old. 

Altansuh manages a clothing trading business with the help of his wife at a rented stall at a Narantuul, one of the busiest markets in Ulaanbaatar city. They started their business in 2006 and have gained much experience. They attribute their business success to a good location of their stall. Altansuh used to help to his mother's business while he was a teenager. At that time, he learned much about business operation and the fundamentals of business management. He is an honest man who is planning to expand his business in the future. He says, "I want to have my own apartment in the future." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro  de 58 años convive con Cirila de 45 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos que son el fruto de esta relación. Ellos viven en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Pedro, es agricultor, actividad que lo aprendió  desde muy joven y esto es gracias a sus padres que le enseñaron. Actualmente las labores de la chacra ya no lo hace bien debido a la avanzada edad que tiene. Es por este motivo que opta por abrir un negocio en su casa que  se encuentra frente al centro educativo de su localidad, ya que vio esta oportunidad puesto que no hay competencia alguna. Es así que tiene un negocio de venta de golosinas, por el cual ya tiene ganado una cantidad de clientes que siempre recurren a su puesto. Este es su segundo empréstito por el que celestino se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas muy puntualmente. Con lo 1.000 nuevos soles pedro comprará golosinas para implementar su tienda.
texts.en:
Pedro is 58 years old and lives with Cirila, who is 45.  They have two children and live in the town of Canayre in the Llochegua district.  

Pedro is a farmer who learned his trade when he was young, and he is thankful to his parents for teaching him.  Currently, he does not do field work very well because of his advancing age.  For this reason, he decided to open a business in his home, which is located across the street from a local school.  He saw an opportunity because there is no competition.  He has a business selling candy, and already has a number of customers who always return to the store.  

This is his second loan, and Celestino promises to be on time with his payments.  With the 1000 nuevos soles he requested, Pedro will purchase candy to set up his store.

loans.use: to purchase candy.

loans.name: Purevdorj

texts.en:
Purevdorj is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a house in Hovd province of Mongolia. His older son goes to a secondary school while his wife works as a cook. 

Purevdorj manages a taxi service business which he started in 2004. His wife is planning to conduct a taxi service business soon. He is a safe and reliable driver who provides comfortable service for his customers. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a car for his wife.

loans.use: to purchase a car.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel de 23 años, es madre soltera con 2 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Raquel tiene la clave del éxito como es la responsabilidad, puntualidad y valorar mucho al cliente. A pesar de su corta edad Raquel decidió emprender en abrir una pequeña bodega con la necesidad de cubrir sus gastos familiares, ella sabe que es el primer paso para cosechar muchos triunfos durante su travesía, pues para esto ella ya cuenta con una buena cartera de clientes, esto debido al buen servicio que ofrece. Generalmente trabaja por cuenta propia y por sus dos pequeñas niñas que son el motor para salir adelante. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete hacer puntual el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles Raquel comprará nuevos productos para abastecer su bodega.
texts.en:
Raquel is 23 years old and a single mother of two children.  She lives in her own home located in the town of Canayre in the Llochegua district.  

Raquel has the key to success; she is responsible, punctual, and values her customers.  Despite her young age, Raquel decided to open a small general store to cover her family's expenses.  She knows that this is the first step to harvest many successes along her journey.  She already has a number of customers thanks to the good service that she offers.  

She is self-employed and works for herself and for her two young daughters, who are her motivation to get ahead.  This is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time.  With the 1000 nuevos soles she requested, Raquel will purchase new products to stock her store.

loans.use: to purchase products to stock her store.

loans.name: Tsogoo

texts.en:
Tsogoo lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His older daughter, age 24, is a student while his younger daughter, age 18, is in secondary school. 

His wife makes Mongolian traditional shoes during winter time and helps in the family business during summer time. 

He manages a vegetable planting and trading business in his town. He started his business in 2001 and has gained much experience. He has been able to build a good relationship with both his partners and his customers. 

He used to have a 0.5 hectare plot of land that was expanded to 1 hectare in 2009. His business earning is a vital source of income for his family. He is an honest man who says, "I am planning to expand my business." 

He is requesting a 450,000 MNT loan to purchase pesticides and fertilizers for his business.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.es: Yasmín de 30 años, convive con Edwin de 36 años, fruto de esta relación tuvieron a Yong su Marian de 2 años de edad. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Yasmin se dedica a la venta de golosinas en el cafetín del centro educativo que queda en su localidad. En un comienzo no sabía nada, pero gracias a la enseñanza de sus padres supo sacar ese don que tenía para las ventas. Es por ello que sus clientes se sienten satisfechos, pero no todo fue alegría en su vida, ya que tuvo momentos en que no tenía clientes pues entonces contaba con una carretilla vendiendo sus escasos productos. Pero gracias al esfuerzo y la perseverancia tuvo un gran logro el de obtener el permiso para que pueda vender en el cafetería de dicho centro educativo. Ahora lo único que ella realiza es ofrecer buenos productos y a un precio cómodo. Este es su primer crédito con MFP,  por lo que ella se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de nuevos productos para su cafetín.
texts.en:
Yasmín is 30 years old and lives with Edwin who is 36.  The couple have one daughter, Yong su Marian, who is 2 years old.  The family live in their own home in the town of Canayre, in Llochegua district.  Yasmín sells sweet treats from a snack bar which is located in the school in her town.  At first, she didn't know anything but, thanks to some training from her parents, she learned how to make use of the gift that she has for selling things.  For this reason, she has satisfied customers.  However, her life hasn't only contained joy.  She experienced some difficult times when she didn't have any customers.  She used to have a small cart from which she sold the few products she had.  However, thanks to her effort and perseverance, Yasmín was able to obtain permission to sell in the school snack bar.  This was a great achievement.  Now she sells good products at an affordable price.

This is Yasmín's first loan from MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time.  She will invest the 1,000 Peruvian soles that she has requested in buying new products for her snack bar.

loans.use: to buy products and sweet treats

loans.name: Yumjir

texts.en:
Yumjir is 31 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger, a Mongolian yurt in the Hovd province of Mongolia. 

He manages a taxi service business in his town. He started his business in 2008 and has gained much experience. 

He is a polite man who is planning to have plot of land in the future. 

He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts to repair his taxi.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Uuganbayr

texts.en:
Uuganbayr is 26 years old and lives with his wife and infant child in a ger, a Mongolian yurt in the Hovd province of Mongolia. 

He manages a taxi service business in his town. He started his business in 2010 with his truck. He used to operate a car wash service before. At that time he learned to conduct a business operation and gained much experience. 

He is planning to have an auto part selling business soon. His wife will take charge of that business. He is a polite man who is planning to expand his business. He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts for his new business.

loans.use: To purchase auto parts.

loans.name: Yhony

texts.es: Yhony de 34 años de edad, es soltero, él vive en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Desde su juventud, Yhony quería tener un negocio grande, pero no como sus padres los llevaba, sino de una manera más responsable y eficaz, desde luego que emprendió en su actividad agrícola, específicamente en la producción y comercialización de cacao. En el presente produce en cantidades considerables y sus compradores potenciales se sienten satisfechos por la buena producción cacao. Es por ello que trata de mejorar la calidad de sus productos aplicando nuevas técnicas de injerto para sus plantaciones de cacao, y venderlo a un precio competitivo. Por lo general sus ventas los realiza en los centros de acopio de su misma comunidad, y eso le genera buenas ganancias económicas, aunque no se siente satisfecho con lo que ha alcanzado, por ello anhela comprar más lotes de terreno, con la finalidad de extender sus cultivos de cacao y así obtener una mayor producción. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP por lo que Yhony se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1.500 soles que solicita, Yhony comprará más plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Yhony is 34 years old and single.  He lives in his own home located in the town of Canayre in the Llochegua district.  

Since his youth, Yhony wanted to have a large store, but that was not his parents raised him.  In a more responsible and effective manner, he later began to farm, specifically producing and selling cacao.  Currently, he produces a considerable amount, and his potential buyers feel satisfied by the good production he has.  Therefore, he wants to improve the quality of his products by using new grafting techniques on his cacao crop and then selling it at a competitive price.  In general, he sells his crop at the collection centers in his community, and they are generating him a good income.  However, he does not feel satisfied with everything he has achieved, so he wants to purchase more land so that he can plant more cacao plants and have a larger harvest.

This is his second loan with MFP, and Yhony promises to be on time with his payments.  With the 1500 nuevos soles he requested, Yhony will purchase more cacao plants.

loans.use: to purchase more cacao plants.

loans.name: Gabina Cristina

texts.es: a señora Gabina se dedica a la venta de golosinas. trabaja desde hace 2 años empezó vendiendo en la calle como ambulante y ahora tiene su triciclo propio.Ella es madre soltera, tiene una hija la cual que esta e edad escolar, eligió este tipo de trabajo por que le generaba buenos ingresos, los desafios que enfrenta es el transporte para su casa,y tener que dejar a su hija al cuidado de otras personas, gabina como muchas personas tiene muchos sueños uno de ellos es poner su propia bodega en casa y asi dejar de salir a la calle, gabina  es una persona muy luchadora y trabajadora, trabaja  en las fuera de un colegio desde las 9 de la mañana y luego se translada a las afueras de una empresa de transporte, en la cual se queda hasta altas horas de la noche, el préstamo es para comprar mucha mas mercaderia para su triciclo, como golocinas gaseosa chocolates entre otros y poner una pequeña tiendita en casa, gabina esta muy agradecida con la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Gabina works selling sweets.  She has done this work for two years.  She started selling in the street as a traveling vendor, and now has her own stand.  She is a single mother of a school-aged daughter.  She chose this type of work because it generates a good income.  The challenges she faces are transportation from her home and having to leave her daughter in the care of other people.

Gabina, like many people, has many dreams.  One of them is to have her own store in her home so that she can stop going out to the street.  Gabina is a fighter and a hardworking person.  She works outside of a high school from 9:00am and later moves outside a transport company, where she stays until late at night.

This loan is to purchase more merchandise for her cart, like candy, soft drinks, chocolates, and more, and also to put a small store in her home.  Gabina is very thankful for the confidence that is being given to her.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like chocolates, soft drinks, and cookies and to install a small store in her home.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: el señor Miguel es casado y tiene 2 hijos que estan en edad escolar,viven en casa propia, miguel se dedica a la actividad de construccion civil, viene realizando esta labor desde hace 5 años con mucho esfuerso y dedicacion llego a ser maestro de contruccion, su esposa se dedica a las labores de hogar, ademas de vender ropa en su casa  y con ello le ayuda a sus esposo con los gastos familiares, el dinero del prestamo sera invertido en comprar tablas y algunas herramientas esenciales para su trabajo, miguel como mucho hombres tiene muchos sueños uno de ellos es ponerle una tienda de ropa a su esposa para que esi le genere mejores ingresos y con ello mejorar su calidad de vida, miguel esta muy contento con el apoyo que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Miguel is married and has two school age children.  They live in their own house.  Miguel works in civil construction.  He has been doing this work for five years.  With a lot of effort and dedication he came to be a master builder.  His wife devotes herself to the household chores.  She also sells clothes at their house.  Through this business she helps her husband with the family expenses.

The money from the loan will be used to buy boards and some tools that are essential to his work.  Miguel, like many men, has a lot of dreams.  One of them is to establish a clothing store for his wife.  This will generate improved earnings, which will improve their quality of life.  Miguel is very happy with the help that is being provided.

loans.use: to buy boards and other tools that are essential for his work.

loans.name: Hernan Luis

texts.es: El señor Hernan es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres, hernan tiene un taller de soldura en las afueras de su casa, hernan se dedica a hacer puertas y ventanas andamios entre otras cosas, con su trabajo hernan ayuda en los gastos familiares, el dinero que esta solicitando es para comprar fierros, llaves entre otras herramientas que son esenciales para su trabajo, hernan como muchos jovenes tiene sueños uno de ello es formar su familia y hacer crecer mas su negocio,y asi mejorar su calidad de vida, hernan esta muy agradecido con la confianza que se le esta brindado
texts.en:
Hernan is single, and he lives in his parents’ house.  Hernan has a soldering shop outside of his house.  Hernan makes doors and window scaffolding, among other things.  With his work Hernan helps with the family expenses.

The money that he is requesting is to buy iron and wrenches, among other tools that are essential to his work.

Hernan, like many young men, has dreams.  One of them is to start his family and to make his business grow more.  This way he will improve his quality of life.  Hernan is very grateful for the trust placed in him.

loans.use: to buy iron and wrenches, among other tools that are essential to his work.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: El señor Edgar es casado y vive en casa propia, tienen 2 hijos menores de 4 y 1 año de edad ,edgar  tiene una bodega pequeña donde vende al por menor ,productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, gaseosas,golosinas,entre otros, durante mas de 2 años, edgar también tiene otros ingresos, trabaja por la mañana en el fundo San Judas Tadeo como obrero de campo viene realizando esta labor hace mas de 3 años, el dinero que esta solicitando es para compra mas mercadería para su negocio, como arroz azúcar leche fideos entre otros, edgar  tiene muchos sueños uno de ello es hacer crecer mas su negocio y convertirse en un tiempo no muy lejano  en un comerciante mayorista,  y asi mejorar su calidad de vida  edgar esta muy contento con la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Edgar is married and lives in his own house.  They have two minor children, ages four and one.  Edgar has a small grocery store where sells basic needs products like rice, sugar, milk, noodles, soft drinks, and sweets, among others.  He sells for retail, and he has been doing this for over two years.

Edgar also has other income.  In the morning he works for the Fundo San Judas Tadeo as a field worker.  He has been doing this work for over three years.

The money he is requesting is to buy more merchandise for his business.  He will buy things like rice, sugar, milk, and noodles, among others.

Edgar has many dreams.  One of them is to make his business grow more.  He dreams of becoming, in the not so distant future, a wholesale merchant.  This way he will improve his quality of life.  Edgar is very happy with the trust that has been placed in him.

loans.use: to buy products like sugar, milk, rice, and noodles, among others, for his small grocery store.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
This is Geraldine, 32, a  resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Demetrio, a security guard, and she is the mother of three children. 

At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support her children’s schooling. She believes that a college diploma, a dream for most poor Filipino parents like Geraldine, is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Geraldine operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Geraldine earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Geraldine dreams of giving all her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
This is Encarnacion, 42, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Florante, a businessman, and she is the mother of their children. Together they work hard for a safe and secure future for their family.

Encarnacion operates a meat business. She buys live pigs, cows and chickens directly from hog raisers, livestock and poultry dealers, slaughters them, and then delivers them to the fast food chains. She has several fast food chain company patrons who buy the cut meat. They prefer Encarnacion’s products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. It is also a little cheaper to buy meat from an independent meat dealer than the ones in the market who sometimes use the services of professional slaughter houses for their meat. The cost of slaughter is added to the final price of the cut meat and passed along to the customers. Thus, Encarnacion has many patrons who regularly anticipate her meat. Her regular customers are Chowking and Teriyaki Boy. She earns a minimum of PHP 933 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000. She will be using the loan to buy meat and chicken to be delivered to fast food chains. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Encarnacion hopes that her business will continue to be successful, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day and be finished with their studies. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for meat and chicken for her business.

loans.name: Brisa Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Brisa, se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Tlayecac, en el estado de Morelos, Mexico, esta conformado por las señoras Teresa de Jesus, Margarita, Demetria Cristina van a comprar con su prestamo perfumes, desodorantes, cremas, etc. la señora Luisa va a comprr telas, hilos para coser, la señora Gabriela Joaquina va a comprar genetina y vasos, la señora Maria de Jesus va a compar Toperware por mayoreo, la señora Maria Elena va a comprar zapatos por mayoreo, la señora Elizabeth va a comprar, chicharron, mieles para vender raspados,el señor Salvador Wilbert va a comprar chivos y alimento para crealos y venderlos,la señora Estela va a comprar colchas y sabanas. La señora Gabriela Joaquina tiene 46 años de edad ella es casada su esposo trabaja en el campo, ella tiene 1 hijo se llama Wilbert de 26 años de edad, ella vende gelatinas en Jaloxtoc se hace como 10 minutos de Tlayecac, utiliza el transporte colectivo para llegar al pueblo donde vende las gelatinas, su hermana le ayuda a vender las gelatinas ella lleva la vitrina con las gelatinas porque la operaron y no puede cargar pesado. Ella solicito su prestamo para comprar materia prima e insumos para elaborar las gelatinas va a comparar grenetina, esencias, vasos, lehe, una vitrina y un triciclo, ella inicio su negocio hace 17 años por necesidades economicas y su hijo estaba pequeño. su tio le enseño a preparar las gelatinas y su esposo le dio para compar la materia prima, ella inicio de poquito en poquito y ha crecido ya vende mas gelatinas ya la conocen sus clientes por su buen sabor. Su negocio es importante porque le gusta elaborar las gelatinas y salir a venderlas y sobretodo le ha ayudado a solventar los gastos de la familia, ella se siente orgullosa de tener su propio negocio, y pudo darle educacion a su hijo,su negocio enfrenta los desafios de costos elevados y el clima en tiempos de calor se ve mas apresurada la venta porque corre el peligro de descongelarse las gelatinas, las ganancias las distribuye una parte para la comida, para volver a invertir en la materia prima, para la luz, para el gas, sus sueños y esperanzas son mejorar el negocio, que toda la familia este bien de salud y ponerle techo de loza a su casa, ella esta muy conntent con este prestamo le va a ayudar a comprar la materia prima para seguir en la venta de gelatinas. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundacion Realidad "les damos las gracias por sus prestamos, gracias por preocuparse por las personas de pocos recursos economicos, para solventar sus necesidades y hacer crecer nuestros negocios". Tlayecac es un pueblo bonito, hay campo siembran sorgo, maiz, se ven los cerros y pueden crear animales para vender como chivos, borregos, vacas. Falta en la foto la señora Teresa de Jesus
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called Brisa ("Breeze").  It is located in the Tlayecac community in the state of Morelos in Mexico.  The group is made up of the following ladies: Teresa de Jesus; Margarita; Demetria Cristina who will use her loan to buy perfumes, deodorants, creams, etc; Señora Luisa who will buy fabrics and sewing thread; Señora Gabriela Joaquina who will buy gelatin and cups; Señora Maria de Jesus who will buy Tupperware at wholesale; Señora Maria Elena who is going to buy shoes at wholesale; Señora Elizabeth who will buy pork and honey to sell pork scratchings; Señor Salvador Wilbert who will buy goats and food to raise and sell them; Señora Estela who is going to buy blankets and sheets. 

Señora Gabriela Joaquina is 46 years old and is married.  Her husband works in the fields and she has a son named Wilbert who is 26.  She sells jellies in Jaloxtoc, which is about 10 minutes from Tlayecac.  She uses public transport to reach the village where she sells the jellies, her sister helps her sell them.  She uses a carrying case for the jellies because she has had surgery and cannot carry anything heavy. She is applying for the loan to buy raw materials and ingredients to produce the jellies; she will buy essences, cups, milk, a carrying case and a tricycle.  She started her business 17 years ago to meet her financial needs and her son was young.  Her uncle taught her how to make the jellies and her husband gave money to buy the raw ingredients.  She started little by little and has grown and sold more jellies, she is well-known by her customers for her good taste. 

Her business is important because she likes to make jellies and go out to sell them, and above all, it has helped defray the family expenses.  She is proud of having her own business, and to be able to provide education for her child.  Her business faces the challenges of high costs and hot weather.  In hot weather, she has to make the sales more hastily because of the risk of the jellies melting.  She applies part of her profits for food, part for reinvesting in the ingredients, and part for electricity and gas.  Her hopes and dreams are to grow her business, so that the whole family can be in good health and she can put a roofing slab on her home.  She is very happy that this loan will help her to buy the raw materials to keep on selling jellies. 

The group members want to tell Kiva and Fundacion Realidad  that "the ladies thank you for your loans, and thank you for caring for people with low incomes so that we can meet our needs and grow our businesses." 

Tlayecac is a pretty village.  There are fields where sorghum and corn are grown, there are hills, and one can raise animals for sale like goats, sheep, and cows. 

Señora Teresa de Jesus is missing from the picture.

loans.use: to buy gelatin, essences, cups, milk, carrying case and tricycle for making and selling jellies.

loans.name: Mu´ssha Group

texts.es:
La señora Aurelia es originaria de la localidad de Francisco Serrato ubicado en el estado de Michoacán,  una localidad rica en pinos y con una hermosa vista a sus bosques, ahí predomina el lenguaje y la vestimenta mazahua. Doña Aurelia comenta que ella es artesana se dedica a hacer accesorios para dama como pulseras de madera, aretes de madera, pulseras de hilo, vestidos, morrales de lana y bordados. Ella vende sus accesorios en el jardín de Zitacuaro Michoacán y también las ofrece en las calles y también elabora piezas de ocochal como canastitas, platos, canastas grandes, tortilleras etc. Ella dice que tiene 4 años con esta actividad y que le gusta mucho realizar estas artesanías, ya que son accesorios que sus antepasados usaban, dice que hace 10 años su mama le enseño a  hacer esas artesanías, Doña Aurelia es viuda. Comenta que el préstamo le beneficiara ya que podrá comprar otro tipo de accesorios para dama y tendrá mas surtido su puesto. La meta que tiene la señora Aurelia es comprar blusas para la temporada de calor para damas.
Los otros integrantes del grupo se llaman Venancio, Josefa, Elpidio y Maria Eduviges ellos están pidiendo sus créditos para invertirlos en la compra carpintería, abarrotes y elaboración de prendas artesanales.
texts.en:
Aurelia is originally from the community of Francisco Serrato, located in the state of Michoacan. It is a locality that is rich in pine trees and it has a beautiful view of its forests. Here, the Mazahua language and clothing are predominant. Aurelia says that she is an artisan who produces ladies' accessories, such as wooden bracelets, wooden earrings, weaved bracelets, dresses, wool hand bags, and embroidery. she sells her accessories in the Zitacuaro Michoacan gardens and she also sells them along the streets. She also makes straw articles such as baskets, plates, large baskets, tortilla baskets, etc. She says that she has been in business for 4 years and she loves making these crafts. These are articles that her ancestors used. She says that 10 years ago her mother showed her how to make these crafts. Aurelia is a widow. She says that the loan will help her because she will be able to purchase other types of ladies' accessories to add more variety to her stand. Aurelia's goal is to purchase ladies' summer blouses. 

The other members of the group are Venancio, Josefa, Elpidio, and Maria Eduviges. They request a loan to invest in the purchase of wood, groceries, and to help in the crafting of traditional garments.

loans.use: to craft traditional garments for sale.

loans.name: El Manantial De Donaciano Group

texts.es:
La señora Juana ella es originaria de la localidad de Donaciano Ojeda y se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías de ocoshal, ella hace lo que so paneras, tortilleras, fruteros, aretes, hueveras, jarrones, floreros etc. Tiene con esta actividad aproximadamente 5 años, comenta que empezó a realizar este trabajo para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar ya que su esposo o puede trabajar debido a que tiene una hernia y trabajan ambos en su casa haciendo artesanías y cuidando a sus hijos. Comenta que vende sus artesanías en Cd. Hidalgo Michoacán, Tuxpan Michoacán y Toluca  estado de México. Doña Juana esta pidiendo un préstamo para la compra de ocoshal, agujas, hilo, cloro y detergente para lavar el ocoshal. La señora Juana esta casada con el señor Tomas el cual es artesano y jornalero ellos tuvieron 9 hijos pero nada mas viven con ellos 7 de nombres Miguel de 16 años el no estudia ya que les ayuda a sus papas con los gastos de la casa y con la educación de sus hermanos pequeños, después sigue Alma de 11 años, Rafael de 9 años, Eduardo de 7 años ellos tres estudiantes de primaria, luego sigue Tomas de 5 años y Cristal de 4 años. Doña Juana comenta dice que desgraciadamente no puede salir a cuidades lejanas a vender sus artesanías  ya que las vende a muy bajo costo y no le conviene ir tan lejos porque no le alcanza para los gastos y es una de las problemáticas que tiene con su actividad, comenta que el préstamo les ayudara de mucho ya que comprara mas insumos para elaborar las artesanías.
Los otros integrantes del grupo se llaman Gregorio, Maria Crisanta y Efrén ellos están pidiendo sus créditos para invertirlos en la producción de tabique de concreto y insumos para el cultivo de aguacate.
texts.en:
Señora Juana is originally from the village of Donaciano Ojeda. She makes her living making artisanal crafts from ocoshal [pine needles]. She makes things like bread boxes, tortilla holders, fruit baskets, earrings, egg baskets, vases, flower baskets, etc. She has been at this for approximately five years. She says that she started to do this work to help her husband with the household costs because he can no longer work due to the fact that he has a hernia. They both work in their home making crafts and caring for their children.

She says that she sells her crafts in Ciudad Hidalgo, Michoacán; Tuxpan, Michoacán; and Toluca, Estado de México. Doña Juana is requesting a loan for the purchase of ocoshal, needles, thread, bleach and detergent to wash the ocoshal. Señora Juana is married to Señor Tomas who is an artisan and farmworker. They have nine children but just seven of them live with them. Miguel is 16 years old and he no longer studies as he now helps his parents with the household costs and his younger siblings’ education. Then there is Alma who is 11 years old, Rafael who is 9 years old and 7-year-old Eduardo, all of whom are primary school students. Finally, Tomas is 5 years old and Cristal is 4 years old.

Doña Juana says that unfortunately she cannot go to cities that are far away to sell her crafts because she sells them at a low price making it unprofitable. She does not have enough money for the expense. This is one of the issues she has in the business. She says that the loan will help them a lot as they will buy more supplies to make the crafts.

The other members of the group are Gregorio, Maria Crisanta and Efrén. They are requesting loans to invest in the building of a concrete partition and supplies for avocado cultivation

loans.use: to make pieces from ocoshal [pine needles].

loans.name: Las Nenas Group

texts.es:
La señora Minerva es parte del grupo Las Nenas, ella se dedica a la compra y venta D. ropa usada y electrodomésticos D. segunda mano y por las noches tiene un puesto D. tacos D. carne al vapor y al pastor y bistec. Ella tiene con ese negocio desD. hace 2 años y dice que emprendió ese negocio para tener su propio negocio y su propio capital, dice que surte sus ropa en diferentes negocios y en Toluca ya que se las venden por pacas y venD. en un tianguis D. su colonia D. los días jueves a domingo, y por la noche le ayuda a su esposo a vender en su taqueria. Ella esta muy contenta por el préstamo por que así surtirá mejor su negocio D. ropa. La meta que tiene es ahorrar para comprar ropa nueva y poner una boutique en su colonia.
Las otras integrantes del grupo se llaman Virginia, Kati, Catalina, Alma, Rosalía, Rosa, Lizbeth, Yolanda, Gloria ellas usaran sus créditos para invertirlos en sus negocios D. zapatería, repostería, abarrotes, tienda D. ropa, paletería y venta D. cosméticos por catalogo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Minerva is part of the group Las Nenas, she sells used clothing, second hand electrical appliances, and by night she has a taco stand where she sells beef and steak tacos and tacos al pastor (traditional pork tacos).   

She has been doing this for over 2 years and says that she started this business to have her own business and capital.  She says that she takes her clothes to different businesses in Toluca because they sell bales in the local market Thursday-Sunday.  By night she helps her husband sell in his taco shop. 

She is very happy about the loan because she will be able to better supply her clothing business.  Her goal is to save to buy new clothing and put a boutique in her neighborhood. 

The other members of the group are: Virginia, Kati, Catalina, Alma, Rosalía, Rosa, Lizbeth, Yolanda, Gloria.  They are using their loans to invest in their businesses which incluD. a shoe store, bakery, grocery store, clothing store, a paletería (Latin American Ice Pop Shop) and a cosmetics shop by catalog.

loans.use: to sell used clothing, electrical appliances, and Mexican food.

loans.name: Amistad Y Union Group

texts.es: La señora Violeta es parte del grupo Unión y Amistad comenta que le pusieron así al grupo por que todos son amigos y están muy unidos. Ella se dedica a la compra, cría y venta de puercos desde hace 8 años y dice que el negocio no lo tenían planeado ya que empezó comprar para uso de ellos para las fiestas que hacían en su familia y que ya después la gente cuando quería hacer alguna fiesta iban y se los compraban a ellos. Doña Violeta esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de alimento, vacunas, desparacitantes, vitaminas para que los puercos crezcan rápido y pueda venderlos pronto y a un buen precio. Ella vende sus animales en su localidad y los compra ahí mismo y otros son crías de las cerdas que tiene. Una de las problemáticas que tiene Violeta por la cual no puede crecer mas su negocio es que su hijo el menor sufre una enfermedad llamada epilepsia y dice que gasta mucho en llevarlo a l medico. Ella tiene otros tres hijos mas uno estudiante de 3 de primaria y una niña de 7 años la cual estudia segundo de primaria, una niña de 4 años y su menor de 2 años. Doña Violeta día a día le hecha ganas para salir adelante con sus hijos, ya que desde muy temprana hora también vende frutas y legumbres en la central de abastos. La meta que tiene para el negocio es hacer una granja en su casa y seguir comprando más puercos para venderlos por mayoreo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Violeta is part of the group Unión y Amistad and says that they put this group together because they are all friends and very close.  She has purchased, bread and sold pigs for 8 years.  She says that they did not plan on having this business but she started to buy them to use for family parties and since then when people wanted to have a party they would purchase the animals for them.

Violeta is requesting a loan to buy feed, vaccines, anti-parasite medication, and vitamins so that the pigs can grow quickly and she can sell them quickly and at a good price.

She sells her animals in town and buys them there as well and others are bread from the pigs that she has.  One of the reasons why Violeta cannot grow her business is that her youngest child suffers from epilepsy.  She says that she spends a lot to bring in a doctor.  She has 3 other children, one is a 3rd grader, a 7-year-old daughter in primary school, a 4-year-old daughter and her youngest is 2-years-old. 

Everyday Violeta makes progress in advancing her children, since she gets up at a very early hour to sell fruits and vegetables in the central market.  Her goal is to make a farm business at home and keep buying more pigs to sell wholesale.

loans.use: to breed and sell pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To hand embroider and sell footwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell shoes, clothes and blankets from catalogs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy underwear and costume jewelry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make orders for shoes she sells via catalog.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for making tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell hand-crafted embroidery and shoes from a catalog.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her business selling cosmetics and growing guava

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a new business selling costume jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell quilts from a catalog.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Esperanza es viuda y es una mujer trabajadora  ya que pese a su edad ella tiene su puesto de antojitos mexicanos desde hace 35 años y también se dedica ala venta de aguacates, en la central de abastos ya que tiene una huerta y cuando es temporada de este fruto sale a venderlos desde muy temprana hora. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de carne, verdura, ingredientes para hacer los antojitos y un comal ya que ella quiere cambiar el que tiene por que ya se le rompió. Ella vende afuera de su casa los antojitos como pambazos, quesadillas, tacos, enchiladas etc. y vende de martes a sábado por la tarde. La meta que tiene es poner una cenaduría donde sus clientes estén a gusto cuando vallan a cenar.
texts.en: Esperanza is a widow and a hard-working woman, since in spite of her age she continues to run her Mexican food stand, which she has operated for 35 years. She also works selling avocados at the farmers' market, since she has an avocado grove, and when this fruit is in season, she goes out to sell them starting very early in the morning. She is requesting a loan to buy meat, vegetables and other ingredients to make her Mexican foods, as well as a tortilla grill, since her previous one broke and she wants to replace it. She sells foods outside of her house such as pambazos [sandwiches], quesadillas, tacos, enchiladas, etc., from Tuesdays through Saturdays in the evening. Her goal is to set up a restaurant where her customers will be comfortable when they go out to eat.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food stand.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Don Antonio tiene un estudio fotográfico en el centro de su pueblo, desde hace 30 años tiene ese negocio y dice que el lo decidió emprender por que le apasiona la fotografía. El  se enseño a sacar fotografías a través de un curso que tomo por correspondencia y decidió abrir su local para poder tener ganancias. El señor Antonio comenta que esta pidiendo un préstamo para invertir en su estudio fotográfico, el comprara rollos para cámara, cámaras digitales, marcos, revelados, accesorios para las cámaras etc. comenta que cada mes el ahorra de las ganancias que obtiene para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, el va a surtir su material en diferentes tiendas de la cuidad de México. 

Don Antonio esta casado con la señora Isalia la cual le ayuda en el estudio fotográfico ya que el le ha enseñado a sacar fotografías y ha rebelar rollos. La meta de Antonio es hacer un poco mas grande su local para así poder surtir un poco mas de artículos para vender en su local y además le gustaría tener un local propio ya que donde tiene su negocio es rentado. El esta muy contento por lo que la financiera esta haciendo ya que a través de este préstamo el podrá crecer poco a poco con su negocio y lo tendrá mejor surtido para dar un mejor servicio a la población.
texts.en:
Antonio has a photography studio in the center of town.  He has owned this business for 30 years and says that he decided to start the business because he is passionate about photography.  He taught himself to take photos via a correspondence course and decided to open his premises in order to make money.  Antonio tells us that he is requesting a loan to invest in his photography studio.  He will buy rolls of film, digital cameras, frames, products for developing photos, camera accessories, etc.  He says that every month he saves money from his profits so that he can continue investing in his business.  He supplies his material to different stores in Mexico City.

Antonio is married to Isalia who helps him in his photography studio since he has taught her how to take photos and develop film.  Antonio's goal is to make his premises a little larger so that he can stock up with a few more products to sell.  He would also like to own his own premises since the premises where his business is currently located are rented.  Antonio is very happy with what our financial institution is doing since, through this loan, he will be able to gradually grow his business and better stock it so that he can provide a better service to his customers.

loans.use: to stock his photography studio.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora esta casada con el señor Javier el cual es empleado en un aserradero en su localidad, ellos tiene 3 hijos que dependen de ellos los cuales el mayor estudia la secundaria, luego sigue una niña de 8 años la cual estudia la primaria y una pequeña de un año. Gaby como es conocida en su localidad tiene una tienda de abarrotes y también vende dulces y refrescos de diferentes sabores, ella esta pidiendo un préstamo a la financiera para seguir invirtiendo sus abarrotes ella comprara chiles enlatados, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, café, focos, veladoras, papel higiénico etc. comenta Gabriela que tiene 11 años aproximadamente con su negocio, cada ocho días va a la población de Zitacuaro a surtir sus productos a diferentes tiendas donde le den buen precio para poderle subir un poco mas ella y tener algo de ganancias a los productos que vende, ella esta muy contenta con lo que vende ya que de ahí le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos que tiene con sus hijos. El sueño de doña Gabriela es hacer un local especial para sus productos ya que los tiene en su cocina y ahí les vende a sus vecinos. Esta agradecida con la financiera por este préstamo ya que poco a poco puede crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a hard-working and enterprising woman.  She is married to Señor Javier who is employed in a sawmill in their town.  They have 3 children that are dependent on them.  The oldest is a high school student followed by a daughter who is 8 and attends elementary school, and a one year old baby.  Gaby, as she is known in her town, has a grocery store.  She also sells candy and different flavored soft drinks.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase groceries.  She will buy canned chilies, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, light bulbs, candles, toilet paper, etc.  Gariela says that she has been running this business for approximately 11 years.  Every 8 days she goes to the town of Zitacuaro to stock up on products at different stores.  She goes where they offer the best prices so she can save some money and also earn something from the products she sells.  She is very happy with what she sells since it helps her husband with the children's expenses.  Doña Gabriela's dream is to have a special place for her products as they are in her kitchen and she sells to her neighbors from there.  She is grateful to the finance company for this loan as it will help her to gradually grow her business.

loans.use: purchase canned chilies, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, light bulbs, candles, toilet paper, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: Doña María de Jesús es viuda y tiene una hija de nombre Maria la cual estudia la preparatoria de su localidad llamada Melchor Ocampo, ella tiene un negocio de antojitos mexicanos y vende jugos y licuados, ella vende quesadillas, sopes, pambazos, tacos dorados y vende jugos de naranja, zanahoria, betabel, apio, toronja y licuados de plátano, papaya, fresa, chocolate y mas. Ella tiene con este negocio aproximadamente 25 años ya que muy joven enviudo y tubo que sacar adelante a sus hijos. Doña Jesús esta pidiendo un préstamo a la financiera para la compra de frutas, legumbres, carnes y gas para la elaboración de sus alimentos que vende de lunes a viernes en un local que renta cerca del centro de su localidad. Ella cada 8 días se surte en la central de abastos de la población de Zitacuaro, Doña Jesús dice que el sueño que ella tiene es tener un local propio donde no gaste en renta, ella esta agradecida con la Fundación por el crédito que le están otorgando por que así su negocio crece y da buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Doña María de Jesús is a widow.  She has a daughter named Maria who attends a high school in their town called Melchor Ocampo.  She has a business selling Mexican snacks, juices and smoothies.  She sells quesadillas, soups, pambazos [Mexican white bread filled with potatoes and chorizo and dipped in guajillo sauce], and fried tacos as well as orange, carrot, beet, celery and grapefruit juice and banana, papaya, strawberry and chocolate smoothies.   She has been running this business for approximately 25 years as she was widowed when she was very young and had to provide for her children.  

Doña Jesús is requesting a loan to purchase fruits, vegetables, meats and gas to prepare her foods.  She sells Monday through Friday in a rented space near the center of town.  Every 8 days she stocks up at the supply center in the town of Zitacuaro.  Doña Jesús says that her dream is to have her own local where she doesn't have to pay rent.  She is grateful to Fundación for the loan that they are giving her because it will help to grow her business and increase her earnings.

loans.use: purchase food supplies to make her traditional snacks, juices and smoothies.

loans.name: Ma Consuelo

texts.es: Doña Consuelo esta casada con el señor Víctor Manuel el cual es panadero, ellos tuvieron 6 hijos pero nada mas dos viven con ella los cuales no estudian pero le ayudan hacer el pan. Comenta doña Consuelo que ella se dedica a vender pan a diario se levantan desde muy temprana hora a las tres de la mañana para amasar, elaborar los panes y después meterlos al horno para que se cosan. Ella tiene con esta actividad desde hace 6 años elabora pan de rancho y conchas, dice que su esposo fue que le enseño hacerlo ya que la familia de el fue son panaderos de tradición ya que sus antepasados empezaron con ese negocio. Doña Consuelo esta pidiendo un crédito para dar un anticipo de un vehiculo para poder distribuir su producto mas fácilmente ya que ahorita en temporada de lluvias se le dificulta la entrega y a través del vehiculo se le facilitara. Ella entrega pan en las tiendas de su localidad, comenta que cada 15 días compra los insumos para realizar el pan en la ciudad de Toluca estado de México ya que ahí le dan buenos precios. La meta que tiene doña consuelo es poner una panadería en su localidad.
texts.en:
Doña Consuelo is married to Señor Víctor Manuel, who is a baker.  They have 6 children but no more than two live with them.  They are not in school, but they help with baking the bread. 

Doña Consuelo says that she works selling bread on a daily basis.  She gets up at a very early hour, at three o'clock in the morning, to knead and prepare the bread and then puts it in the oven to be baked.  She has been doing this activity for 6 years and makes rolls and biscuits.  She says it was her husband who taught her to do this because he comes from a family with a tradition of being bakers, as their ancestors began in that business. 

Consuelo is requesting a loan to pay an advance on a vehicle to be able to distribute her products more easily.  Right now, in the rainy season, deliveries become difficult and the vehicle will make it easier. She delivers bread to her local stores, and says that every two weeks she buys the ingredients for baking in the city of Toluca, in Mexico state, as they have good prices there.  

Doña Consuelo's goal is to have a bakery store in her area.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to bake bread for sale.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: El señor Jaime es originario de la localidad de Melchor Ocampo, el esta casado con la señora Maria de la Luz, ellos tienen 3 hijos un joven de 17 años estudiante de primaria, una jovencita de 13 años estudiante de secundaria y una niña de 9 años estudiante de primaria. Don Jaime tiene un puesto de tacos en su localidad cerca del centro de su población, el vende tacos de bistec y tacos de cabeza al vapor, también vende consomés y refrescos, el tiene 20 años con su negocio y surte la carne y las verduras en la población de Angangueo ya que ahí le dan mas barata la carne. Jaime comenta que el esta muy contento por el préstamo que le están haciendo ya que así podrá comprar un poco mas de carne para la elaboración de tacos. La meta que tiene el señor Jaime es mas adelante poner un puesto de venta de pollos al carbón en su localidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Jaime is originally from the Melchor Ocampo neighborhood.  He is married to María de la Luz and they have 3 young children who are primary school students.  They have a 17 year-old in school, one young 13 year-old girl in secondary school and a 9-year-old girl in primary school. 

Jaime has a taco stand in his neighborhood near the center of the town.  He sells steak tacos, tacos de cabeza al vapor (traditional steamed tacos), consomés (clear soup) and sodas.  He has been in this business for 20 years and he gets his meat and vegetables from Angangueo since there they sell cheaper meat.

Jaime says that he is very happy to receive the loan because he will be able to buy a little more meat to make his tacos.  

Jaime's goal is to move forward and put a post for the sale of grilled chicken in his neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy meat for his taco stand.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith es originaria de la localidad de Melchor Ocampo, tiene 30 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Daniel el cual es militar del ejército Mexicano y  todavía no tienen hijos. Ella tiene un puesto de revistas en el mercado de su localidad desde hace 5 años y también esta asociada con su papa en un estudio fotográfico desde hace 8 años. Comenta que esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de revistas y periódicos nuevos para venderlas en su puesto y un poco de rollos y revelados para invertir en el negocio que tiene su papa y Edith en el centro de la localidad. Comenta que las revistas las surte en la ciudad de México los fines de semana y el periódico se lo llevan hasta su localidad y los artículos que vende en el foto estudio lo compra en México. Ella esta muy contenta con estos préstamos que adquiere ya que le va muy bien en su negocio y comenta que poco a poco esta creciendo, el sueño de Edith es hacer crecer sus dos negocios y poner una tienda de ropa en el centro de su localidad.
texts.en: Edith is originally from Melchor Ocampo. She is 30 years old and she is married with Daniel. He is in the military in the Mexican army and they still do not have children. She has had a magazine stand in her community market for the past 5 years. She has also been working with her father in a photography studio for the past 8 years. She says that she requests a loan to purchase new magazines and newspapers to sell them from her stand, as well as a few rolls of film to invest in her father's business in the city's downtown. She says that she gets her magazines from Mexico City on the weekends and the newspapers are delivered all the way to her house. The articles that she sells in her photo studio are purchased in Mexico City. She is very happy with these loans and she admits her business is doing very well. She says that gradually the business is increasing. Edith's dream is to make her two businesses grow and to set up a clothing store in her community.

loans.use: venta de revistas y estudio fotografico

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Doña Guadalupe se dedica a vender helados, paletas de diferentes sabores, congelados y sándwich de nieve desde hace 5 años, comenta que ella decidió emprender su negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y vende sus productos en el centro de su localidad en un carrito de helados. Lupita como es conocida en su localidad esta casada con el señor Franco el cual es obrero y tienen una niña de 3 meses de nacida. 

Doña Lupita esta pidiendo un préstamo a la financiera para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio de nieves, comenta que cuando en tiempo de lluvias y en invierno baja un poco la venta por el frió, y en ese tiempo ella vende corundas y elotes preparados. La  meta que tiene Guadalupe es poner una peletería estable en el centro de su pueblo.
texts.en:
Doña Guadalupe has made a living selling ice cream, different flavored popsicles, freezer pops and ice cream sandwiches for five years now. 

She says that she decided to start the business to help her husband with the household expenses. She sells her products in the center of her town from an ice cream cart. Lupita, as she is known in her town, is married to Señor Franco who is a laborer and they have a 3-month-old girl. 

Doña Lupita is requesting a loan from the financial institution to continue investing in her ice cream business. She says that during the rainy season and the winter, her sales drop a little bit due to the cold. During those periods she sells corundas [tamales] and corn on the cob. Guadalupe’s goal is to set up an ice cream shop in her town.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her ice cream cart.

loans.name: Laura Lizbeth

texts.es: Laura tiene 19 años y es una joven emprendedora y  muy trabajadora ya que ella le ayuda a su mama que es viuda con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene 10 años haciendo sus costuras y comenta que le enseño su mama hacerlas. Dice que dejo de estudiar para ayudar a su mama con los gastos del hogar  ya que no le alcanza el dinero para estudiar una carrera, pero el sueño de Laura es muy pronto entrar a una universidad para estudiar para maestra que es lo que más le llama la atención. Comenta que vende sus costuras en su localidad y que le mandan hacer servilletas para dar de recuerdo en las fiestas donde ella les borda algo alusivo a la fiesta, también otras las manda a la cuidad de México con una amiga de ella la cual le hace el favor de vendérselas y ella le da una comisión por cada costura que vende. Laura es soltera y su sueño con su negocio es rentar un local en la población de Zitacuaro para vender sus costuras.
texts.en:
Laura is 19 years old.  She is an entrepreneurial and very hard-working young woman as she helps her mom, who is a widow, with their household expenses.

Laura has been embroidering for 10 years and she tells us that her mom taught her this skill.  She says that she stopped studying in order to help her mom with the household expenses since there wasn't enough money for her to study at university.  However, Laura's dream is to enter university very soon so that she can study to become a teacher which is what appeals to her the most.  She says that she sells her products in her town and people also order napkins from her to give as gifts during fiestas.  She embroiders something that has to do with the fiesta on her products.

Laura also receives orders from Mexico City where a friend of hers sells her products for her.  Laura gives her friend a commission for every product that she sells.  Laura is single and her dream for her business is to rent premises in the town of Zitacuaro so that she can sell her products there.

loans.use: to buy supplies for embroidering items by hand

loans.name: Maria Claudia

texts.es: Doña Claudia es originaria de la localidad de Ocampo ella esta casada con  el señor Hilario el cual es jornalero y tiene 3 hijos uno en la primaria de 8 años y 2 niñas de 3 y un año de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos, ropa y cosméticos por catalogo desde hace 5 años, comenta que emprendió en su  negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, Claudia vende sus productos en diferentes localidades aledañas a su población, ella y surte sus productos en la cuidad de Zitacuaro en los distribuidores autorizados. Comenta que ella esta pidiendo un préstamo a la financiera para tener en existencia sus productos que vende, ella esta muy contenta con el préstamo que le van hacer ya que es la primara vez que trabaja con una financiera y ella promete quedar bien en sus pagos. El sueño de Claudia es rentar un local en el cual pueda tener muy bien surtido de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos y accesorios para dama.
texts.en:
Doña Claudia is originally from the town of Ocampo. She is married to Sr. Hilario, who works as a farm laborer. They have three children, an eight-year-old son in elementary school and two daughters (ages 3 and 1). Claudia has been selling shoes, clothing, and cosmetics through catalogs for five years. She says that she started her business so that she could help her husband with the household expenses. Claudia sells her products in various surrounding areas near her town. She acquires her products in the city of Zitacuaro from authorized distributors.

Claudia says she is requesting a loan so that she can have products to sell. She is very pleased with the loan since this is the first time she has worked with financing. Claudia promises to keep up with her payments. Her dream is to rent a location where she can have a large stock of clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and women’s accessories.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es: Cristian es una joven muy trabajadora para sacar adelante a su pequeña hija ella esta casada con el señor Juan Pablo el cual es obrero ellos tienen una niña de un año, Cristian se dedica a realizar pulseras, collares, aretes de fantasía y también hace accesorios para niñas como moños, diademas y las vende con sus conocidas y en su casa ya que ahí vende también dulces, refrescos y tiene unas maquinitas (juegos de video). Esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de material para realizar los accesorios para dama  y para surtir su negocio de dulces. Ella comenta que es la primera vez que se mete a un crédito y espera que le baya muy bien ya que podrá hacer crecer su negocio poco a poco. La meta que tiene para el negocio es abrir un local donde pueda vender ropa para dama y zapatos.
texts.en:
Cristian is a woman who works very hard so that her young daughter can get ahead. She is married to Sr. Juan Pablo, a laborer. Their daughter is a year old. Cristian makes bracelets, necklaces, and earrings. She also makes accessories for girls, such as bows and tiaras, and sells them to acquaintances and from her home. In addition Cristian sells candy, soft drinks, and offers video game machines.

She is requesting a loan to buy materials for making women’s accessories, but part of the money will be used to restock her candy business. Cristian says this is the first time she has received a loan and hopes that it will go well so that she can see her business grow gradually. Her goal for her business is to open a shop where she can sell women’s clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to acquire materials for making women's accessories and to buy candy to sell.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Don Guillermo es originario de la localidad de Melchor Ocampo y esta casado con la señora Margarita la cual le ayuda en la polleria, ellos tienen 2 hijas la mayor estudia la primaria y la menor tiene 8 años la cual estudia el preescolar. El se dedica a vender pollo vivo y pollo destazado (pollo cortado por piezas) por kilo. El tiene un puesto pequeño en el mercado del pueblo, tiene con ese negocio aproximadamente 20 años y comenta que sus papas fueron quienes le inculcaron desde muy pequeño el amor por el negocio, dice que primero empezaron con un negocio de venta de barbacoa y después con el de la polleria. Don Guillermo dice que surte sus pollos en la ciudad de Zitacuaro en una granja que se dedica a la venta de este animal, el esta muy contento por que le están dando este crédito que va a obtener por que gracias a este el podrá hacer crecer su negocio. La meta que tiene el señor Guillermo es poner un local donde venda pollos asados o la leña.
texts.en:
Don Guillermo is originally from the town of Melcho Ocampo. He is married to Sra. Margarita, who helps him with his poultry business. Guillermo has two daughters in elementary school and another one who is in pre-school. He sells both live and butchered (in pieces) chickens by the kilo. Guillermo has a small stand at the town market where he has been in business for approximately 20 years. He says that his parents instilled in him a love for this business at a very young age. At first, he started out selling barbecue and later switched to selling chickens. Don Guillermo says that he acquires his chickens in the city of Zitacuaro from a farm that sells this type of animal.

He is very pleased with this loan because it will help him grow his business. Guillermo’s goal is to have a shop where he can sell either roasted chickens or firewood.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 35-year-old married father of four children. He is a dairy farmer, and also runs a motorbike business in Mariakani. His business has been in operation for the last eight years and has been a success. 

This is his third loan from KADET to finance his business. With this loan he plans to add a dairy cow to his herd. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay back the loan and to gradually expand his business. 

His dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: to add a dairy cow to his herd

loans.name: Winstone

texts.en:
Winstone, a 37-year-old, has been operating a retail shop for the last three years. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he has learned how to save, and to manage his business well. 

Previously, he was employed by a telecommunications firm. In the next five years, he hopes to expand his business into wholesale. 

He wants a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar, wheat flour, etc.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
For the last one year and four months, George, a 33-year-old single man, has been selling hot coffee. By attending Faulu Kenya seminars, he has been able to learn business management skills and how to maintain good customer relations. 

In the next five years, he hopes to open up a cafeteria and start selling a variety of drinks so that he is able to make enough money to buy a piece of land. 

He wants a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more coffee and to employ one person.

loans.use: To buy coffee and employ one person

loans.name: Jesse

texts.en:
Jesse has been selling boiled eggs for the last three years. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he has been able to learn how to manage both his business and finances. Jesse is a hard-working, aggressive, and focused 26-year-old. He is married and blessed with one child. In the next five years, he hopes to have a better business premises. 

He needs a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy eggs at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy eggs

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
This is Josefa, 48, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Elpidio, a taxi driver, and mother to their child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to save for her child's future. 

Josefa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five peso's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Josefa makes money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Josefa hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to save money for the future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery products and inventory items for her variety store.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru: Инобат живет в городе Турсунзоде. Замужем. У неё трое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Инобат занимается торговлей овощей. Два года как она торгует на рынке города. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара, то есть помидоров и огурцов.
texts.en: Inobat lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is married and has three children.  She has a secondary education.  Inobat sells vegetables.  She has been trading in the city market for two years.  She is taking out a loan to expand the variety of goods she offers, in other words, to buy tomatoes and cucumbers.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and cucumbers

loans.name: Jesse

texts.en:
Jesse has been selling boiled eggs for three years. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to interact with other business people who have given him business ideas and business management skills.

Jesse is a 25 year old married man who has a new-born child. He hopes to supply eggs by wholesale in five years. His dream is to buy a piece of land and start a poultry farm. He needs a loan of 20, 000 Kenyan shillings to buy eggs.

loans.use: to buy eggs.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
This is Flora, 26, resident of Tanza,Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Aloud. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to save for the future of her child.

Flora operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Flora earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Flora hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to save money for the future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise is a 34 year old hard working business lady. She is married and blessed with three children aged; 14, 11, and 3. 

Loise sells utensils and plastic goods. Previously, she worked at a music studio. She wants 45,000 Kenyan shillings to buy buckets, basins and utensils.
She hopes to have a big shop and to be a prosperous business-lady. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for improving her business skills and teaching her the art of saving.

loans.use: to buy buckets, basins and utensils.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
This is Nimfa, 49, a resident of Tanza,Cavite City, Philippines. Being single, she manages her own household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Nimfa operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines and, while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these items to junk shops like Nimfa’s for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries, like factories, and others of the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund, used to buy trash from collectors and for the maintenance of her motorcycle cart. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nimfa dreams to have a much bigger place for her business. She also hopes to have her motorcycle paid soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for scrap materials that she buys for her business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has been selling vegetables and charcoal for the last four years. She does farming to supplement her income. Previously, she was employed. 

Beatrice is married and blessed with three children, aged 12, 9, and 2. She hopes to become a wholesale supplier of charcoal in the future. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for giving her knowledge on how to expand her business.

She has requested for 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur comes from village Majadia, Akhalkalaki District, in the southern part of the country. He is 25 years old, married and lives with his extended family: his wife – Marine, two sons (5 and 3 years old), a younger brother, a sister and his parents. Artur and his brother work as construction workers in his and neighborhood villages, when there are orders. Along with this job, they are also busy with farming activities, run by their family. In particular, they have three milk cows and sell approximately 90 kg of cheese per month in the village. Also they grow potatoes on 1 hectare of land and sell the harvest locally to retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 750 Laris per month. 

Artur requested credit to purchase a house in the same village for his family, as the existing one is too small for eight persons. Together with his wife and sons he will move to the new house, though will stay engaged in the family business, as the house he plans to by is close to the current one. In the new house his family will have more space and better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a house for the family.

loans.name: Dokdurkul's Group

texts.en:
Dokdurkul, 38, is the treasurer of this group. She resides in a village called Tamchi, which is situated near a great lake, Issyk Kul. Every summer local residents face a big influx of tourists from Kyrgyzstan and abroad. It’s a busy time for local entrepreneurs. 

Dokdurkul  cooks meals and sells them on one of local beaches. Even though the business was started last year, the results have been encouraging. This year she is renting out two big rooms for the customers. The initial investment in business totaled 15 000 soms and she hopes that the summer season will bring much revenue. 

The purpose of the loan is the construction of a small open air café on a beach. This way she believes she can provide service of a higher quality and attract more customers. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously).
