MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and hire labor.

loans.name: Darcho

texts.en:
Darcho comes from village Moliti, Borjomi District. He is 39 years old, married and lives with his wife and four children – three daughters (sixteen, fourteen and eleven years old) and his 3 -year-old son. Darcho’s wife Marine is a housewife. Darcho is the only income income in the family. 

He runs a family dairy farm, with three milk cows. With the milk Darcho produces approximately 90 kg of cheese per month. He sells it his small grocery store, located in the same village. Also Darcho’s family owns 0.3 hectare of agricultural land, where potatoes are grown. Harvested potatoes are also sold in his store. 

Along with cheese and potatoes, villagers can buy  different types of grocery products in Darcho’s store. In the spring/summer period Darcho had many agricultural expenses (tilling and fertilizing his plot, sowing potatoes). He didn’t have enough capital left to keep the assortment of the products in the store at a certain level. 

He requested credit to increase his existing stock in trade in his store, otherwise he will lose his customers and the family’s income will decrease.

loans.use: to purchase products to increase his stock in trade in the grocery store.

loans.name: Dinara's Group

texts.en:
Dinara, 45, is the leader of this group. She and her husband, who is a member of a local farm community, have three young kids. She combined her single mindedness with her enormous creative abilities to guarantee her success. She started farming in 1994 during the peiod of privatization. After twelve years of labor on a field she constructed a house and expanded her herd of livestock. 

Today she has been widely recognized with her high quality agricultural products and is in high demand. The loan is requested with the purpose of buying fertilizers and medicine for caring for the potatoes that she planted this spring.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Solidarité Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SOLIDARITÉ est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Fleurette est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Fleurette est âgée de 29 ans et vit au Bénin. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Fleurette est mariée à un journaliste du nom de Romaric. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé qui est à leur charge. Fleurette et son mari supportent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Fleurette a très peu fréquenté l'école. Il y a cinq ans environs que Fleurette mène comme activité la vente de layette. A côté de cette activité qui lui génère des revenus l'aidant à assumer son rôle de mère au foyer, Fleurette vend des ustensiles de cuisine. Fleurette s’approvisionne dans l'un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Fleurette n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Fleurette et les autres membres du groupe SOLIDARITÉ sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The SOLIDARITÉ group is made up of three persons who live in the same district in Bénin. The representative of the group, Fleurette, is the one who is raising her hand in the photo. 

Fleurette is 29 and lives in Bénin. It's the first time that this group has requested financial support from ALIDé to expand their businesses. Fleurette is married to a journalist named Romaric. The couple are raising one child who is enrolled in school. Fleurette and her husband share the responsibility of supporting their family. 

Fleurette went to school very little. About five years ago she began selling newborn layettes. Besides this income-generating activity which allows her to fulfill her role as mother and wife, Fleurette sells kitchen utensils. She buys her merchandise in one of the biggest markets in Bénin. The demand from her clientele is growing and, in view of her limited means, Fleurette is not able to satisfy their needs. In view of all that and of her limited means, Fleurette and the other members of her SOLIDARITÉ group are asking for their first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and newborn layettes.

loans.name: Fotima's Group

texts.en:
Fotima, 37, is the leader of this group. She was born in Aravan and has two kids. Fotima’s husband is presently employed in a construction firm in Russia, so the children were left in Fotima’s care. “If there ever was a guiding force in my life, it is my children,” Fotima explained. Fotima does her best to help her children achieve their goals in life. 

With the help of savings from doing farming, Fotima started selling grocery products in a local market in 2008. The groceries include tea, pasta, sugar, salt, etc. Currently she earns 8 000 soms monthly while having 20 000 soms in goods circulation. The past three years have brought enough help for buying livestock and furniture for the house. Fotima knows that success does not come easily, you have to work hard. She believes that the hard work in business will help her successfully repay the loan from Kiva, which she requests for investing in goods circulation. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs.

loans.name: Bessarion

texts.en:
Bessarion comes from village Gulgula, Kakheti Region. This region is well-known, with fertile land and well developed agriculture throughout the country. 

Bessarion is a 48-year-old farmer. He is married and lives with his family – his wife Ia, two sons (14 and 11 years old) and his 76-year-old mother. Ia is a teacher in a local school. The children go to school. 

Bessarion is leading the farming activities of the family. They have 0.6 hectare vineyard and sell grapes in season. Also they grow barley, garlic and haricot beans on family-owned 2 hectares of land. Harvested vegetables and grains are sold locally to retailers. The average monthly income of the family is 520 Laris. 

With the requested credit Bessarion will pay the hired workers, which will help them to perform seasonal work in the vineyard and kitchen garden – treatment of different parasites. Also they will assist Bessarion in the process of barley harvest. Part of the credit will be used to purchase medicines for the above-mentioned process. Bessarion hopes that after the treatment for parasites he will get a quality harvest and planned income from his sales.

loans.use: to purchase medicines against parasites and pay workers.

loans.name: Tazagul's Group

texts.en:
Tazagul, 31, is the treasurer of this group. This woman lifted herself and her family out of poverty thanks to her strong character, good entrepreneurial skills and the fruitful land of Kyrgyzstan. Tazagul says that the land has always fed her and her family, especially the proceeds from cotton crops. In Central Asia cotton is called “white gold” for its enormous reserves and importance in economy. Tazagul’s relationship towards this product started in 1993, when she spent 3,000 soms on planting cotton seeds on her small piece of land. She has 18 years of farming experience. Tazagul is married to a construction worker, who contributes 5,000 soms a month towards the family's needs, and they have six young children. Currently she cultivates cotton on 0.54 hectares of land, which brings in 3,000 soms a month. The purpose of this loan is to purchase fertilizers. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi comes from village Matani, Kakheti Region. This region is well known with fertile land and well developed agriculture.

Giorgi is 43 years old and lives with his wife Martia and 18-year-old son. Giorgi works as a house painter and works in his and nearby villages. Martia manages the canteen of a local school. Along with the above-mentioned jobs the family is busy with the family farm. In particular, they have two milk cows and sell approximately 55 kg of cheese per month to local dairy products retailers. Also they have four pigs. Piglets are sold in the village. Giorgi and Martia grow maize on family owned 2.5 hectares of land. They use only 30% of the land. Harvested corn is used in the farm, for feeding domestic animals. Total average monthly income of the family amounts to 800 Laris.

Giorgi requested credit for tilling the total plot (2.5 hectare) and sowing maize. He will get three times more harvest, 1/3 of which will still be used in the family farm and the rest will be sold locally. The family will get additional income from sales of maize. Giorgi plans to use the increase in income for purchasing additional milk cows.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for tractor for tilling the land and pay workers.

loans.name: Po

texts.en:
Po, 64 years old, is a farmer. Her husband is a farmer and village leader. Their income is $3.50 per day. They have two children. One works in a factory as a supervisor, making an income of $10 per day. There are eight people in her family, including her two grandsons. She has to spend $100 on food and $10 on transportation per month.

Po would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a sewing machine to sew in the village with her daughter. She wants to teach sewing to the villagers and sew clothes for her daughter’s costumers so that she earn more income to help her family.  When she can save more money, she plans to expand her small school.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Orozgul's Group

texts.en:
Orozgul, a member of this group, is 48 and married to a private entrepreneur.  Together with her husband she is bringing up a son, 20, who studies at university. Whenever their son is free from his studies, he helps his parents with housework. 

In order to meet the family needs, Orozgul sells fruit and vegetables at the market. She started this activity six years ago with the initial investment of 5,000 soms. At the moment her monthly profit is about 4,000 Soms per month. With money received from the loan, Orozgul wants to purchase more fruit for resale. In the future, with the profits gained from the trade, she wants to celebrate her son’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit for resale.

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Morn, 52 years old, is a farmer with an income of $2 per day. She is a single mother with three children, but only one lives with her. There are six members in her family, including her daughter-in-law and three grandsons. 

Her son is a motor taxi driver making $8 a day. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, and $20 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a cow, which she will breed in order to sell its calves. When she saves more money, she plans to start a small grocery shop in front of her house with her daughter.

loans.use: To buy a cow for calving, to sell the calves.

loans.name: Evgenia

texts.en:
Evgenia comes from village Ruisi, Khashuri District. She is 28 years old, married and lives with her husband Zaza, her 6-year-old son, her 5-year-old daughter and her parents-in-law. The main source of income for Evgenia and the whole family is farming activities. They have two milk cows and produce and sell approximately 50 kg of cheese per month. At the same time the family cultivates 2.5 hectare of land, where they grow cabbages and tomatoes. Harvested vegetables are sold to local vegetable retailers. Average monthly profit for the family is approximately 2000 Laris per month.

Evgenia requested credit for purchasing fertilizers, which will be used for fertilizing the land. Also part of the credit will be used to pay agricultural workers, who will help them in the above-mentioned process. After fertilizing, Evgenia’s family will get a high quality harvest and sell it for a good price. 

Evgenia and Zaza plan to use received income for construction of a new house for the family, as their existing house (only 2 rooms) is very old and uncomfortable, as well as too small for all family members.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay agricultural workers.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel, a 27-year-old single man, has operated a motorbike transport business for the past three years to earn a living. He also farms to supplement his income. Daniel's dream is to own a van for his transport business in the future.

Grateful to Faulu Kenya for empowering him financially, he is now requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to open a retail shop.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi comes from village Akhalsheni, Samtskhe-Javakheti Region. He is 52 years old and lives with his wife Marine. The source of income for the family is agricultural activities. They run a dairy farm with seven milk cows and six calves. Giorgi and Marine produce approximately 200 kg cheese per month and sell it locally to dairy product retailers. Also the family owns 0.75 hectare of land, where four tons of potatoes and 250 kg  of haricot beans are grown per year. The vegetables are sold locally. Average monthly profit of the family is 600 Laris.

With the requested credit Giorgi plans to construct a storehouse for cheese.  With the storehouse he won't have to sell the whole amount of cheese shortly after production, but can store it for months and sell when prices for cheese go up – in winter and early spring. 

Using the storehouse will significantly increase the profit of the family (by 30 – 40%).  Giorgi plans to use the increase in profit for further expansion of the farm through purchasing additional milk cows

loans.use: to pay for construction materials for cheese storehouse construction.

loans.name: Martiros

texts.en:
Martiros is a 56-year-old farmer from village Skhvilisi. He is married and lives with his wife in the village. The main income of the family comes from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land where potatoes are grown and also an apple garden. Harvested potatoes and apples are sold locally to greengrocery retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 850 Laris. 

With the requested credit Martiros will purchase fertilizers for the plot. After fertilizing he will get more and better quality harvest and thus more income from sales. 

Increased income will allow Martiros to put aside some savings and purchase a truck, for transportation of his products. When he purchases a truck, he will be able to sell his products outside of the region, where prices for potatoes and apples are higher.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for agricultural plot.

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar comes from the village of Toloshi in the Aspindza District, in the southern part of Georgia. He is 48 years old and lives with his wife, Ketevan, two sons (21 and 19 years old), and his 83 year-old mother. All family members are involved in agriculture.

Nodar requested a loan for the expansion of his farming business. His family runs a small dairy farm with two cows whose milk is used for cheese production. Also, their eleven sheep produce milk for cheese.  Both types of cheese are sold locally.   The family also grows potatoes on their plot of land. They harvest approximately 3 tons of potatoes each year and sell them locally. 

Nodar requested a loan to purchase 4 calves. He will raise and sell them at the end of fall for a higher price. The profit earned will be used to support Nodar’s new business initiative.  He plans to begin selling potatoes and cheese in Tbilisi and nearby districts for good prices instead of selling his farm products locally for low prices.   In order to have profitable turnover, he will trade not only with his own products, but will also purchase some from neighborhood farms and will use his mini-bus for transportation.  Income received from sales of the calves will be used for purchasing cheese and potatoes from neighborhood farms.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina, a 38-year-old entrepreneur married to Muhamad, is the mother of four children: Dwi, 14 and Rahman, 13 years old, both in Junior High School; Dyah, 8 years old in Elementary School, and Sinar, 2 years old.

Rina owns a retail stall business in the local market selling clothes, socks, baby shoes, sandals, school bags and stationery, an enterprise she started just two months ago. She bought the business products using her own capital and rents a simple building with two small rooms. Rina runs this business to help her husband in generating more income to meet their living needs and the children's educational costs.

Prior to starting this business, Rina sold goods such as flour, rice, sugar, coffee, etc. door to door, allowing customers to pay in two installments per month.

Rina plans to merge both businesses into one business location and so is requesting a business loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM to purchase rice, sugar, coffee, shampoo, etc. She believes that the loan will assist her in improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase products such as rice, sugar, coffee, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Shamin

texts.ru: Shamin 37 let . On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Shamin i yego semya jivut v Baku regione. On uje 7 let kak uchitel po muzike, on uchit detey igrat na raznix muzikalnix instrumentax. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit noviye muzikalniye instrumenti chtobi uchit detey. Shamin sam ochen lubit muziku i starayetsya chtobi deti polubili muziku tak je kak i on igrali ot vsey dushi.
texts.en: Shamin is 37 years old.  He is married and has two children.  Shamin and his family live in the Baku region. He has been a music teacher for seven years.  He teaches children to play different musical instruments.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy new musical instruments to teach children.  Shamin loves music very much and tries to teach children to love it as well, and to play with all their hearts.

loans.use: to buy musical instruments.

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli comes from the village of Ruisi, Kareli District. She is 56 years old and lives with her 34 year-old son. Her son works as a watchman in the local school. 

Nanuli and her son  are involved in farming. They own a 3-hectare plot of land where cabbage, tomatoes, beets, onions, and garlic are grown. Nanuli sells the harvested vegetables locally to vegetable retailers. Also, the family has a milk cow. Nanuli produces cheese and sells it locally. 

She requested a loan for purchasing tomato seedlings, as well as fertilizers. Also, part of the loan will be used as payment for workers who will help the family with planting the seedlings, as well as fertilizing the land. 

Nanuli plans to use part of the income for her son’s wedding arrangements this fall. Another part of the income will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase tomato seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is 24 years old, married and has five children, some of whom she adopted. Her children are between the ages of one to twelve years old. Her husband is a businessman.

For the past five years Laurence has operated a general store in which she sells different kinds of items such as rice, cooking oil, Irish potatoes, beans, etc. Her business is going well. With her husband, she has been able to meet the needs of her family and pay her children’s school fees.

Laurence is requesting a loan to buy more items for her store so as to make more in profits. With the profits she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To pay for rice, beans, cooking oil, and Irish potatoes to sell in her store.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan comes from the village of Kekhijvari, Khashuri District.  He is 52 years old and lives with his wife, Elene, and two daughters (22 and 21 years old). 
Levan works as a car mechanic in the village. He is master of engines. Along with this job, he is actively involved in family farming. The family has 2 milk cows whose milk is used for cheese production. Approximately 50 kg of cheese is sold at the local market. Also, the family has 1.6 hectares of land where they grow tomatoes, haricot beans, garlic, cherries, strawberries, corn and nuts. Levan and Elene sell the harvested products in Khashuri and neighboring districts’ open markets. Total average monthly income of the family is approximately 700 Laris.  

With the requested loan, Levan plans to purchase 7 piglets and pig feed.  He will raise and sell them in the fall for a higher price. He has some experience in pig farming, as in the past the family ran a pig farm. 

From the additional profit, Levan and Elene plan to renovate their house, in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seven piglets

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 45 years old and married to Pamela. They are blessed with three children.

John owns a retail shop in Gitathuru, Nairobi where he sells things such as sugar and flour to the residents of that area. He has been in business for the last four years and earns an income of 10,000 KES a month.

John is applying for his first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to purchase more stock like sugar, flour and other things. He is very hardworking.

John plans to use the anticipated profits to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase more stock like sugar and flour.

loans.name: Bayram

texts.ru: Bayram jenat i imeyet 4 detey. Yemu 45 let. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Uje 11 let Bayram chinit isporchenniye mashini. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya pochinki mashin. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego starshego brata kotoriy toje zanimayetsya pochinkoy mashin.
texts.en: Bayram is married and has four children.  He is 45 years old.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Absheron region with his family.  For eleven years, Bayram has been repairing broken cars.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy parts to repair cars.  He started his business with his older brother who also repairs cars.

loans.use: to buy car parts

loans.name: Benadetti

texts.en:
Benedetti is 34 years old and married to Joseph. They are blessed with four children aged twelve, ten, seven and four years.

Benedetti has been a dairy farmer for the past three years. She earns a monthly income of 11,000 KES which she uses to support her family members.

Benedetti is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced to KADET by a staff member. She will use the loan to buy a dairy cow. With the anticipated profits she will venture into greenhouse farming.

Benedetti’s hopes and dreams are concentrated on greenhouse farming, the profits from which will educate her children and insure their wellbeing, so improving her family’s living standard.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Metriana

texts.en:
Metriana is 42 years old and married to Zet, a sixty-year-old man. They live with their eight children in a modest house. Their children are Maria, nineteen years old and a senior high school graduate; Milka, eighteen years old and in vocational school; Ester, fifteen years old and in the third level of junior high school; Arifin, thirteen years old; Yunus, eleven years old; and Yesaya, seven years old. The youngest of the three are still in elementary school.

Metriana is a farmer who cultivates vegetables (kangkung), red spinach, string beans, mustard greens, chilies, tomatoes and basil. She knows that she has to support her husband to fulfill their family’s needs. She said that her family cannot depend on her husband’s income as a contract staffer in a government agency.

Metriana is grateful to have a relative who is willing to lend her two plots of land for free. She spends most of her days on the farm. She dreams of buying a pump to water her crops, but she does not have the money to do so. So Metriana is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 IDR from TLM. She is hoping that TLM will approve her application so she can buy a pump and improve her yield.

loans.use: To purchase a pump.

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is a 62 year-old farmer from the village of Sasireti, Kareli District.  Tamaz is married and lives with his wife, Maya, three sons (21, 19 and 8 years old) and a twenty-year old daughter. The only source of income for the family is farming. In particular, they have 5 hectares of farmland where wheat, barley, haricot beans, maize, cabbage, tomatoes, garlic and beets are grown.  They also have a 3-hectare orchard with 500 apple, 350 peach and 20 cherry trees. Tamaz also has a tractor equipped with different attachments. He uses it on his own farm as well as on neighborhood farms, providing them with different types of services.  That is an additional source of income for the family. Total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris.

Tamaz requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for treating plants with parasites. Also, part of the loan will be used for paying workers who help the family.  After fertilizing and treating the plants, Tamaz’s family will get a quality harvest and sell it for a good price. It will positively impact the income of the family. 

With the income, Tamaz plans to expand the farm by purchasing an additional 4 hectares of land for farming.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides, as well as to pay workers

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 37 years old and married to Agrippina. They are blessed with three children.

Julius owns a retail shop in Gitathuru, Nairobi, where he supplies tea leaves to the residents of that area. He has been in this business for the last two years and earns an income of 8,400 KES a month.

Julius is applying for his first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD which he will use to purchase more tea leaves. He plans to use the anticipated profits to expand his business and educate his children.

Julius is a very hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy more  tea leaves

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 36-year-old businessman and is married to Nancy, who is a housewife. They are blessed with two children ages ten and twelve. For the past ten years, Peter has been a goat farmer. He earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES which he uses to support his family.

Peter has successfully repaid a previous loan with KADET. He is requesting a second loan to purchase a heifer and increase his income. He plans to use the anticipated profit from his loan to start a mechanic shop. His hopes and dreams are to own a car bazaar which will improve his family’s living standards and allow him to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase a heifer

loans.name: Bilgeys

texts.ru: Bilgeys rodilas v 1958 qodu. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Bilgeys i yeyo semya jivut v Absheron regione. Ona 8 let zanimayetsya vipechkoy xleba "Tandir", tak je ona v etoy pechke tandir delayet nacionalnuyu yedu iz kuricci i iz ribi "Lavangi". Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye produkti dlya vipechki v tandire. Vipechki v tandire ona nauchilas u svoyey mami.
texts.en: Bilgeys was born in 1958. She is married and has two children.  Bilgeys and her family live in the Absheron region. She has been baking tandir bread for the last eight years.  Additionally, she makes the traditional dish lavangi (stuffed chicken or fish) in her oven.  Now she needs 2000 AZN to buy the ingredients necessary for baking in the tandir.  She learned how to bake in a tandir from her mother.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients necessary for baking in a tandir

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is a 37-year-old married mother of three. For the past two years, she has run a retail shop in Kilifi. Milly has been a previous KADET client and this will be her second loan. 

Milly is requesting a loan to increase her stock of sugar, corn flour, salt, cooking oil, margarine, and tea leaves. She plans to use the profits from her loan to both repay KADET and support her family. Her dream is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy sugar, corn flour, salt, cooking oil and other items to sell

loans.name: Starphord

texts.en:
Starphord is 25 years old and married. He runs a retail shop in Mtwapa, Mombasa. For the past four years, Starphord has also been in the entertainment industry, operating a successful video shop. 

Although Starphord is a KADET client, this will be his first business loan. He is requesting a loan to renovate his video café and purchase flour and sugar. He plans to use his anticipated profit to repay his loan and gradually expand his business. Starphord’s dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: to renovate his video café and purchase flour and sugar

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz comes from the village of Sagholasheni, Kareli District. He is 47 years old and lives with his wife, Inga, 20 year-old daughter and 18 year-old son.  The son and daughter are in school.  Teimuraz and Inga earn a living through farming activities. They cultivate a  family-owned 1.5 hectare plot of land. They grow tomatoes, cabbage, carrots, onions, haricot beans and strawberries. Harvested vegetables and berries are sold locally in the village to the green grocery retailers, as well as to the local population. 

This is the high season in farming.  Teimuraz requested a loan for purchasing fertilizers and insecticides as well as for paying workers who help the family fertilize and treat vegetables with different parasites. The family will get a better harvest and a good income from sales. Teimuraz and Inga plan to use part of the income for the children’s education and the other part for covering the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides and to pay workers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy phone accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy electronics to sell

loans.name: Bichiko

texts.en: Bichiko comes from the village of Ganakhleba in the Dmanisi district. He is 40 years old, unmarried and lives with his father, 90-year-old Guram, who is retired. Agricultural activities, led by Bichiko, are the only source of income for the family. He works on the family-owned dairy farm with 5 milk cows and sells approximately 140 kg of cheese per month to local dairy product retailers. He also has a bee keeping farm with 30 hives and colonies. He sells the harvested honey in the village during the entire year. The family's average monthly income from farming activities is 500 GEL. Bichiko plans to use the requested loan to purchase 10 more beehives with bee colonies. The expansion of the bee keeping farm will allow Bichiko to sell more honey and get more income, thereby improving living conditions for his father and himself.

loans.use: to purchase 10 beehives with bee colonies

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a mother of nine children who are ages 7-22 years old. She is married to a house construction laborer in their village. Florence has a small supermarket in which she sells different items such as milk, juice, and fruits. She has been doing this business for the past three years. Her business is doing well and has enabled her feed her family and pay school fees for her family. Florence needs a loan to buy more supermarket items in order to make more profits. With the profits she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for milk, juice, fruits, and other goods that she will sell in her store

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 36 years old, married, and a father of two children who are one and three years of age. He is in the transport business and also runs a tailoring business in Kilifi. His business has been in operation for the last four years and has been a success. 

James has been a KADET client and this is his second loan to finance his business. With this loan he plans to service his tuk tuk and use the remaining amount to purchase cloth materials for tailoring. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. James' dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: to service his tuk tuk and to purchase cloth materials for tailoring with the remaining amount

loans.name: Karani

texts.en:
Karani is a 35-year-old married father of four children. He is a poultry farmer in Mariakani, Mombasa. His business has been in operation for the last four years and has been a success. 

He has been a KADET client and this loan marks his fourth time borrowing to finance his business. With this loan he plans to purchase more chicks. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. Karani's dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks

loans.name: Phillip

texts.en:
Phillip is a 41-year-old married man. He runs a food café at Holland, Mombasa. His business has been in operation for the last five years and has been a success.
 
He has been a KADET client and this marks his third loan to finance his business. With this loan he plans to add more food stock and to refurnish his café. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. Phillip's dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: to add more food stock and to refurnish his café

loans.name: Madaleine

texts.en:
Madaleine is 62 years old and has 7 children who are ages 17 to 39 years old. Some of them have finished school already. Her husband is a farmer. 

Madaleine sells milk and some food stuffs. She has been selling food stuffs for the past 14 years old. This business enabled her to meet the needs of her family and to feed her family. Madeline needs a loan to buy more food stuffs in order to make more profits. With the profits she plans to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase milk and food stuffs that she will sell

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is a 42-year-old single mother of three children. She runs a beauty salon in Bamburi, Mombasa. The business has been in operation for the last two years.
 
Claire has been a KADET client and this marks her second time borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to add more stock of cosmetics and hair products. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to maintain her family. Her dream is to relocate her beauty salon into a bigger business premise.

loans.use: to add more stock of cosmetics and hair products

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustine is 28 years, married and has a nine-month-old child. His wife is a tailor, and they work together.

Faustine owns a general store in which he sells different items such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, Irish potatoes, etc. He has been in business for the past five years, and his store is progressing well. From this business he can afford to feed his family and advance himself.

Faustine needs a loan to buy more items to put in his store so as to make more in profits. With these profits he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, and Irish potatoes to sell in his store.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 45 year old, married to Hellen and is blessed with four children.

Peter owns a fruit shop whereby he supplies fruit to his neighborhood. He has been in business for the last nine years and earns an income of 18,000 KES a month.

Peter is applying for a loan of 20,000 KES, his first from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy fruit and pumpkins to sell. He hopes to educate his children, become a fruit distributor in Githurai and build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 46 years old, married to Caroline and has two children. He has been running his carpentry business for the past thirteen years. He earns a monthly income of about 10,000 KES which he uses to take care of his family.

George has been loaned 40,000 KES by KADET LTD. This is his second loan from KADET. He intends to use the entire loan to purchase more timber for his business.

George plans to use his anticipated profits to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase more timber for his business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 37 years old, married and has four children, nineteen, fifteen, twelve and eight years of age. She has been a butcher for two years. She earns a monthly income of about 6,000 KES, which she uses to restock her shop and take care of her family.

Jane has been loaned 20,000 KES by KADET LTD, her first loan from KADET. She intends to use her loan to buy more meat for her butchery. She plans to use the profits from her business to open up another shop to sell her supplies of honey and wedding and special occasion beverages.

In the future, Jane hopes to send all of her children to college and establish herself fully in business.

loans.use: to buy more meat for her butchery.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is 26 years old, married to Leah and is blessed with one child. He owns houses in Gitathuru that he rents to people in the area. He has been doing this for the last eleven years and earns an income of 10,000 KES a month. He is a very hardworking man.

Jacob is applying for his first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD. With this loan he plans to build more houses. He will use the extra profits to expand his business and educate his child.

In the future he hopes to build more houses.

loans.use: To build more houses.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 40 years old, she has three children who are aged 8-16 years old, all of whom are in school. Joy sells eggs and chicken food to make a living and she has been in this business for the past four years. This business has enabled her to pay school fees for her children and meet the needs of her family. Joy is requesting a loan to buy more chicken feed to increase her profits. She plans to continue feeding her family with her profits.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a mother of six children who ages range from 2 to 13 years old. All but the youngest two are in school. Joyce's husband is a businessman. Joyce owns a general store in which she sells different items such as rice, beans, sugar, etc. She has run this business for five years and it has enabled her to feed her children and pay their school fees. Joyce needs a loan to in order to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, and other goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar, 28 years old, is married to Wandia and they are blessed with two children. Oscar owns a laundry service and he sells clothes to people in his area. He has been doing this for the last nine years, earning an income of KES 10,000 per month. 

Oscar has a good credit history with KADET and he is applying for his second loan of KES 40,000, which he plans to use to purchase more clothing stock. He will use the extra profit to expand his business and educate his children. Oscar hopes to expand his business and build a residential house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing stock

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is a mother of a 4-year-old child who is in school. Her husband is a farmer and Claudine owns a general store in which she sells different items such as salt, cooking oil, sugar, soap, etc. She has run this business for four years and it is doing well. This business has enabled Claudine to develop herself and improve her family's standard of living. She needs a loan to buy more items for her store. Claudine plans to use the anticipated profits to begin building her family house.

loans.use: to purchase salt, cooking oil, sugar, soap, and other goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is engaged in agriculture. She keeps livestock. Mariam would like to increase the livestock and develop her business. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase cows. The increase in livestock will help Mariam to get more income and cover her family’s daily costs. Besides, additional income will help Mariam to start her own family in the future. Mariam lives together with her parents.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Narine

texts.en: Narine trades in clothing from a rented booth in the city market. Narine would like to increase the variety of clothing to meet her clients’ demands. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase more clothing to sale. Narine will increase her working capital and develop her business further. Additional income will help Narine to pay for her student son’s education. Narine lives together with her pensioner mother, husband and son.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en: Alvard keeps livestock and cultivates land. Alvard has a tractor for cultivating the land, but it is very old and needs to be repaired. With a repaired tractor, Alvard will cultivate the land faster and more effectively, which is very important for getting a good harvest. With the loan’s help, Alvard will develop the land and insure a sustainable future for her family. Alvard lives together with her husband and son.

loans.use: to pay for tractor repair

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en: Samvel is a veterinarian. In addition to his professional work, he keeps livestock. The family's main income come from the livestock. Their current income is not enough to cover the family’s daily expenses. Samvel would like to purchase a horse, as well as a sheep shaver. Samvel will be able to shear the sheep and the wool not only for the family needs, but also to sell. This will help Samvel to get additional income and insure a brighter future for his family. Samvel lives together with his wife and two children.

loans.use: to pay for a horse and a sheep shaver

loans.name: Alina

texts.en: Alina keeps beehives and livestock and cultivates land. Additionally, Alina works at the post-office as a postman, but her salary is too low to cover the family’s daily costs. Alina would like to increase her livestock and start cultivating potatoes. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase a special sort of potato seeds and livestock. With the loan’s help, Alina will increase her business and get more income. Additional income will help her renovate the house and improve her family’s living conditions. Alina lives together with her husband and daughter.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and livestock

loans.name: Spartak

texts.en: Spartak keeps beehives. In addition, he works at the village hall as the community deputy leader. Spartak’s salary and current income are not enough to meet his family’s needs. Spartak would like to increase the number of beehives and develop his business. With the requested loan, he plans to purchase beehives and essentials. With the loan’s help, Spartak will get additional income and will be able to insure a better future for his wife and little child.

loans.use: to purchase beehives and essentials

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 36 years old, is married to Susan, a businesswoman, and they are blessed with four children: 20, 17, 15 and 12 years old. Joseph has been running his tire repair business for the past four years, earning a monthly income of about KES 25,000, which he uses to take care of his family.

Joseph has been lent KES 75,000 by KADET Ltd. This is his second loan from KADET, which he intends to use to purchase rims, oil and a compressor machine. He plans to use the anticipated profit to boost his business. In the future, Joseph hopes to educate his children to university and establish his business as the major tire repair service in Githurai 44.

loans.use: to purchase rims, oil and a compressor machine

loans.name: Vardigyul

texts.en:
Vardigyul keeps livestock and beehives. Vardigyul needs to replace the old hives with new ones. This requires some financial investments. With the requested loan, Vardigyul plans to purchase new hives, as well as some medicine and requisites for her bees. 

The new hives will allow Vardigyul to have a good produce, develop the beekeeping. This will also help Vardigyul to get additional income and insure sustainable future for her family. She lives together with her husband.

loans.use: to pay for hives, medicine and other requisites for bees

loans.name: Voskan

texts.en: Voskan keeps livestock and cultivates land. Voskan would like to increase the number of livestock he owns and develop his agriculture business. He has applied to SEF to get a loan that will provide sufficient financial means for this. Developing his agricultural business will help Voskan to increase his income and ensure better living conditions for his elderly grandparents, who help him with his business. Voskan lives with his grandparents. Additional income will also enable Voskan to provide for his family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Yeghishe

texts.en: Yeghishe keeps livestock and cultivates land. Yeghishe would like to start growing cabbage, as it is in great demand. Cabbage farming requires much work, so Yeghishe plans to hire workers to help. With the requested loan he plans to purchase cabbage seeds and pay the salaries of the workers. Yeghishe will increase his income and improve his family’s living conditions. He lives with his wife, who is a school teacher.

loans.use: to purchase cabbage seeds and pay workers' salaries

loans.name: Inessa

texts.en: Inessa is engaged in agriculture. She keeps cattle. Agriculture is the family’s main source of income, and it is very hard for the family to cover the daily expenses for the family of four. She lives with her mother, brother, and sister. Inessa would like to increase the number of livestock she keeps in order to increase her income in the future. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase cows. Additional cows will help Inessa earn additional income and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en: Shushanik is engaged in an agricultural business. She keeps beehives. Shushanik would like to increase the number of beehives. An increase of honey produce will bring more income to Shushanik and her husband, who helps her in the business. This is her second loan from SEF International.

loans.use: to purchase beehives

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his business capital and invest in purchasing a paving cutter and other new tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a shaving machine, timber and iron sheets for business expansion.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome makes and sells bags to earn a living.  She has been in this business for two years. Being a single mother of one, she works hard in her business in order to provide for her child. Salome has benefited from Faulu Kenya because she has been educated on business management and this has helped her to grow her business. Salome's dream is to open up a training school for tailors and to provide employment to several people. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a sewing machine and more fabric.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and more fabric

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has been tailoring since 1992. He is 44 years old, married and a father to five children aged 14, 12, 10, 8, and 6. Through Faulu Kenya, Charles has grown his business, thus raising his family's standard of living.

In the next five years, Charles hopes to expand his business in order to get enough income to educate his children. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more fabric. Charles appears in the photo with his wife and two of his children.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soft drinks and umbrellas for her shop

loans.name: Rizk

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 49-year-old married man living with his wife and three school-aged children. He is from Lebanon. 

He has been working as a mechanic for over 25 years. In 1991, he opened his own car repair shop. He specializes in repairing vehicle body-work. He provides his customers with top quality services and has two full-time employees helping him with the work. 

He has obtained his first Kiva loan and has been a very good client with punctual repayments. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional tools for his business. He is confident that his work will continue to be successful in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools needed for his business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose has been rearing chickens for the last two years. She is a hardworking, single 30-year-old businesswoman. Rose is grateful to Faulu Kenya for empowering her financially. She hopes to have a well-established business in five years. Rose is asking for a loan of 80,000 KES to buy more chicks for rearing.

loans.use: To buy chicks

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne has been engaged in dairy farming since 1989. She is a hardworking 50-year-old businesswoman. Anne is married and has adult children. She has benefited from Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management. Anne hopes to own a ranch in the future in order to generate more income. She has requested a loan of 76,000 KES to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen and his wife, Melinda, started their League City, Texas-based business, Publish-ME.com, LLC, after they realized their hobby of publishing free software online had the potential to earn them a profit. Two and a half years ago, Stephen decided to turn his long-time website, which offered free and safe software downloads, into a business by opening up advertising space on it. This was the official start of their business because, as Stephen says, “From day one, it was instantly profitable.” 

Stephen and Melinda’s website, www.safefreesoftware.com, offers their clients eight categories of virus-free software downloads: security, games, video, audio, apps, internet, business and website development. In total, they offer 6,727 programs, which means that a visitor to their site is bound to find something that fits their needs. The high traffic resulting from this diversity of reliable content has contributed to the success of the advertising space offered on the website.

Despite their impressive initial success, Stephen and Melinda are very excited to continue growing their business. Along with continuing to offer reliable software downloads, they are now adding another component to the site that will keep customers informed about the world of software development. Under Melinda’s guidance, the site now has an “editorial” page, which will teach the reader about a certain kind of software each day. With this in mind, the website now boasts that returning customers can “learn something new every day!”

This loan made the new editorial section of the website possible. The remainder of the funds are going to the development of advertising space on other sites to draw in more customers. Stephen says that, though the new developments on the site allow it more traffic from search engines, the daily budget still runs primarily on ads that he and Melinda put on other sites. 

The biggest business successes that publish-ME.com, LLC has seen, according to Stephen and Melinda, are its instant and continued profitability and that is has allowed Melinda to devote herself 100% to her own business. While Stephen still manages another full-time career, Melinda develops the business and writes its content full time. Without this loan, Stephen says that the business would have taken much longer to get to the point that it’s at now; with it, Stephen and Melinda are able to continue expanding their business and providing reliable services to their loyal clientele.

loans.use: to expand his website to include an editorial section and to pay for advertising space

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela’s McAllen, Texas-based sporting accessory business, The Commander, grew slowly out of her and her husband’s dream of becoming self-sufficient entrepreneurs. Starting their careers as waiters, Marcela and her husband, Juan, began chasing their dream by selling sporting clothing and accessories at weekend flea markets. Recently, they made the largest business decision since they began pursuing their business goal: they moved to a permanent, fixed location.

Ten years ago, with strong encouragement from Juan, Marcela began selling military and hunting items at two McAllen flea markets. As the years passed, she began to envision a permanent location for her business, and she and Juan began to look at buildings with dimensions appropriate for their inventory. Six months ago, they found an affordable, central location and took a courageous leap of faith by signing a lease and moving their inventory.

At first, Marcela says, business seemed to flow smoothly enough; however, she soon started to see that her store needed more inventory. Customers demanded varied items that Marcela had never sold before, such as paintball gear and police suits. As she realized that her flea market inventory was not sufficient to fill the needs of the business’ permanent location, she began to search for ways to meet the demands of her new customers.

This loan was the solution to Marcela’s inventory problem. It was invested in new inventory, such as paintball products and police attire, to fill the unique demands of her new customers. After being denied a loan from a commercial bank, she came to Kiva partner, Accion Texas-Louisiana. Of this experience, she says “The loan helped our business a lot. Without it, with our lack of new inventory, I project that our business would have closed down in a short time.”

The Commander now supplies its customers with the sporting items they need. Some additions to her inventory include flashlights, caps, hats, bandanas, camouflage face paint, helmets, paintballs, facemasks, paintball guns, and boots. Marcela says that her business is successful in part because it offers more variety to her customers than her competitors. Without her loan, she says, none of this success would have been possible.

In the future, Marcela aims to continue her business’ success and growth by providing her customers with their sporting needs. She will continue running her business with the support and hard work of her husband and three daughters. Most of all, with the help of her new loan, she hopes to continue realizing her long-time dream of being a self-sufficient entrepreneur.

loans.use: to pay for sporting goods inventory such as paintball and police accessories

loans.name: Geoconda Benita

texts.es: Geoconda Benita tiene 39 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este humilde negocio, ella tiene que levantarse muy temprano para realizar los quehaceres del hogar, pues además tiene que brindarle la atención necesaria a sus hijos. A pesar de ser una actividad muy minoritaria trata de mejorar los ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de ropa en general, cosméticos, calzado, bolsos, sabanas entre otros. Ella sueña con que sus hijos finalicen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Geoconda Benita is 39 years old and sells general merchandise. She has managed her modest business for more than five years. Geoconda wakes up early to complete her household chores before attending to the needs of her children. Despite having an informal business, she tries to improve her income so that she can obtain a better quality of life.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy clothing, cosmetics, shoes, bags, bed sheets, and other items. Her dream is for her children to complete their studies.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, cosmetics, shoes, bags, bed sheets, and other items.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria nació en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 37 años de edad. Actualmente,  Ana Maria  vive en la ciudad donde nació y se dedica a venta de cosméticos desde hace 6 años labor que realiza con la ayuda de su familia ella vende cosméticos por catalogo de distintas empresas muy reconocidas en el ámbito de la belleza, ofrece sus productos a amistades, oficinas, y por su zona ya que ella es una persona muy conocida en el área, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en incrementar el capital de trabajo comprando mercadería que se encuentra en promoción y después ofrecerla un poco más caro y así obtener más ganancias, es un apersona joven con ganas de superación agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Ana Maria was born in the city of Cusco in the Department of Cusco, Peru. She is 37 years old. Ana Maria currently lives in the city where she was born and has been selling cosmetics for six years with the help of her family. She sells cosmetics through catalogs from different companies that are known in the beauty industry. Ana Maria offers her products to friends and office workers. In her region, she is a person who is well-known in her trade.

The money from this loan will be used to increase her operating capital for purchasing merchandise through a sales promotion and then sell them at a slightly higher price so that she can generate more earnings. Ana Maria is a young woman who desires to succeed and is grateful to Asociación Arariwa for the support it has provided.

She is a responsible and hardworking person. As a result of these qualities, her fellow group members invited her to participate in the Communal Bank “Mosoc Killa” which is part of Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es: Florentina nació en la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 47 años de edad. Actualmente, Florentina  vive en la ciudad de Cusco junto con sus dos hijos. Florentina tiene un restaurante y tiene un nombre particular “Flori”. Florentina tiene 16 años que se dedica a la venta de comida y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Florentina was born in Quispicanchis Province in the Department of Cusco, Peru. She is 47 years old and currently lives in the city of Cusco with her two children. Florentina has a restaurant named “Flori” where she has been selling food for 16 years. She has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work.

Florentina is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles, and other items. She is a responsible and hardworking person. As a result of these qualities, her fellow group members invited her to participate in the “Mosoc Killa” Communal Bank, which is part of Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, noodles, and other supplies.

loans.name: Erlinda De Rosario

texts.es: Erlinda tiene 33 años, este no es el primer financiamiento que solicita a Fundación, por lo que es una excelente cliente. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, la necesidad de emprender su propio negocio fue la razón por la ella dio inicio a este humilde negocio que ahora es su medio de vida, y la necesidad de proporcionarle a su hijo lo necesario. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de azúcar, jabón, detergentes, leche, jugos y refrescos naturales, a pesar de que tiene que levantarse muy temprano para ir al mercado para realizar las compras y recorrer los diferentes establecimientos donde le ofrezcan los productos más baratos siempre sonríe con mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Erlinda is 33 years old. This is not the first time she has requested a loan from Fundación Leon 2000 since she is an excellent client. She manages a store that she established because she wanted to have her own business. It now serves as her livelihood and helps her provide for the needs of her child.

This loan will be used as operating capital so that she can buy sugar, soap, detergents, milk, juices, and natural refreshments. Despite having to wake up very early to go to the market and travel to different establishments to get the cheapest products, Erlinda is always smiling because she is able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, detergents, milk, juices, and natural refreshments.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es: Evangelina  nació en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 50 años de edad. Actualmente, Evangelina vive en la ciudad de Cusco junto con su único hijo. Evangelina venta de ropa como por ejemplo pantalones, camisas, chompas. En esta oportunidad Evangelina requiere el préstamo para comprar más ropa como por ejemplo casacas, pantalones y  muchas cosas más.  La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Evangelina was born in the city of Cusco in the Department of Cusco, Peru. She is 50 years old. Evangelina currently lives in the city of Cusco with her only son. She sells clothing such as trousers, shirts, and sweaters. At the moment, she needs a loan to buy more clothing such as jackets, trousers, and other items.

She is a responsible and hardworking person. As a result of these qualities, her fellow group members invited her to participate in the Communal Bank “Mosoc Killa” which is part of Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase jackets, trousers, and other items.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: José francisco tiene 50 años, por lo que él se dedica a ofrecer sus servicios musicales de disco móvil. Hace más de 32 años que se dedica a este humilde negocio, pues desde muy joven empezó a trabajar. Con los ingresos que obtiene los utiliza para sus 2 hijos que son lo más importantes para él, por lo que él está muy interesado en proporcionarles a sus hijos estudios y en la manutención de su hogar. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para realizar la compra de alambres, luces, computara y otros accesorios.
texts.en:
José Francisco is 50 years old and offers his musical services as a disc jockey. He has operated his modest business for more than 32 years since he started working at a very young age. With his earnings he is able to support his two children who are most important to him. José is very interested in providing for his children’s education and maintaining his household.

For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy extension cords, lights, a computer, and other accessories.

loans.use: to purchase extension cords, lights, a computer, and other accessories.

loans.name: Akufoé Mawusinu

texts.fr: Veuve de 53 ans et mère de cinq enfants, Akufoé est revendeuse de trousseau bébé au marché Assiyéyé  d’Adidogomé depuis 2001.elle s’approvisionne à Lomé. Afin de pouvoir assurer les  besoins de ses enfants et  mieux supporter les charges de sa maisonnée Akufoé ne  lésine pas sur ses efforts pour accomplir ses tâches.
texts.en: A 53-year-old widow and the mother of five children, Akufoé has been a seller of baby accessories at the Assiyéyé market of Adidogomé since 2001. She gets her supplies from Lomé. To ensure the needs of her children are met and to cover household expenses better, Akufoé spares no effort to accomplish her tasks.

loans.use: to buy infant accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flavourings and bags of sugar.

loans.name: Abla Emefa

texts.fr: Abla  est à son premier  crédit  dans notre institution  et est une bonne revendeuse  de charbon de bois car elle maîtrise bien son activité. Elle s’approvisionne à Anié(Atakpamé) puis revend  à domicile Abla est célibataire sans enfant et à 35 ans, elle  fait de son mieux pour prendre soin d’elle.
texts.en: Abla is on her first loan with our institution and is a skilled retailer of charcoal, since she manages her business well. She gets her supplies at Anié (Atakpamé), and then re-sells them at her home. Abla is unmarried, has no children, and at 35 years of age does her best to take care of herself.

loans.use: To buy charcoal.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adjo Délali

texts.fr: Revendeuse de boissons, Adzo associe à ce commerce la restauration. Elle à commencé son activité depuis 2009 et vend à Adidogomé un quartier de la place. Adzo à 31 ans, est mariée à un conducteur de  travaux et  est mère d’un enfant. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et ses environs et espère qu’un jour ses efforts auront du mérite.
texts.en: Originally a retailer of drinks, Adzo has added a catering business to her activities. She began her business in 2009 and makes her sales in Adidogomé, a local area. Adzo is 31 years old, married to a foreman, and is the mother of one child. She gets her supplies in Lomé and the surrounding areas, and hopes that her efforts will one day all be worthwhile.

loans.use: To buy drinks and ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials to make shoes

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa, elle s’approvisionne sur un marché de la place  et ce premier crédit va lui servir à acheter plus de sacs d’oignons pour son commerce et rendre la fin du mois plus agréables  et mieux  satisfaire les besoins de son enfant.
texts.en: Yawa gets her supplies at a local market, and this first loan will serve to buy more bags of onions for her business, ensure a more pleasant end of the month, and allow her to better provide for her child.

loans.use: To buy onions.

loans.name: Bertha Margarita

texts.en:
Bertha is 63 years old and lives near the city of Latacunga in the central Ecuadorian highlands. She is divorced, has four grown children, and lives with her grandson. Bertha is a responsible woman who raises guinea pigs and pigs. She began her business with a small amount of animals and wants to purchase more guinea pigs and pigs to raise.

Bertha has been obtaining loans to support her business for three years. She says her past loans have given her a place to live and have helped her survive and overcome poverty. Her dream for the next five years is to continue prospering and to keep more animals. In the picture, Bertha is showing off one of her larger guinea pigs.

loans.use: to raise more pigs and guinea pigs

loans.name: Raquel De La Concepcion

texts.es: Raquel tiene 42 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de granos básicos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella ofrece una variedad de granos básicos. Es una persona muy alegre y trabajadora por lo que vive muy feliz con su negocio a pesar de ganar mucho con este negocio le proporciona lo necesario para mantenerse a ella y la familia. Ella solicita urgentemente para comprar frijoles, azúcar, aceite, arroz, concentrado maíz entre otros. Su deseo es mantener siempre su record crediticio porque sin él no podría avanzar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Raquel is 42 years old and earns her livelihood by selling dry goods. She has been in business for more than three years and offers a variety of dry goods. Raquel is a cheerful and hardworking person who is very happy with her business. Even though she spends a great deal of time managing her business, it provides her what she needs to support herself and her family.

Raquel is submitting an urgent request so that she can buy beans, sugar, oil, rice, concentrated corn, and other products. Her wish is to constantly maintain her credit record, because without it she is not able to advance her business.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar, oil, rice, concentrated corn, and other products.

loans.name: Sonia Fabiola

texts.en: Sonia is 42 years old and lives in Latacunga, a city located in the central highlands of Ecuador. She is separated from her husband and lives with two of her three children, aged 20, 16 and 14. Sonia is an enterprising person with goals to overcome her hardships. She raises pigs and guinea pigs and is requesting this loan to purchase more animals to raise. Her past loans have helped Sonia support her children and invest in her animals. In the future, she would like to continue to raise more pigs and guinea pigs. In the photo, Sonia is showing off one of her larger guinea pigs.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs and guinea pigs to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilisers, and diesel before the rainy season.

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr:
Ngoné habites dans un petit village à l’interieur du Senegal avec son marie et ses enfants. Elle a neuf enfants en total entre l’âges de 17 à 34 ans. 

Elle est commercente depuis 17 ans, specialisé dans les produits locals comme les carottes, aubergines et piments. 

Elle a constaté qu’elle peut gagner plus de marge si elle achetes les légumes dans sa localité au lieux de payer les frais de transportation. Ca lui permettra aussi de passer plus de temps avec ses enfants et ses petits enfants.

Avec l’argent qu’elle gagne elle va soutenir ses enfants dans leur scolarité.
texts.en:
Ngoné lives in a small town in the interior of Senegal with her husband and children. She has nine children in total, whose ages range from 17 to 34.

She has been a merchant for 17 years, and specializes in local products such as carrots, eggplant, and peppers.

She has noted that she can earn larger profits if she buys vegetables in her area instead of paying for them to be transported. This will also allow her to spend more time with her children and grandchildren.

With the money that she earns, she will provide for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables locally, without having to pay for transportation costs.

loans.name: Saye

texts.fr:
Saye a 66 ans, elle est marié et elle est mere de 10 enfants entre l’age de 21 ans à 48 ans. Elle habites dans un village à l’interieur du Senegal avec sa famille.

Elle est commercante depuis 30 ans; un occupation qu’elle a herité de sa mere. Elle s’occupes de l’achat et la revente des légumes dans le marché local, principalement les carottes, les choux et les aubergines cependant la saison. C’est dur comme travail mais elle aime bien les relation tissée dans son activité.

Elle a déja bénéficié de quatre petits crédits et elle cherches ce crédit pour lui aider a acheté des légumes pendant la période des pluies qui vient bientôt en Senegal.

Ce crédit lui permettre de soutenir sa famille avec ces dépenses quotidiens.
texts.en: Saye is a 66 year old married woman and a mother of 10 children between the ages of 21 and 48. She lives in a village in the center of Senegal with her family. She has been a shopkeeper for the last 30 years, a job which she inherited from her mother. She is in charge of purchasing and selling vegetables in the local market, namely carrots, cabbage and eggplant, depending on the season. The work is hard but she enjoys the relationships arising from her profession. She already benefitted from four previous small loans and is asking for this next loan in order to help her purchase these vegetables during the rainy season that will soon arrive in Senegal. This loan will allow her to take care of her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables: carrots, cabbage, eggplant

loans.name: Magueye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Magueye agée de 33 ans,marié,pere de 3 jeunes enfants ,habite un village se situant à 15 km de la principale ville de la region.
IL est enseignant dans l’ élèmentaire depuis plus de 3 ans. Il adore son métier et aime partager ses connaissances avec ses élèves.
Avec ce credit il envisage de prendre en charge les frais médicaux de son enfant malade.
Il veux stabiliser  l’ état de santé de son enfant ,pour qu’ il puisse aller normalement à l’ école.
texts.en: Magueye is 33 years old, married, and a father of three young children. He lives in a village located 15 kim away from the capital city in his region in Senegal. He has been an elementary school teacher for the past three years and really enjoys sharing his knowledge with his students. He is asking for a loan in order to cover the medical costs of his sick child, who needs special care before being back in stable health in order to continue to go to school.

loans.use: cover medical expenses of his child

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials - sand, cement, stone, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco,  y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia  tiene 61 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. artesanía, ella venD. polos, chompas, gorros y muñecas, ella tiene un stand donD. trabaja desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Inti Quilla communal bank, located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is 61, married, and has 6 sons and daughters.  She sells handicrafts besides doing her other activities.  She sells shirts, sweaters, hats and dolls at a stand where she works from 8 am to 10 pm.  With the help of this business the member has been able to get her children ahead.  She would like to expand her handicrafts business and is requesting a loan to buy crafts wholesale.

The member is happy with the loan and promises to make all the payments on time.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts wholesale
