loans.name: Pemuco Crece Contigo Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Pemuco Crece Contigo” está conformado por 19 emprendedores, que se dedican a diversos rubros entre ellos venta de ropa, venta de ropa interior, producción de longanizas y producción de cerdo ahumado. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Gladys, quien en la foto se encuentra en el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste con una chaqueta color rojo y usa pantalones color negro.
Se dedica al rubro de la artesanía, compra floreros de greda y flores secas en el pueblo de Pomaire y la ciudad de Santiago.  Ya que realiza arreglos florales. Gladys comenta que fue autodidacta para aprender el oficio. 
Con el crédito comprará cacharritos de greda y flores secas. 
Sus metas en su negocio son tener un local establecido, ya que actualmente vende sus productos en una feria artesanal los días de pago de sueldo de sus clientes.
Gladys vive junto a su marido y su hijo de 20 años de edad, quien trabaja de manera dependiente y sus anhelos son estudiar dibujo grafico, además le ayuda en su negocio. 
Por ende uno de sus sueños es que su hijo sea un profesional. 
Ella está muy agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, no solo por el crédito sino a todo nivel, ya que además disfruta mucho de las reuniones, los temas que se desarrollan en éstas y la solidaridad y buenas relaciones interpersonales al interior del grupo del banco comunal. 
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
The “Pemuco Crece Contigo” (Pemuco Grows With You) community bank is made up of 19 entrepreneurs who work in different fields including selling clothes, selling underwear, making spicy sausages, and making smoked pork.  They all live in the city of Chillán.

Gladys is the second person from the right in the photo.  She is wearing a red jacket and black pants.  She is in the handicrafts business.  She buys clay vases and dried flowers in the village of Pomaire and the city of Santiago.  She makes flower arrangements.  Gladys tells us that she taught herself this trade.  She will use her loan to buy clay vases and dried flowers.  Her goals for her business are to have established premises since she currently sells her products in a craft fair on the days her customers are paid.

Gladys lives together with her husband and her 20 year-old son who works for a company and longs to study graphic design.  He also helps his mom in her business.

One of Gladys' dreams is for her son to become a professional.

Gladys is very grateful for the opportunity that she has been given by Fondo Esperanza, not only for the loan but at all levels since she also really enjoys her community bank meetings, the topics that they cover in these meetings and also the solidarity and good interpersonal relationships that exist within the community bank.

Chillán is a town in the central-south area of Chile.  The name means 'chair of the sun' in Mapundungun, the language of our Mapuche indigenous people.  Chillán is known as the 'Cradle of the Nation' or 'Land of Artists' owing to the fact that prominent people from Chile's history, such as the well-known pianist Claudio Arrau, were born here.

loans.use: to buy clay vases and dried flowers

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es: Este cliente se dedica a la agricultura y labora como vigilante desde hace más de cinco años para un dueño de fincas a orillas del mar actualmente el estado civil es acompañado. Ha tenido  nueve créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha destinado a la  compra de insumo agrícola para la siembra de maíz, trigo etc. Para mejorar su cultivo, estos créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado para mejorar el nivel de vida de la unidad familiar.
texts.en: This client farms and has worked as a security guard for a plantation owner by the sea for more than five years.  His current marital status is 'living with somebody'.  He has had nine loans from CEPRODEL and has used each one to buy agricultural supplies for growing corn, wheat, etc. in order to improve his crops.  His loans from CEPRODEL have been useful as they have enabled him to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for sowing two 'manzanas' (3.36 acres) of corn

loans.name: Custodio

texts.es: El señor Custodio nació en Mairana Provincia Florida del departamento de Santa Cruz,  casado con la Sra. Benita tienen 7 hijos algunos todavía se encuentran en edad escolar, trabajan en la Pampa el Cosal a 30 km de San Luis, donde tiene su parcela y su casa el trabaja agricultura siembra maíz, sandia, poroto pero más se dedica a la ganadería, también tiene su Huerta de cítricos como ser Naranja y Mandarina, sus hijos le ayudan el lo que es la siembra y su esposa en comercializar los productos en el mercado de la zona, el dinero del crédito es para la compra de motocicleta ya que necesita para transportarse, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Custodio lives in Mairana Province, Florida, Santa Cruz, and is married to Benita; they have 7 school-age children.  They work in Pampa el Cosal, 30 km from San Luis, where they have an agricultural plot and plant corn, watermelon, citrus, mandarin oranges and other crops.  They also raise cattle, and with the help of their children they harvest and market their crops in local markets.  They plan to use this loan to buy a motorcycle, to more efficiently transport their products.  Custodio is a hard worker and is grateful for this credit.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina tiene 2 hijos y los quiere mucho. Ella siempre lucha por salir adelante pues todos los días sale a visitar las diferentes casas distribuidoras como Avon, Zelsa, Vogue entre otros productos ella sale todos los días por la mañana a ofrecer sus productos, ya que tienen que buscar la forma de vender los productos a sus diferentes clientes. Ella sueña con sacar adelante a sus hijos y proporcionarle todo lo necesario. El financiamiento es para la compra de cremas, colonias, tratamientos, shampoo, ropa interior, perfumes entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Carolina has two children, and she loves them very much.  She always struggles to get ahead.  Every day she goes to the different distributers like Avon, Zelsa, and Vogue, among others.  She leaves every day in the morning to offer her products.  She has to find the way to sell the products to her different customers.

She dreams of getting her children ahead and of giving them all of the necessities.

The loan is to buy creams, colognes, treatments, shampoo, underwear, and perfume, among other products.

loans.use: to buy creams, colognes, treatments, shampoo, underwear, and perfume, among other products.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther tiene 58 años, es una mujer que siempre ha luchado en la vida, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. El negocio de Esther es la costura, su trabajo es muy solicitado en su barrio, ya que es la única que realiza esta actividad, ella aprendió desde muy pequeña junto a su madre y ahora tiene su propio taller, donde atiende con mucha paciencia a sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es terminar los trabajos que le encargan. Lleva 44 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo, es tener que trabajar todo el día cuando tiene un pedido muy grande. Espera que en el futuro, su negocio sea más conocido y así pueda crecer más, para ello esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro y sin descanso. Este es el décimo quinto crédito con MFP, pero sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y esta dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que no quiere causar problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida y apreciada. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará una maquina remalladora nueva, así de esta manera espera incrementar su producción y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Esther, age 58, is a woman who has always struggled in her life.  She lives in her own house, and what she wishes for the most is to work very hard in order to improve her quality of life.  Esther is a seamstress.  There is great demand for her work in her neighborhood.  This is because she is the only one there with this type of business.

She learned when she was very young together with her mother.  Now she has her own shop where she patiently waits on her customers.  What she likes the most about her business is finishing her orders.  She has been doing this business activity for 44 years.  She considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to work all day when she has a very large order. 

She hopes that in the future her business will become better known.  That way it will grow more.  In order to do this she is ready to work very hard without rest.

This is her 15th loan with MFP.  She knows that she needs to make her payments on time, and she is prepared to do so.  She does not want to cause problems for the members of her communal bank, where she is a very well-liked and valued member.  She will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy a new overlock machine.  This is the way she hopes to increase her production and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy and overlock machine

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.es: Carmelina tiene 40 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería, como madre responsable debe buscar la manera de mejorar las condiciones de vida. Ella tiene un hijo a su cargo, ella tiene que proporcionarle lo necesario como es la vestimenta y el pan de cada día. Inicio hace 12 años por cuenta propia porque no tenía un trabajo ella poseía mucha fortaleza esto la motivo a establecer una pulpería, al inicio Carmelina no tenía la experiencia en este negocio, pero eso lo fue obteniendo con el paso del tiempo. Ella solicita este financiamiento y así comprar golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas y granos básicos. Ella sueña convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Carmelina, age 40, has a grocery store.  As a responsible mother, she needs to look for the way to improve their living conditions.  She has one child under her care.  She needs to provide him with the necessities like clothing and food.  

She started on her own 12 years ago because she did not have work.  She had a lot of fortitude, and this motivated her to establish a grocery store.  In the beginning, Carmelina did not have experience in this business.  However, she was getting it as time passed.

She is requesting this loan to buy sweets, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and basic grains.

She dreams of converting her grocery store into a distributorship.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and basic grains.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Gilberto de 58 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y amable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Lita de 48 años y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo de Gilberto es la venta de pescado, tiene su puesto en el puerto de pescadores en la ciudad de Pucallpa, el cual es muy concurrido por sus clientes, ya que él vende el pescado más fresco y sabroso del mercado, además que es un vendedor muy alegre, que siempre saca a sus clientes una sonrisa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y bromear entre ellos, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que los más difícil es soportar el intenso olor que sale de los pescados, ya que este se le pega en la ropa y prácticamente tiene que soportarlo todo el día. Espera tener en el futuro un pequeño frigorífico donde pueda vender su pescado sin temor a que se malogren con el calor del sol. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, se siente muy feliz por haberlo obtenido y espera poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es un socio muy querido, por la alegría que pone en el grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más pescado para tener más mercadería para vender.
texts.en: 58 year old Gilberto is a very simple and friendly man. He lives in his own house along with his wife, Lita, who is 48. What he most wants is to work very hard in order to improve his quality of life. Gilberto's job is to sell fish. He has a stall in the fishermen's port in the city of Pucallpa, which is very popular with his customers as he sells the freshest and most tasty fish in the market and because he is a very happy vendor who always gives his customers a smile. What he most likes about his work is talking with his customers and joking with them. He has been doing this work for 5 years and thinks the most difficult thing is putting up with the strong smell of the fish as this gets into his clothes and he has to put up with it almost the whole day. For the future, he wants to have a little fridge from which he can sell his fish without fear of them going off in the heat of the sun. This is his third loan from MFP and he is very grateful for it and hopes to be able to make all his repayments on time. He is a well-loved member of his community bank because of the happiness that he brings to the group. He will use the $750 he is requesting to buy more fish so that he can have a greater amount of merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Las Leonas Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento LAS LEONAS es un banco nuevo  y el Banco está conformado por 9 Integrantes todas son Mujeres  y las señoras se dedican al comercio y venta pollos y otros, y la Sra. DORA es la presidenta del Banco y  tiene un hijo y ella se dedica a la repostería a la elaboración D. galletas empanadas tortas queque, y variedad D. galletas, actividad donD. le v a muy bien y con el préstamo  comprara harina e insumos para la elaboración D. galletas es una persona muy trabajadora y siempre pensando en el bienestar D. su hijo, su deseo es el ve der a su hijo profesional y también poder tener su propia pastelería ya que ahora elabora sus productos y entrega en la zona y también en algunos colegios, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The entrepreneurs loan group Las Leonas (The Lions) is a new group and is comprised of 9 members who are all women. The women work in commerce and sell chickens and other things. Dora is the president of the bank and she has a son and works making cookies, empanadas, pies, cakes and a variety of cookies, a business that is doing very well, and she will use the loan to buy flour and supplies to make cookies. She is a very hardworking person and she is always thinking of the well being of her son. Her wish is to see her son become a professional and also to have her own cake store as she currently makes her goods and delivers them in the area and to some schools. She is grateful to the loan institution for the support offered to her.

loans.use: to buy flour to make cookies and tarts.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: Maria José tiene 43 años, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a ofrecer a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos, por lo que siempre ha buscado la forma de generar ingresos a su familia. Tiene una gran experiencia, la mayoría de sus clientes se encuentran satisfechos por el buen servicio que ofrece. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de perfumes, pantalones, vestidos, trajes, faldas, ropa interior.
texts.en: Maria José is 43 years old and she works selling clothes. She has been doing this for more than 7 years and she offers her clients a large variety of products. She has always sought means to generate income for her family. She has lots of experience and the majority of her customers are satisfied with the good service that she offers. The loan that she is requesting is for buying perfumes, pants, dresses, suits, skirts, and underwear.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, pants, dresses, suits, skirts and underwear.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Gilberto, de 54 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. El día de Gilberto comienza muy temprano, aproximadamente a las 6 de la mañana sale junto a su inseparable motocarro en busca de personas que necesiten de sus servicios. Él es una persona muy carismática, lo cual ha hecho que los clientes no le falten y que su motocarro sea uno de los más solicitados de su barrio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con los pasajeros y hacerles más ameno el viaje, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil para él es tener que realizar jornadas de trabajo de casi 16 horas, lo cual para su edad es muy cansado y lo desgasta mucho, espera poder comprar en el futuro otro motocarro y así generarse mejores ingresos económicos. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, está dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no desea causar problemas en su banco comunal, en donde es muy querido, por la alegría que demuestra. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados, hará arreglar su motocarro, puesto que con el tiempo ha ido fallando y ya es hora de que le de mantenimiento técnico.
texts.en: 54 year old Gilberto is a simple and hardworking man who lives in his own home and who most wants to work hard to improve his quality of life. Gilberto's day begins very early: at about 6am he leaves home with his trusty motorcycle-taxi to search for people who need his service. He is a very charismatic person, which means that his customers stay loyal and that his motorcycle-taxi is one of the most requested in the neighborhood. What he likes most about his work is talking to the passengers and making their trips enjoyable. He has been doing this work for 2 years and the most difficult thing for him is that sometimes he has to work almost 16 hours in a day and because of his age this makes him very tired and he dislikes this very much. He hopes to buy another motorcycle-taxi in the future and so generate more income. This is the second loan he has had from MFP and he is disposed to make his repayments on time as he doesn't want to cause problems for the community bank, in which he is well-loved for his happiness. He will use the $225 he is requesting to fix his motorcycle-taxi because it has had some problems and this is the right time to do some maintenance.

loans.use: to maintain his motorbike.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, etc.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es: Jhonny de 30 años, es un hombre muy amble y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa María de 29 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Moisés de 10 y Jack de 1 año, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Para Jhonny los largos días de trabajo son parte de su rutina, él se despierta a las 6 de la mañana y junto a su motocarro, sale en busca de clientes que deseen llegar rápido y seguros a su destino. Después de recorrer las calles de la ciudad de Pucallpa y llegadas las 10 de la noche, guarda su motocarro y descansa, sabiendo que al día siguiente le espera otra larga jornada laboral. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus pasajeros y hacerles más ameno el viaje, lleva 15 años en este trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar todo el día alejado de su familia. Con el tiempo desea poner una tienda para que sea administrada por su esposa. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, nunca ha tenido problemas en su pagos, pues siempre ahorra para pagarlos a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy querido, pues siempre llega muy puntual. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevos asientos para su motocarro, ya que los que tiene actualmente ya están muy gastados.
texts.en:
Jhonny is 30 years old.  He is a very kind and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 29 year-old María, and his two beloved children, 10 year-old Moisés and 1 year-old Jack, who he would like to provide with a better quality of life.

For Jhonny, long work days are part of his routine.  He wakes up at 6 o'clock in the morning and, together with his motorcycle taxi, he goes out in search of customers who would like to arrive quickly and safely at their destinations.  After driving through the streets of the city of Pucallpa all day, at 10 o'clock at night he puts his vehicle away and rests, knowing that another long day of work awaits him the next day.

What Jhonny most enjoys about his work is chatting to his passengers and making their trip more pleasant.  He has been in this business for 15 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be having to work all day away from his family.  Over time, he would like to set up a store for his wife to run.

This is Jhonny's second loan from MFP and he has never had any problems in making his repayments.  He always saves up so that he can make his repayments on time.  He is a very well-liked member of his community bank who always arrives very punctually.  He will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles he is requesting to buy new seats for his vehicle since the ones he has right now are very worn.

loans.use: to buy seats for his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 62 años, es un hombre muy amable y sencillo, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Sarela, de 57 años y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro con tal de mejorar su calidad de vida. Para José recorrer con su taxi las calles de la ciudad de Pucallpa constituye su forma de ganarse la vida, él sale todos los días en busca de personas que deseen llegar de manera rápida y segura a su destino. Por lo general siempre ofrece el servicio nunca le falta trabajo, generándose muchas ganancias.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es manejar por las calles de Pucallpa, lleva 25 años en esta actividad, los cual le ha servido para conocer cada calle de esta ciudad. Espera en el futuro comprar un taxi nuevo y ponerlo a trabajar en la misma empresa, lo más difícil para José es tener que trabajar de madrugada, ya que lo peligroso de la ciudad hace que las largas noches sean terribles. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y esta dispuesto a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es muy responsable, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a sus socias. Los mil nuevos soles solicitados, los invertirá en arreglar su taxi, para así poder brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: José is 62 years old. He is a very kind and humble man. He lives in his own home with his wife Sarela, who is 57 years old. He is willing to work very hard in order to improve his life. For José, driving the streets of the city of Pucallpa is the way he makes his living. He goes out everyday looking for people who need a quick and safe way to get to their destination. In general, he always offers his service and never lacks work, generating a lot of income. What he likes the most about his job is driving the streets of Pucallpa. He has been doing this activity for 25 years, with which he has been able to get to know every street in this city. In the future he hopes to buy a new taxi and work it in the same business. The hardest thing for José is having to get up in the early morning, since the danger of the city makes the long nights terrible. This is his third loan with MFP. He knows that he has to make all of his payments on time and he is willing to do this. He is very responsible in his community bank, since he doesn't want to cause his partners any trouble. The thousand nuevos soles he has asked for he will invest in fixing his taxi in order to offer his customers a better service.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies in order to grow beans and corn.

loans.name: Mirania Yessenia

texts.es: Esta clienta es trabajadora activa de un centro turístico ubicado en las costas de pochomil desempeñándose como ayudante de cocina,  tiene dos años de trabajar para esta institución es madre de un hijo en edad escolar, acompañada. Con la institución es el crédito numero dos que solicita para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y tener mejores condiciones de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en: This borrower is employed in a tourist center located along the Pochomil coast, where she works as kitchen aid. She has been working with this institution for two years, she has a child who goes to school and she lives in a common-law marriage. This is the second loan she has requested to the institution, and she will use it to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone and piedrín (a type of building stone) that will be used to enlarge and improve her house and to provide better living conditions to herself and to her family.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as sand, stone and cement to improve and enlarge her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials to improve and enlarge her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sand, cement, stone, piedrín and blocks.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 37 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 5 children. Jocelyn has a business selling snacks, earning about PHP 1,500 each month. Jocelyn has a requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase raw ingredients to prepare her snacks. Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Jocelyn would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks

loans.name: Welma

texts.en: Welma is married and has 6 children. She is 41 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. Welma has run a business selling snacks for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase raw ingredients to prepare her snacks. Welma has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Welma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks

location.town: Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy products to improve his wife's grains selling activity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies to harvest maize, beans and wheat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials to enlarge and improve his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To by construction materials to enlarge and improve his house.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Este cliente es un pequeño productor de granos básicos especialmente maíz y trigo, tiene mas de catorce años de dedicarse a esta actividad, cuenta con sus propios medios de producción tales como una yunta de bueyes, arado así como una cultivadora. Este y todos los créditos han sido para compra de Insumos agrícolas. La inversión la hace con el apoyo de la familia los que trabajan en conjunto para alcanzar sus objetivos el de obtener buenos rendimientos en la cosecha.
texts.en: This client is a small-scale producer of basic grains, especially corn and wheat.  He has been in this business for more than fourteen years.  He has his own means of production such as a yoke of oxen and a plow.  This loan, in common with all the other loans he has received, will be used to buy agricultural supplies.  He makes this investment with the support of his family who work with him in order to reach his goals of obtaining a good yield from his harvest.

loans.use: to buy supplies for growing corn and kidney beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies (sand, cement, stone, gravel, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies such as sand and cement, and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies such as corrugated metal sheets, sand and blocks

loans.name: Narciso De Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Masaya, reside don  Narciso de Jesús, quien labora para la institución de Enacal desde hace seis años, como Fontanero, es casado con tres hijos menores es por ellos que trabaja  arduamente para darle las condiciones necesarias.
Unas de las necesidades que está atravesando la familia de don Narciso es la condición del techo de su vivienda ya que estamos en temporada de invierno y el techo de su casas ya no le sirve, es por eso que  se acerco a las oficina de Ceprodel  para solicitarnos un crédito para poder realizar compras como Zinc y perlin  y así por medio de este mejoramiento le dará mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Narciso de Jesús lives in the city of Masaya.  He has worked as a plumber for Enacal for six years.  He is married and has three dependent children for whom he works hard in order to provide them with what they need.

One of the needs that Narciso's family currently has is the need to improve the condition of the roof of their house since we are in the winter season now and their roof is no good.  For this reason, he approached Ceprodel's offices to request a loan so that he could buy sheets or corrugated metal and beams in order to make this improvement which will improve his wife and children's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sheets of corrugated metal and beams

loans.name: Rosalpina

texts.es:
Rosa, de 50 años de edad, habita en Pueblo Nuevo, municipio de Estelí, esta casada es madre de 2 hijos, ella es maestra de matemáticas en una escuela primaria y a la ves es comerciante vende ropa y zapato.  Ella inicio su negocio en el año 1992, con la ayuda de su esposa y el salario que recibía como maestra al transcurrir el tiempo fue ampliando y mejorando su inventario de ropa y zapatos ahora lo tiene un poco más surtido.    
Ella solicito el préstamo para la compra de ropa y zapatos para su venta. Ella espera tener abastecido su inventario con nuevo y variados productos para ofertar a sus clientes y mejorar sus ventas. En sus planes futuros esta hacerle mejoras de infraestructura a su negocio y su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 50 years old and lives in Pueblo Nuevo, in Estelí.  She is married and has two children.  Rosa is a math teacher in an elementary school and also sells clothes and shoes.  She started her business in 1992 with the help of her husband and the salary she received from her teaching job.  Over time she has expanded her business and improved her stock of clothes and shoes.  Now her business is a little better stocked.

Rosa requested a loan to buy clothes and shoes to sell.  She hopes to stock her business with a variety of new products to offer her customers and thereby improve her sales.  Some of her plans for the future are to make improvements to the infrastructure of her business and her home.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies such as sand, cement, wood and sheets of corrugated metal

loans.name: Edis Manuel

texts.en:
Edis Manuel lives in the city of Masaya.  He has worked for Enacal for nine years, maintaining a pipe that carries potable water.  He is married and has three dependent children for whom he works hard in order to provide them with what they need.

One of the needs that Edis Manuel's family has right now is the need to improve the condition of the roof and floor of their home since we are in the winter season and their roof is no good.  Their house floor is just bare ground.  Their children are little and it is affecting their health.  Edis Manuel approached Ceprodel's office to request a loan so that he could buy sheets of corrugated metal, beams, cement and sand in order to make this improvement which will provide him with a decent home and a better quality of life for his children and his wife.

Translated from Spanish: 

En la ciudad de Masaya, reside don  Edis Manuel, quien labora para la institución de Enacal desde hace nueve años en mantanimiento de la tuberia de agua potable , es casado con tres hijos menores. Trabaja  arduamente para darle las condiciones necesarias.

Unas de las necesidades que está atravesando la familia de don Edis es la condición del techo y el piso de su vivienda ya que estamos en temporada de invierno y el techo de su casas ya no le sirve y por consiguiente el piso de su casa es de suelo y sus hijos son pequeños y el suelo le está afectando su salud, se acerco a las oficina de Ceprodel  para solicitarnos un crédito para poder realizar compras como Zinc, perlin, cemento y arena  y así por medio de este mejoramiento le dará en techo digno y mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y su esposa.

loans.use: to buy sheets of corrugated metal and bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for minor surgery to his nose.

loans.name: Reynalda Indiana

texts.es: Este cliente se desempeña como conserje en una empresa turísticas de Nicaragua desde hace mas de dos años se dedica a esta actividad de limpieza de oficinas, solicita financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción para la remodelación  de un cuarto de habitación, ella es madre de dos hijos en edades escolares. La Sra.reconoce que estos organismos ayudan al desarrollo de la sociedad porque de lo contrario es difícil hacer mejoras en el hogar.
texts.en: This borrower works as a cleaner for a tourism company in Nicaragua. She has dedicated herself to this work of cleaning offices for more than two years. She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to remodel a room. She is the mother of two school-aged children. She recognizes that organizations like this help the development of society, because without them, it is difficult to make home improvements.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, stone tiles, concrete blocks, etc.

loans.name: Ismael Antonio

texts.es:
Don Ismael habita en San Sebastian un pueblo localizada en Yali municipal de Jinotega, el tiene52 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos. El se dedica a la agricultura específicamente a la siembra de café. Empezó  trabajar con la siembra de café hace 7 años pues antes se dedicaba a la siembra de granos básicos, su finca la adquirió a través de una herencia después con el tiempo vendió parte de su finca para comprar 7 manzanas de café. El ha sido un hombre emprendor  a pesar que no finalizo sus estudios. Hoy en día además de dedicarse a la siembra  de café, tiene un ciber café y vende repuestos. 
El esta solicitando el préstamo para terminar de sembrar café y comprar abono para preparar la tierra. Con esta inversión espera sacar una producción de café con excelentes rendimientos  y venderlo a un buen precio que le genere ganancias. En sus planes futuros esta ampliar su siembra de café para convertir en un productor mayorista de café orgánico para sacar adelante a su mayor prioridad su familia.
texts.en:
Ismael lives in San Sebastián, a village which is located in Yali, in Jinotega.  He is 52 years old, married, and has two children.  He is a coffee farmer.  Ismael started growing coffee seven years ago.  Before that he used to grow basic grains.  He acquired his farm through an inheritance.  Over time, he sold part of his farm to buy seven 'manzanas' (one 'manzana' = 1.68 acres) of coffee.  He has been an enterprising man even though he didn't finish his schooling.  Now, in addition to growing coffee, he also owns an Internet cafe and sells spare parts.

Ismael is requesting a loan to finish sowing his coffee and to buy manure in order to prepare his land.  Through this investment, he hopes to achieve an excellent yield of coffee and sell it for a good price which will make him profits.  His future plans include expanding his coffee growing so that he can become a wholesale producer of organic coffee.  In this way, he will be able to get his family, who are his main priority, ahead in life.

loans.use: to grow coffee and buy manure to prepare his land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for growing basic grains and to buy building supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand and gravel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school shoes for men, women, and children.

loans.name: Carlos José

texts.es: Este cliente se dedica a la agricultura, tiene más de 25 años de experiencia en la actividad agrícola, los rubros que más cultiva es el maíz, trigo y arroz. Con la institución es el crédito número tres que solicita para gastos agrícolas, es padre de cinco  hijos, de estado civil casado. Estos créditos le han beneficiado para desarrollarse en la actividad agrícola y para la obtención de más ingresos para la unidad familia.
texts.en:
This client devotes himself to agriculture.  He has over 25 years of experience in agriculture.  The crops he grows the most are corn, wheat, and rice.

This is the third loan that he has requested from the institution.  The loan is for agricultural expenses. 

He is married and has five children.

These loans have helped him develop his agricultural activity in order to get more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like complete urea and to pay for the labor to plant corn and wheat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corrugated metal roofing and roofing beams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials like sand, cement, and zinc to expand and repair his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials like sand, cement, and corrugated metal roofing to expand and repair his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc and wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, cement, laminates, beams, stone, sand, etc.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: Este cliente es trabajador activo de un centro turístico ubicado en las costas de masachapa, desempeñándose como cocinero  tiene  dos años de trabajar para esta institución es casado  actualmente tiene dos hijo en edad escolar. Este es el segundo crédito con CEPRODEL para ampliación y mejora de vivienda los materiales a comprar es arena, piedras canteras, cemento, piedrín y pago de mano de obra.
texts.en: This client is an active worker in a holiday resort on the shores of Masachapa, where he works as a chef.   He has been working for this establishment for two years, and is currently married with two school-age children. This is his second loan through CEPRODEL for expansion and improvement of his home. The materials he needs to buy are sand, quarried stone, cement, gravel, and to pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, quarried stone, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials: sand, cement, stone, gravel, cinder-blocks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for planting an area of cabbage, and paying for labor.

loans.name: Febelyn

texts.en:
Febelyn is now 28 years old, married and has 2 infant-aged children. She has a retail shop where she sells dry goods and footwear. She has been in this business for almost 5 years. 

Febelyn is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase additional inventory of clothes and footwear to sell. Each month, Febelyn earns about PHP 9,000 in doing this type of work.

In the future, Febelyn hopes to make her business grow, considering the fact that this is the only way of gaining income. She believes that with the continuous support and assistance of the Kiva lenders, she can be able to make her business viable and hopes that each of her children will have a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of clothes and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Marivick

texts.en:
Marivick is now 38 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She has a retail shop where she sells dry goods such as different kinds of clothing. Marivick has been in this business for almost 13 years. 

Marivick is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase additional clothes to sell. Each month, Marivick earns about PHP 8,000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Marivick hopes to improve this business in order to help her husband in gaining income to support their family needs, especially for the education of their children. She believes that she can be able to improve her business through the continuous support and assistance of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes to sell.

location.town: Brgy. San Fernando, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Midred is married and she is now 51 years old. She owns and manages a small general store where she sells different grocery items. Mildred has been in this business for almost 7 years. 

Mildred is asking for a loan of PHP 18,000 to purchase canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar and bread to sell. She usually earns about PHP 6,000 each month in this business.

In the future, Mildred hopes to make her business grow in order to earn a higher income to help her husband in gaining income for the sake of their children's futures. She is thankful with the financial assistance offered by the Kiva lenders that helps her to strengthen her small business. She believes that she can improve it with the continuous support and assistance of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar and bread to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hard working mother who is now 56 years of age with four adult children. Teresita is a farmer working in the Philippines. She earns PHP 6,500 per month. 

Teresita is asking for a loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase additional breeding livestock and feeds. Teresita raises hogs and has been doing this for almost 9 years.

In the future, Teresita hopes to improve the business she manages since this is one of the sources of their income. She is thankful with the Kiva lenders who offered a financial assistance to her business. She believes that with their continuous support and assistance she can able to improve through hard work and strong determination.

loans.use: to purchase additional breeding livestock and feed.

loans.name: Elsita

texts.en:
Elsita is a hard working mother who has 4 school-aged children. She is now 42 years old and has had a food selling business for almost 5 years. 

Elsita sells food like hard boiled eggs, boiled chicken embryo (balut), fruits and vegetables, to the people in her community. Elsita earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month in her food selling business. 

Elsita is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell.

In the future, Elsita hopes to become successful in this kind of business through the continuous assistance of the Kiva lenders. She believes that someday, her business will grow more and their children will finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new tires and sprocket to provide better service

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in Vanadzor and she is 35 years old.  Marine is married and has two under age children: a son and a daughter. 

Marine has engaged in woman's and children's clothes trading for about 5 years.  She rents a part of a shop where she resells clothes, which she buys from Yerevan.  Once a month Marine and her colleagues from the same shop rent a car and go to Yerevan to purchase products and thereby thanks to joint action they decrease their expenses. 

Marine says that children's clothes are always in demand, so she intends to enlarge children's clothes assortment at her stall.  Therefore, Marine is asking for a 500.000 Armenian drams loan.

loans.use: to enlarge children's clothes assortment at her stall

loans.name: Anna

texts.ru:
Анна торгует женской обувью на рынке. Она начала этот бизнес 7 лет назад. За это время она смогла хорошо освоиться и развить бизнес. У нее много постоянных клиентов, которые у удовольствием покупают обувь у Анны. 

Анна – оптимистична и предприимчива. Именно  качества позволяют ей идти дальше, невзирая на экономические трудности и невзгоды. Анна хочет открыть еще одну точку на рыке и увеличить оборот. Анна просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен. Она надеется получить дополнительную прибыль и улучшить свой быт. Анна замужем, они с мужем имеют одного сына.
texts.en: Anna sells women's shoes at the market.  She started this business seven years ago.  During this time, she was able to familiarize herself with and develop the business well.  She has many loyal customers, who buy shoes from Anna with satisfaction.  Anna is optimistic and entrepreneurial.  These qualities allow her to go further, regardless of economic difficulties and adversities.  Anna wants to open one more retail outlet at the market and increase her goods turnover.  Anna is requesting a loan in the sum of 20,000 hryvnias.  She hopes to get an additional profit and improve her livelihood.  Anna is married, and her husband and her have one son.

loans.use: to obtain summer merchandise and increase selection

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is married with 6 children.  Carmelita is 57 years old and lives in Ubay,Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Carmelita sells food for snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 7 years.  She has requested a loan for 3,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending.

Carmelita joined PMPC as a new member this year.  In the future, Carmelita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional piglets to raise and feed for them

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is single.  Esterlita is 59 years old and lives in Ozamis City.

To earn a living, Esterlita has a clothing sales business.  She has had this business for 5 years.  Each month, she earns approximately PHP 6,000.  She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to purchase more clothing for her clothing business.  Esterlita is a new member of PMPC who joined this year.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for her clothing sales

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet, a 40-year-old mother who is blessed with three school-aged children, owns and manages a general store where she sells rice and agricultural supplies. In business for almost one year, she usually earns about PHP 7,000 each month. Now requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional stocks of rice and agricultural supplies, Juliet hopes to improve this business in order to give her children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of rice and agricultural supplies to sell.

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en: Nemesia, a 46-year-old married mother of five children, lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis City where she has had a general store that sells a variety of products  for six years.  A member of PMPC for four years, Nemesia is requesting a loan for 10,000 to purchase more stocks for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros, a 38-year-old mother of four married to an overseas Filipino worker, has been growing rice for eight years and is thankful because her husband helps her in maintaining their business. Since Milagrosis can earn about PHP20000 every cropping, they are able to sustain the needs of their children, who are studying, as well as purchase feed supplies for her hogs.

Due to the high cost of basic commodities, Milagros is requesting a loan of PHP15000 to purchase fertilizer and insecticides for her farm. Thankful to all Kiva supporters, she hopes to make her farm more productive in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticides for her farm.

loans.name: Navuth

texts.en:
Navuth, who sells vegetables and fruits and is married to a chef, received a previous Kiva loan to build a brick room under her wooden house. She now plans to organize the room by laying bricks and plastering the ceiling and the wall in order to visually enhance it and so is requesting another loan for $1,000 to complete the project.

The couple lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Photo: Navuth and her husband.

loans.use: to organize her brick room by laying bricks and plastering the ceiling and the wall in order to visually enhance it.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary (in the photo) is a rice farmer, while her husband is a wooden-house builder who hopes to supplement their income by starting a new business driving a Tuk Tuk taxi. Nary is therefore requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her husband.

The family lives along National Road Number One, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

loans.use: to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her husband.

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Theary, pictured here, is 28 years old and her husband, Chan, is 27 years old. Theary is a garment worker and her husband is a farmer and fisherman. The couple lives in a village along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penn City. They have been married since 2002 and have three daughters. One of their daughters is in school and other two are still young. 

Theary is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to help her husband’s farming business by purchasing seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain his vegetable farm. She will also use her loan to build a shelter to shade his vegetables from the sun.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide and build a shelter

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea, pictured here, is a construction worker and his wife is a farmer. The couple has been married since 2009 and has a young daughter. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sothea is requesting a loan to buy a cow to raise and sell when it grows big enough.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to raise and sell

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Noun, pictured here, is a construction worker. His wife, Thoun, stays at home and does housework. The couple lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn City. They have four daughters.

Noun is requesting a Kiva loan to improve and organize his house by building a brick room. He has decided to request another Kiva loan for the purpose of laying brick and plastering the ceiling and wall to visually enhance his home.

loans.use: to enhance his home by building a brick room

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Phea, who is pictured here, is a tuk-tuk taxi driver. His wife stays at home and does house work. The couple lives in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three young children, one son and two daughters. 

Phea is requesting a Kiva loan of 1,000 USD to help his brother buy a motorcycle to commute to work. This will be his second loan.

loans.use: to help his brother buy a motorcycle to commute to work

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is 19 years old and still single. She earns about 15,000 PHP per harvest as a rice farmer working in the Philippines. May has been growing rice for the past three years and is thankful that she is able to maintain her business.

Due to the expensive cost of farm supplies, May is requesting a loan of 27,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and insecticides. In the future, May hopes to expand her rice farming business and improve her income to save for the future. She hopes that her loan will be granted.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticides for her farm

loans.name: Savet

texts.en: Savet (pictured here with her mother) is a tailor. She is single and lives with her widowed mother on an island located fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is applying for a loan of $1,000 to assist her brother in buying a cow to raise.

loans.use: to assist her brother in buying a cow to raise.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap (pictured here with her loom) is a weaver. Her husband is a house builder. The couple live on an island located fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2000 and have two young daughters. 

Sopheap is asking for a loan of $200 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Yeun

texts.en:
Yeun (in the photo) is 52 years old and his wife, Vannsrey, is 46. They live along National Road two, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1983 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. One of their children has full-time employment, another one is a teacher and the third one attends school.   

Yeun is a policeman. His wife raises chickens and ducks at home. He is asking for a loan of $1,000 to assist his wife in buying additional chickens and ducks to raise and to build chicken coop.

loans.use: to assist his wife in buying additional chickens and ducks to raise and to build chicken coop.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 32 years old and still single. He earns about PHP 40,000 for every crop harvest. He is so grateful because of his sacrifices and hard work; his rice farming business is improving.

Solomon grows rice and has been doing it for 2 years. In order to make his business more productive, he is asking for additional capital of PHP35,000 to buy fertilizer, insecticides and payment for some helper in their farm. He hopes that his loan request will be approved. The loan will be very helpful in gaining his income and saving some funds for his future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and payment for some helpers on their farm.

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Ganchimeg, 35, is a doctor. She lives with her husband ,36, and child, 16, in the old communal apartments of Darkhan, second largest city in Mongolia. Mrs. Ganchimeg is the type of person who strongly wants to improve her family life conditions and to set definite goals for her life and her job. She has been working as a doctor in secondary school #9 of Darkhan city since 2010 and had the same type of work experience between 1999-2002 in another secondary school. She left her previous job because of illness. Her husband has been a teacher of physical training in the same school since 2004. This family has never been able to make repairs to their old apartment since they bought it. 

Mrs. Ganchimeg and her husband are planning to do a repair to their old apartment. They need to buy some construction materials and to hire the repairmen. Therefore the loan she is requesting will be dedicated to do these repairs to their old apartment. She said "Thank you very much, Kiva, for helping my family!"

loans.use: to make a repair to her home apartment.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 39 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Three of her children are still studying, while the other child is already married. Due to expensive supplies needed on the farm, Zenaida hasn't been able to sustain all the needs of her family. She is doing her best to provide for all their needs as well as the needs of her business. She earns about PHP30,000 every crop harvest.

Zenaida grows rice and has been doing this business for 21 years. Because of insufficient capital, she would like to ask for a loan of PHP20,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

She is hoping that everything will be alright through granting her requested loan. The said amount will be very beneficial in gaining her income and providing for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is married and the mother of five children: four sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is a painter and paints walls, buildings, etc., while her second son works with his father at his restaurant. Her remaining three children are getting their education attending a local school. 

Khursheed's husband runs a Punjabi food restaurant in the nearby market. He is expert at making Punjabi food and has a good number of clients who come to his restaurant daily for food. Khursheed herself is a housewife. She stays at her home and carries out her household responsibilities. In her spare time, she also helps her husband by preparing food for his restaurant. 

Khursheed has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to help her husband improve his business. With this loan, he will buy the required ingredients to be able to prepare better quality food and also buy some chairs and tables to provide better seating for his clients. He has been in this business for the past many years and Khursheed is optimistic about the growth of her husband’s business after this loan investment. She is a regular Asasah client and this is her third loan application. In previous years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: to buy required ingredients, chairs and tables for a restaurant business.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is 53 years old and married. He has only one child. He really works hard to be able to provide for the needs of his family and to become successful in his business.

Wilfredo grows rice, which he has been doing for 33 years. According to him, he is able to earn about PHP30,000 every crop harvest. The profit he generates from his business is not enough. He is asking for additional capital of PHP25,000, which will be used for the maintenance of his rice farm. He will purchase supplies such as fertilizer and insecticides. Some amounts will be used for the payment of the laborers on the farm. He is hoping that he could avail this loan amount so that he can sustain the needs of his family and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and to pay for the laborer in the farm.

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is a housewife that stays at home doing her household responsibilities. On a part-time basis, she also does embroidery. This helps her pay utility bills and other little household expenses. She has given birth to five sons and two daughters. She is a very caring mother who is raising her children very well. Unfortunately, due to financial constraints, she couldn’t educate her elder children. Her four elder sons do different kind of work to financially contribute to the family, while her younger children are getting their education. 

Zubaida's husband sells fruit from a cart. He believes in providing fresh quality fruit to his customers at good prices – that’s why he sells well and makes good profit. Zubaida is a very supportive wife who is always ready to help her husband in difficult times. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, because her husband wants to buy some more fresh fruit to sell. He has been operating his business for the past 20 years and Zubaida hopes that an investment will be productive for him and increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit to sell.

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran sells clothes to neighborhood clients to share the financial burden with her husband. She purchases clothes from different cities and earns good profit from her business. Her husband is also involved in the clothes selling business. He sells clothes to different clothes shops in the market for profit. 

Sugran is the mother of two sons and a daughter. Her two older children are getting their education while youngest one is only 3 years old and has not started his education yet. 

Sugran has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy clothes in bulk that will help him minimize the cost of travelling and also allow him to offer more variety to his clients. Sugran is a regular Asasah client and this is her second loan application. In previous years, she has proven herself to be a responsible client by paying her installments on time and by attending every meeting. She is hopeful that this time the loan will also bring positive changes to her husband’s business and make him more income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is a housewife and carries out her household responsibilities by staying at home. Her husband is a mason by profession. He provides his services to different construction companies and people looking to build homes and buildings. He is known as an expert in his work and gets jobs regularly. Kosar is the mother of four sons and a daughter. Her first three sons work for private organizations, while the other two are students. 

Kosar has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for the growth of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy masonry tools to provide better quality services to his customers and earn better profit. He has been doing his business for the past 10 years and Kosar is hopeful that, after the loan investment, her husband’s business will be well established and her family will have more financial security as a result.

loans.use: to buy masonry tools.

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.en:
Shamigul is an honest and hardworking divorced woman. She lives in Kumsangir, Tajikistan with her five children. Shamgul has been selling fabrics at the market for eight years and she has good business experience. Her son helps her in this business and together they are trying to improve their living condition. Shamigul would like to get a loan of 2000$ USD for purchasing new fabrics in order to increase the assortment of merchandise for retail sales. She is thankful to lenders who will support him.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy new fabrics.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 36 year old single lady. Lucia is in the hawking business in Mikindani, Mombasa. Lucia’s business has been in operation for the last ten years. 

Lucia has been a KADET client and this marks her third borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase combs, face towels, basins, scissors, buckets and saucepans for her business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to benefit her family. Lucia's dream is to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase combs, face towels, basins, scissors, buckets and saucepans for sale.

loans.name: Adija

texts.en:
Adija is a 42 year old married mother of three children. She sells vegetables and fruits in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. Her business has been in operation for the last three years.
 
Adija has been a KADET client and this marks her second borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase mangoes, pineapples, cabbage, potatoes, onions and tomatoes for her business. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to benefit her family. Her dream is to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes, pineapples, cabbage, potatoes, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Salimjon

texts.en:
Salimjon lives and works in Istaravshan, Tajikistan. He is married and the father of three children. He works as a farmer. Before, he worked as a firefighter and today he is a pensioner. Pension fees which he receives are not enough to provide for his family and children’s needs. That’s why currently Salimjon engages in cultivating of potatoes, onions, wheat and carrots and also raises cattle. Salimjon would like to get a loan of 12000 TJS for purchasing mineral fertilizers and cattle. The profit which he makes from this business allows him to take care of his family. Salimjon hopes that lenders will support him.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer and cattle

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is an industrious 49 year old business man. He is married and blessed with three children aged 11, 6 and 2. He has been operating a retail shop for the last 5 years. He is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because he has learned how to relate with his customers. This has helped him to attract customers and grow his business. In the next five years, he dreams of owning rental apartments.

He wants 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar and rice for sale in his retail shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar and rice for sale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 57 year old single mother of one child. Margaret sells clothes in Kongowea, Mombasa. Her business has been in operation for the last four years. 

She is a KADET client and this marks her second borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase more bails of clothes for her business. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to benefit her family.

Her dream is to own a boutique in future.

loans.use: to buy more bails of clothes for reslae

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a 36 year old married father of four children. Victor sells clothes in Mariakani. His business has been in operation for the last six years and has been a success. 

He is a KADET client and this marks his third borrowing to finance his business. With this loan he plans to add more stock of clothes for his business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay back the loan and to gradually expand his business.

His dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: to add more stock of clothes for resale

loans.name: Juliah

texts.en:
Juliah is 40 years old and married to Samuel. Together they are blessed with one child. Juliah supplies milk in Kiamumbi. She has been in this business for the last three years and earns an income of KES.10,000 per month. 

She is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD which she plans to purchase more stock. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business to other areas.

She hopes to expand her business and also wants to  buy cows so as to save and reduce on the cost of buying milk from suppliers.

loans.use: To purchase more stock (milk) and also buy a cow so as to save and reduce on the cost of buying milk from suppliers

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is 24 year-old single man.  He owns a retail shop in Huruma, where he supplies things like airtime vouchers to the residents of that area.  He has been doing this business for the last three years and gets an income of  KES.35,000 per month.

He is applying for his first loan of KES.40,000 from KADET LTD, with which he plans to boost the business by buying more stock of airtime vouchers.  He will save the anticipated profit.  He hopes to venture into the exporting business in the future.

loans.use: To boost the business by buying more stock of airtime vouchers

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 56 and married, with 5 children. Two of her children got married already and the rest are at school.   Celia is thankful because she is able to earn about PHP20,000 from each crop.

Celia grows rice and has been doing it for 33 years. According to her, the profit she generates isn't enough for buying farm supplies.  She is asking for additional capital of PHP 15,000. She wants to purchase fertilizer and insecticides for her farm. Celia's profit goes to her children's allowances, food and electricity bills and daily needs, and also the repayment of her loan.
,
In the future, Celia hopes that her profit will increase so that she can send her children to a higher level of education and improve their living.  She is hoping that the loan will help her to attain her business goals.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticides for her farm

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is 43 years old and married to Mercy.   They are blessed with three children.  Elias runs a carpentry shop in Githurai, where he supplies his product to the people of that area. He has been doing this business for the last eighteen years.  He earns an income of KES.15,000 per month.

Elias has a good credit history with KADET, LTD.   He is applying for his second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD. to purchase more stock.  He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business and educate his children.  He is very hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase more material, like lumber

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 47 years old and married to Jacinta. They are blessed with three children. John runs a carpentry business in Githurai 45. He has been doing this business for the past four years and gets an income of 16,000 KES.

He has a good credit history with KADET and he is applying for his second loan of 80,000 KES from KADET LTD, which he plans to purchase more stock. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business and educate his children.

John hopes to expand his business. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials, like timber

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a hardworking, 55-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with eight children. She has been selling firewood since 1998. Eunice has retained her business with the financial support from Faulu Kenya. She supplements her income by farming. She also owns rental houses. Eunice needs 30,000 KES to buy firewood. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter  is 53 years old and married to Wanjiru. They are blessed with three children. He owns a tin smith and welding business in Githurai 45. He has been doing this for the last seventeen years and gets an income of KES 6,000 per month. 

He has a good credit history in KADET and he is applying for his second loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase more raw materials like iron sheeting.

Peter will use the extra profits to expand his business and to educate his children. He hopes to expand his business, he is very hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials like iron sheets.

loans.name: Sumaya

texts.en:
Sumaya is a 49-year-old housewife, who has had a talent for embroidery since she was young. She could not use her talent before because she was blessed by marrying and having six children who took most of her time. Now that all of her children are grown up, Sumaya decided to pursue her dream and started a small business at home two years ago making embroidered traditional dresses and selling them. During these two years, she has been able to sell her dresses at the market and has been making a good profit. 

Now, since Sumaya is having more dresses requested, she has applied for this loan to buy machines that can help speed her production and allow her to employ more people in the future.

loans.use: to buy a sewing and an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 44 years old and married. She has 6 children: 5 school-aged and 1 infant. According to her, she is able to earn about PHP 30,000 per crop harvest. The profit she generates from her business goes to allowances and tuition fees for her children and also to the daily needs of her family.

Erlinda grows rice which she has been doing for 17 years. She would like to buy complete supplies needed for her farm business. However, because of the high cost of farm supplies, she is in need of additional capital of PHP25000. She wants to buy fertilizers and a variety of seeds for her farm. She hopes that her request will be granted because the loan will be very helpful to gain her income and alleviate her family from poverty.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and a variety of seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of cloth material for dress making business.

loans.name: Perveen Akhter

texts.en:
Perveen Akhter has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her business of selling buffalo milk. She has been involved in this business for the past 20 years and has 4 buffaloes. With the loan, she will buy another buffalo that will allow her to get a larger quantity of milk and increase her profits by selling more. 

She is also a very good housewife and does her household duties effectively. She is very cooperative and always ready to help her family to overcome the difficulties of life. 

Her husband is a retired government official. She has given birth to two children. Both of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She is hopeful that a loan investment will bring positive changes to her business and will improve her income.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married and a mother of three school-age children. She is 40 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Regina is a farmer. She plants and harvests bananas to earn a living. She sells banana in the local open market at retail and she also sells in bulk to local traders. She has been doing this business for five years. She earns PHP 4,000 a month from this work. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase banana tissue culture seedlings.

Regina has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Regina hopes to have a banana fruit exportation business and gain more profit.

loans.use: To purchase banana tissue culture seedlings.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en: Stellah, a 26-year-old hardworking lady, has been operating a grocery store for four years thanks to the the financial support of Faulu Kenya. Now requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy crates of eggs, her dream is to buy a piece of land and build rental houses in the future.

loans.use: to buy crates of eggs.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en: Dennis, a 34-year-old single man, has been growing rice for five years, earning about PHP30000 per cropping.  Because of insufficient capital, he is requesting a loan of PHP27000 to buy farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides. Dennis is confident that this loan will enable him to increase his  income and improve both his business and his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 39 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and a mother of three grown children. Juliet has a small market at home. She sells grocery items to earn a living. She sells basic food items, food ingredients, laundry soap and dish washing bars. She has been engaged in this type of business for over three years. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 from these activities. Juliet has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 at GDMPC to purchase grocery stock and soft drinks to sell.

Juliet has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Juliet hopes to expand her business and gain more profit.

loans.use: To purchase more stock and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, who is 44 and married to a farmer, has five children, two of whom are still studying. Another is married, while the other two help their parents maintain the farm. Teresita is able to earn about PHP20000 per cropping, profits that enable her to sustain her children and allowed for her recent purchase of some kitchen supplies.

Teresita, who has been growing rice for 21 years, is requesting a loan of PHP15000 to buy fertilizer and seeds, purchases which will be very helpful in improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Marciano

texts.en: Marciano is 35 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is married and a father of five school-aged dependents. Marciano is the head of the family and a farmer. To make a living, he plants rice and harvests palay. He has been engaged in this activity for over eight years. He earns a total quarterly average of PHP 24,000 from farming. Marciano has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 at GDMPC to pay the labor costs to plant rice and to  purchase fertilizers. Marciano has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Marciano hopes to buy more hectares of rice fields and harvest cavan's (50-kilo sacks) of palay.

loans.use: to pay the labor costs to plant rice and to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Joemar

texts.en: Joemar is married and a father of one school-age child. Joemar is 30 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Joemar is a farmer.
