He owns a half-hectare coconut farm that he inherited from his parents. He has been in the copra production business for two years. He earns approximately PHP 30,000 quarterly from this business. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to pay the labor cost to produce the copra. Joemar has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Joemar hopes to purchase additional hectares of coconut farmland.

loans.use: To pay labor costs to produce copra

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 26 years old, married and has two small children.

Marilyn has been a rice farmer for the past two years. She earns about 25,000 PHP per crop. She uses her profits for her family’s basic needs and the future needs of her children. This is why sometimes her budget for the maintenance of her rice farm is insufficient.

In this regard, Marilyn is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer and seed. She hopes that she can improve her rice farm so that her profits will increase.

Marilyn would be thankful if her loan request is granted so she can increase her income and improve her family’s way of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seed for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nory

texts.en:
Nory is a hardworking Filipina entrepreneur who for the past 25 years has bought and sold sea shells. She also earns more income from renting sound systems.

Nory has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase more shells to sell.

Nory dreams of building and expanding her business so as to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more shells to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is married and works hard to support her family. For the past seventeen years she has had a meat market in the Philippines.

Tessie has requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more meat to sell. She would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 36 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family.

For the past two years Elsie has run a general store where she sells items like rice and soft drinks. She also sells gasoline.

Elsie has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock for her general store. She has borrowed and paid off six loans from NWTF before this one.

Elsie aspires to build and expand her business so as to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items like rice, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: Celia is married and a mother of three school-age dependents. She is 47 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Celia is a farmer. She plants and sells vegetables to earn a living. She delivers vegetables like leafy vegetable, squash, and beans to the local market. She has been doing this business for five years. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month in this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizers. Celia has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Celia hopes to purchase a hectare of land for vegetable production and to gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 32-year-old married lady with four children who go to school. She has been running a hair salon for five years.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Hellen has improved her business because she was trained in business management skills.

Hellen has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to add to her stock of hair chemicals, hair oil and hair braids. She hopes to buy real estate in the future.

loans.use: to add to her stock of hair chemicals, hair oil and hair braids.

loans.name: Nasreen Akhtar

texts.en:
Nasreen Akhtar is 47 years old and married with three children: two sons and a daughter. Both of her sons are  master tailors by trade. Her elder son has a tailoring shop where they both work together and meet the clients' orders on time. 

Her daughter and Nasreen herself do sewing at their home. They get orders from neighboring clients and earn well after completing them on time. In this way, they all financially contribute to the family so they have a better standard of living as a result.

Nasreen Akhtar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business. With the loan, he will buy a new sewing machine and also pay the shop rent in advance to be able to work in an effective way and produce good quality work. 

Nasreen is hopeful that the loan investment will bring better profits to her sons’ business and improve its financial position

loans.use: To buy her son a new sewing machine and pay the shop rent in advance.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Isabel works hard to support her family.  She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Isabel is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment for her fishing business.

Isabel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 8 years. Zenaida earns additional  income from boarding house rentals and from raising pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell in her stall.  Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell in her stall

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 56 year-old married lady with grown children.  She has been practicing dairy farming for three years.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her finances.  This has helped her in saving and investing more in her business.  

She hopes to own a ranch in the future.  She wants to start raising pigs.  For this reason, she has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Vivigyn

texts.en: Vivigyn is married and a mother of three school-age dependents. She is 45 years old and lives in Aurora Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Vivigyn is a farmer. She plants and harvests corn to earn a living. She sells corn at the local market for food and feed for the animals. She has been in this business for 10 years. She earns PHP 25,000 every quarter from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase fertilizers and to pay labor cost at harvesting. Vivigyn has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Vivigyn hopes to purchase equipment to use in her production.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and to pay the labor cost at harvesting.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. Eden has been in this business for 20 years.  She earns additional income from buying and selling coconuts and from sugarcane farming.

She is borrowing PHP15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets and equipment for her fishing business.

Eden has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets and equipment for her fishing business

loans.name: Sarah Jane

texts.en:
Sarah Jane works hard to support her family. Sarah Jane is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 20 years.

Sarah Jane requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.  In the future, Sarah Jane would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Berbea

texts.en: Berbea is married and a mother of two school-age dependents. She is 29 years old and lives in Tongo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Berbea is a farmer. She plants and harvests vegetables to earn a living. She sells vegetables at retail and by volume to local traders. She has been in this type of business for five years. She earns approximately PHP 2,500 from these activities. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to pay labor costs for land preparation. Berbea has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Berbea hopes to buy a hectare of land for vegetable production.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for land preparation.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 54 years old and married with four children.

Elsa works hard to provide for her family. She has run a sari sari (general) store for the past twenty years in the Philippines. She also earns an income from growing, buying and selling rice.

Elsa has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like shampoo, noodles, etc. to sell in her sari sari store. She has borrowed and paid off four loans from NWTF before this one.

Elsa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her sari sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stocks of sugar, cooking fat, paraffin and mobile phone credit cards to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is married and works hard to support her family. For the past nine years she has had a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Elena has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase parts to repair and maintain her motorcycle.

Elena would like to save enough money to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase parts to repair and maintain her motorcycle.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is widow with 6 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elsie is 62 years old.   She has a meat vending business in the Philippines.  Elsie has been in this business for 5 years.   She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional meat to sell.

In the future, Elsie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat to sell

loans.name: Baby Girl

texts.en:
Baby Girl is 26 years old and single.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  Baby Girl has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. Baby Girl requested a PHP11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase assorted goods to sell in her sari-sari store .

Baby Girl has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Baby Girl would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase assorted goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a chaff-cutter and to build a zero-grazing unit.

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en:
Mary Cris is 39 years old and single.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Mary Cris has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 3 years and also earns an income from selling clothes.  Mary Cris aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 44 years old and married, with 2 children.  She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  Evelyn has been farming sugarcane for 23 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married and works hard to support her family. For the past six years she has sold fish in the Philippines.

Evelyn has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. She would like to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marites works hard to support her family.

Marites has a carenderia (restaurant) in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her carenderia.

Marites hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her carenderia.

loans.name: Minara's Group

texts.en:
Minara is the leader of this group. She is 41 and married to a bus driver. Together with her husband she is raising three daughters and a son. The oldest daughter studies at college, and the other children are at school.

In order to earn additional money to meet the family’s needs, Minara breeds and resells farm animals. She also has a farm. With money received from a loan Minara wants to purchase additional cattle for breeding.

In the future she wants to save money to purchase an apartment in Bishkek, the capital of Kyrgyzstan.

About MCC Mol Bulak Finance LLC:

loans.use: to purchase additional cattle for breeding.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, single, and lives with two family members.

Raed has had a food market since 2007 selling soft drinks, juices, and cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $2400 loan to make a ceiling for his market and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to earn more profit to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make a ceiling for his market and add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken and milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for milling services and transportation of timber

loans.name: Aigul's Group

texts.en:
Aigul is the leader of this group. She is 56 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband, she has raised three daughters. The first daughter works in a sewing workshop, the second daughter is a student and the youngest one works in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan). 

Ten years ago with the initial investment of 10,000 KGS, Aigul started to breed livestock and then resell them at higher prices after being fattened. With money received from this loan, Aigul wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, with money gained from reselling livestock, Aigul wants to purchase agricultural equipment for making the sowing process easier.
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchasing vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate his market and purchase additional foodstuffs.

loans.name: Mamary

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamary  est un homme marié de 32 ans et père de 2 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants chez son père dans le quartier Hérémakono-Nord de Bougouni.
Après les études secondaires sanctionnées par un diplôme en comptabilité, Mamary est resté pendant des années sans emploi. 
Il a tenté plusieurs activités notamment la commercialisation des boeufs, des moutons et  des chèvres mais sans réussite, il décida finalement de s’intéresser aux activités de volailles.
Avec une expérience de 3 années il maîtrise son activité qu’il a appris auprès d’un de ses amis.
Pour bien entretenir ses poules, Monsieur Mamary  décide de prendre un prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter?  1 tonne de céréales pour leur nourriture, 2 cartons de médicaments et 200 poussins pour préparer la relève. Il est à son quatrième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et les trois prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.  Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et à Bamako ( capitale de la république du Mali.)  Les œufs sont vendu à des acheteurs professionnels (Boutique, Alimentation et restaurant). et à la maison. Après leur pontes, elles sont vendues au marché et dans des restaurants. Avec ce près, Monsieur Mamary compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 500 FCFA.
 Avec ce bénéfice il compte élargir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mamary is a 32-year-old married father of two and lives with his wife and children in his dad's house in the Hérémakono-Nord de Bougouni region.
After finishing secondary studies and receiving an accounting degree, Mamary has gone several years without a job.
He tried several jobs such as selling cattle, sheep, and goats but with no success, he ultimately decided to sell poultry. 
With three years of experience, he is becoming an expert at his job which he learned from one of his friends.
To take care of his chickens, Mamary decided to take out a loan through Soro Yiriwaso to purchase: 1 ton of grain for feed, 2 cartons of medicine, and 200 chicks. He is on his fourth loan with Soro Yiriwaso and his three prior loans were all repaid in full. He buys his supplies in Boubouni and in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). The eggs are sold to professional buyers (shops, food industries, and restaurants) and to home consumers. After they are laid, the eggs are sold at the market and in restaurants. With this loan, Mamary hopes to make a monthly profit of 75,500 FCFA.
With this profit, he hopes to increase the size of his business.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine, and chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase casava.

loans.name: Maqboola's Group

texts.en:
Maqboola is 35 years old and married with four children: two sons and two daughters. Her elder son is 18 years old and involved in a floor tile-making business. He just studied till 5th standard while the other three are enrolled in a school and getting their education. 

Her husband runs a grocery store business. He runs his business at his home. He has taken over a room of his house for this purpose where he serves his customers and generates income for the family. He has been operating this business for the past seven years. 

Maqboola has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to be able to put into his store for selling. Maqboola is very hopeful that her husband’s business will grow further and increase his profits.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery store business.

loans.name: Saibou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Saibou est un homme marié de 39 ans et père de 1 enfants qui vit dans une famille nucléaire et ses enfants et son épouse  dans le quartier Niebala de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, très jeune il commença les activités génératrices de revenus telles l’achat et la vente des motos à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et cela sans succès.  Quelques années après il revient auprès de son oncle à Bougouni pour apprendre l’achat et la vente des pièces détachées.
Depuis qu’il a intégré le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, son secteur d’activité a évolué, son cycle achat et vente a beaucoup changé.
Avec une expérience de 8 années, il maîtrise son activité.
Pour agrandir sa boutique Monsieur Saibou décida de prendre un prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, 15 pneus, 10 batteries, 2 trousseaux de clé et 25 chambres à air, à Bamako.
Il est à son cinquième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et tous les  quatre prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Saibou compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 750 FCFA. Il envisage avec ce bénéfice agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Saibou is a married 39-year-old father of one who lives in a nuclear family with his child and wife in the Niebala area of Bougouni. 
Having not gone to school, he started working early in life, including buying and selling motorbikes in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) with no success. Some years later, he returned to his uncle in Bougouni to learn about buying and selling spare parts. 
Since becoming involved with the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, his job sector has evolved, and his buying and selling cycle has changed a lot. 
With 8 years of experience, he is an expert at his job.
To increase the size of his shop, Saibou has decided to take out a loan through Soro Yiriwaso to buy 15 tires, 10 batteries, 2 bunches of keys, and 25 inner tubes in Bamako.
He is on his fifth loan with Soro Yiriwaso and his four previous loans were all repaid in full.
With this loan, Saibou hopes to make a monthly profit of 70,750 FCFA. He hopes to increase the size of his business with this money.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Lira's Group

texts.en:
Lira is the leader of this group. She is 44 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband, she brings up three children, all of whom study at school. 

In order to earn money to support the family budget, Lira breeds livestock and then resells them at a higher price. She has been running this business since 1992. In this way she earns 5,000 KGS per month. Lira applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds for purchasing livestock. In the future, with the profits gained from reselling livestock, she wants to purchase a vehicle for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is 46 years old and is married with 2 children who are in school. Lucrecia is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.

Lucrecia requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Lucrecia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Benkadi 1 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kantela, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MANSA, qui est debout en milieu, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labours pour entretenir environs 1 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions seront vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA environs par campagne après toutes dépenses.
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi 1 se disent satisfaites de la collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et portent toute leur confiance pour une agriculture durable avec l’aide de Soro Yiriwaso/Kiva.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women with an average age of 50, and an average of 3 children each. Most of them live in polygamous families in Kantela, one of the villages in the commune of Massigui, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, 2nd administrative region of Mali. The women are collaborating with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so they can better organize their activity as the rainy season begins. Crops grown by the group include rice and groundnuts, among others. 

This is their 5th collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso. With this new loan, Mansa, standing, in the middle of the photograph, plans to buy farm inputs, small equipment and to pay for plowing costs for around 1 hectare of rice and groundnuts. The crops will be sold in Massigui after the harvest, to customers who are both men and women. 

The women of the group expect to make an average profit of 40,000 CFA francs per season after all their expenses. They are happy with Soro Yiriwaso and are confident of sustaining their farming practices with the help of Soro Yiriwaso/Kiva.

loans.use: pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, weedkiller and small equipment.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 65-year-old widow with 4 children. Lilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like detergents, breads and other miscellaneous things. She has been running the variety store for 6 years and also earns an income from selling used clothes. Lilia has borrowed and paid 8 previous loans from NWTF.

Lilia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more detergents, breads and other miscellaneous items

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi I sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Momina, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, YAOUSSA, qui assise au milieu, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour (sarclage) pour entretenir environs 0,5  hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Group Benkadi I are married women who are on average 47 years old with four children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Momina, one of the villages in Massigui Township in Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (Mali's second administrative region).
They are partnering with micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate include rice and groundnuts. They are on their first collaboration with the organization.
The woman sitting in the middle, Yaoussa, intends on using this new loan to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment, and to pay for plowing and weeding costs to maintain about 1.2 acres of rice and groundnuts.
After the harvest, the production is sold in the town of Massigui to a clientele comprising men and women. This group expects to make an average profit of about 20,000 CFA per agricultural cycle.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small equipment.

loans.name: Babylyn

texts.en:
Babylyn is 26 years old and married with 5 children. With 3 children in school, Babylyn works very hard to provide for them.

Babylyn runs a charcoal sales business in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell. Babylyn has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Babylyn would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Naskul's Group

texts.en:
Naskul is the leader of this group. She is 40 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she brings up four daughters and a son. The first daughter studies at university and other children are in school. In order to earn money to meet their daily needs, the family breeds cattle and then resells them at a higher price. Naskul applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds for purchasing more cattle. In the future, Naskul wants to give her children a good education and improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Kitombo

texts.en:
Kitombo is a 37-year-old, married father of two children. Kitombo is a retail trader in Mikindani, Mombasa. Kitombo's business has been in operation for the last 6 years and has been a success. 

He has been a KADET client and this marks his fourth borrowing to finance his business. With this loan he plans to purchase ear buds, toothpaste, toothpicks, bathing soaps, scissors, combs, mirrors, toys and powder for his business. The anticipated profits will be used to repay back the loan and to gradually expand his business.

His dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: purchase ear buds, toothpaste, toothpicks, bathing soaps, scissors, combs, mirrors, toys and powder

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 51 years old and married with 6 children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Elizabeth is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elizabeth has been farming rice for 3 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling of vegetables. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is 35 years old and married with 6 children. Analy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of items like bread, curls, sugar etc. to sell. She has been running the variety store for 20 years and also earns an income from selling firewood. Analy has borrowed and paid 9 previous loans from NWTF. 

Analy aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of items like bread, curls, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 27 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. Arlene runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store. Arlene has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from rice retailing. She has borrowed and paid 7 previous loans from NWTF. 

Arlene aspires to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 2 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kantela, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz, le petit mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, ROKIA, qui la deuxième debout à gauche, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi 2 group are all married women with an average age of 47 and an average of 2 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Kantela, one of the villages of the Massigui commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, the 2nd administrative region of Mali.
They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to better organize their business before the wintering. The crops grown include rice, millet, and peanuts. They are on their fifth loan with Soro Yiriwaso.
With this new loan, Rokia, standing second from the right, plans on buying agricultural inputs, small equipment, and paying labor costs to maintain about 0.5 hectare of millet and peanuts.
The harvested crops are sold in the city of Massigui to a customer base made of both men and women. They hope to make an average profit of 40,000 FCFA per harvest cycle.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and small equipment.

loans.name: Orlina

texts.en:
Orlina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy materials for the repair and maintenance of her business motorcycle. Orlina has been in this business for 8 years. She earns additional income from pig-fattening.

Orlina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna works hard to support her family. Erna is married and has a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years. Erna requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store like eggs, sugar, groceries, etc.

In the future, Erna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store like eggs, sugar, groceries, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joebima

texts.en:
Joebima is 44 years old and married with 3 children.  She has been running a sari-sari store in the Philippines for 10 years, and also earns some income from pig fattening.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

Joebima has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like bread, noodles, egg, spices, etc. in her sari-sari store.  She has borrowed – and repaid – 17 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She aspires to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 38 years old and married with 4 children.  She has been running a general store in the Philippines for 6 years, and also earns some income from selling rice.  She works hard to provide for her family.

Vilma has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store. She has borrowed – and repaid – 11 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi II sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Momina, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  le petit mil, le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SOUMBA, la première debout à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour(sarclage) pour entretenir environs 0,9 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi II group are married women, who average 40 years of age an 3 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Momina, one of the village in the Commune of Massigui, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of Mali).

In order to better organize their business as the rainy season begins, they work with Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. Their crops include, among others, pearl millet, rice and peanut. They are seeking their fifth loan from Soro Yiriwaso.

With this new loan, Soumba (first one standing on the right) intends to buy fertilizers, small tools, and pay for weeding to maintain about 0.9 hectare of rice and peanut fields.

After the harvest, the production is sold in Massigui to a clientele comprising both men and women. The members of the group intend to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 50'000 (ca US$ 100) during the season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, herbicide, and small tools, and pay for weeding

loans.name: Allenneth Joy

texts.en:
Allenneth Joy is 30 years old and married with 4 children.  She has been running a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines for 5 years.  She also earns some income from jeepney transport. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Allenneth Joy has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. She has borrowed – and repaid – 8 loans from NWTF prior to this loan.  She aspires to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Felizardo

texts.en: Felizardo is 26 years old, single and lives in Sinara Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Felizardo has a motorcycle taxi service to earn a living. He owns and operates a motorcycle transporting passengers in the local community. He has been engaged in this service for five years. Each month, he earns a total of PHP 3,000 from this work. Felizardo has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay labor costs for motorcycle repair and maintenance. Felizardo has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Felizardo hopes to purchase a motorcycle to gain more income for his family.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for motorcycle repair and maintenance.

loans.name: Saitoti

texts.en:
Saitoti has been practicing farming in Narok, Kenya, for the last eight years. He is 33 years old, married and supports seven people in the family.

He has been a good client, and he repaid his previous loan well. He has applied for his second loan. He plans to use this loan amount to buy maize seeds and fertilizer and also to hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting. From his anticipated profit, he plans to add stock of seeds and fertilizer. 

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in the region.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyunchimeg, 52, sells car spare parts and runs an auto service that is called “Auto Standard” with her two sons. They live together in their own house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She is a divorcee and a hardworking woman who has been successfully running her business for the last two years. 

Now she is planning to expand her business by buying some car spare parts and accessories from abroad, especially China. Therefore, Oyunchimeg is requesting the loan to purchase some car spare parts from China.

“I want to grow up my business, and I want to give some properties to my sons when they marry. That is my wish in the near future. And I really appreciate the Kiva team and lenders! Thank you all,” she said.

loans.use: To purchase some car spare parts and accessories from China.

loans.name: Amil

texts.ru:
Amil 29 let. On jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Amil yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. Amil uje 8 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov . Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya molochnogo produkta.
Eto uje vtoraya ssuda , v perviy raz on bral 1200$ i za etu ssudu on ochen blagodaren Kive i lenderam.

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/76291
texts.en:
Amil is 29 years old.  He is married and has one child.  Amil is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his wife and child.  Amil has been a herdsman and cattle breeder for eight years.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to increase his milk production.  This is his second loan.  The first time he borrowed $1200, and he is very grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the loan.  

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/76291

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Benkadi 3 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kantela, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KOROTOUMOU, qui est debout au milieu, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,9 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women, who average 33 years of age an 2 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Kantela, one of the villages in the Commune of Massigui, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of Mali).

In order to better organize their business as the rainy season begins, they work with Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. Their crops include, among others, rice and peanut. They are seeking their fifth loan from Soro Yiriwaso.

With this new loan, Korotoumou (standing in the middle) intends to buy fertilizers and small tools, and to pay the cost of plowing and weeding to maintain about 0.9 hectare of pearl millet and peanut fields.

After the harvest, the production is sold in Massigui to a clientele comprising both men and women. The members of the group intend to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 50'000 (ca US$ 100) during the season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, herbicide, and small tools, and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 27 years old, married and a mother of four children. Rehema runs a posho mill for grinding maize into flour in Kilifi. Rehema’s business has been in operation for the last four years. 

Rehema is a KADET client, and this marks her third time borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase maize and diesel for her business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to maintain her family. Her dream is to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase maize and diesel.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 45 years old and married with 5 children.  With 3 children in school, Eva works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari Store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as snack food, soft-drinks and other groceries.  She has been in this business for 2 years.

Eva has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is Regina, 41, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Juan, an overseas worker, and is mother to their children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to save for the future of her children.

Regina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP worth of cooking oil or an egg. Regina earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Regina hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to save money for the future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in her variety store

loans.name: Mairam's Group

texts.en: Mairam is the treasurer of this group. She is 37 and married to a tractor driver whose monthly salary is about 5,000 soms. Together with her husband, she is bringing up two sons and two daughters. The sons and the older daughter are at school, but the second daughter is not yet as she is preschool age (under seven). Five years ago, with an initial investment of 8,000 soms, Mairam opened a trade place and started to sell foodstuffs. At the moment she earns about 8,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Mairam wants to purchase more foodstuffs and detergents for trade. In the future she plans to expand her business and, with the profits gained, Mairam will start building a house. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs

loans.name: Sevindj

texts.ru: Sevindj rodilas v 1974 qodu. Ona zamujem imeyet 2 detey. Sevindj uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda ,seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kurici i utok dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva ptic dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Sevindj was born in 1974. She is married and has two children.  Sevindj has raised poultry for nine years.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her family.  Now she needs 2000 AZN to buy chickens and ducks to increase the number of birds she sells.

loans.use: to buy chickens and ducks.

loans.name: Benkadi  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Benkadi III sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Momina, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SALI ADAMA, qui est le deuxième assise à gauche, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour (sarclage) pour entretenir environs 0,7 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi III group are married women, who average 39 years of age and 3 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Momina, one of the villages in the Commune of Massigui, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of Mali).

In order to better organize their business as the rainy season begins, they work with Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. Their crops include, among others, rice and peanut. They are seeking their fifth loan from Soro Yiriwaso.

With this new loan, Sali Adama (second one from the left, sitting) intends to buy fertilizers, small tools, and pay the costs of weeding to maintain about 0.7 of rice and peanut fields.

After the harvest, the production is sold in Massigui to a clientele comprising both men and women. The members of the group intend to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 800) during the season.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicide, small tools, and to pay for weeding

loans.name: Anar

texts.ru: Anar 31 let. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Anar uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa. On delayet yogurt,kefir iz moloka i prodayet ix sosedam.
texts.en: Anar is 31 years old.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family.  He is married and has one child.  Anar has been a herdsman and cattle breeder for five years.  He started this business with his father.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to develop his business.  He makes yogurt and kefir from the milk and sells them to neighbors.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 4 sont constitués par des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à Kantela, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le petit mil, le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MOUSSODJE, qui est assise au milieu, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labours(sarclage) pour entretenir environs 0,5  hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en: The ten members of the group Benkadi 4 are married women with an average age of 39 years old and an average of three children.  For the most part, they live in polygamous families in Kantela, one of the villages in the Massigui commune, in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region, the second administrative region of Mali.  They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution with the goal of better organizing their businesses at the beginning of the rainy season.  The crops planted include pearl millet, rice and peanuts.  They are on their fifth collaboration with the institution.  With this new loan, Moussodje, who is seated in the middle, expects to buy the fertilizers, seeds, and small tools and pay the labor costs (for hoeing) to maintain around .5 hectares of pearl millet and peanuts.  The products are sold at the city level in Massigui after the harvests to a customer base made up of men and women.  They expect to make an average profit of 20,000 FCFA per plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, hoes and small tools

loans.name: Benkadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe Benkadi IV sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à Momina, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, DJENEBA, assise au milieu, compte acheter les intrants et payer les frais de labour (sarclage) pour entretenir environs  1 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75.000FCFA environs en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the group Benkadi IV are married women who average 33 years of age and three children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Momina, a village in the Commune of Massigui, Prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

The women are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their activities as winter begins. The crops grown include rice and peanuts. The group members are on their fifth collaboration with the institution. 

With this new loan, DJENEBA (seated in the middle in the photo) intends to buy farm inputs and to pay the cost of weeding to maintain about one hectare of rice and peanuts. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village of Massigui to a customer base composed of women and men. DJENEBA plans on making an average profit of about 75,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, manure, herbicides, and weeding

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 5 sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kantela, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le petit mil, riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KADIATOU, la première debout à gauche avec une écharpe blanche, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,8 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40.000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkadi 5 Group ("Harmony") are married women who, on average, are 32 years old and have four children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Kantela, one of the villages in the municipality of Massigui, prefecture of Dioïla (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, small millet, rice and groundnuts. This is their fifth loan with the institution.

Kadiatou, the first woman standing at the left-hand side of the photo and wearing a white scarf, intends to use her new loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing. She has around 0.8 hectares of farmland to grow small millet and groundnuts. The harvest will be sold in the city of Massigui to a clientele made up of men and women. The group members expect to make an average profit of around 40,000 CFA francs per season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and farming tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more bales of clothes

loans.name: Benkadi V Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Benkadi V sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 20 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles polygames à Momina, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MAMOU, qui est la deuxième assise au milieu, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour (sarclage) pour entretenir environs 0,8 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. MAMOU espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA environs en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of Benkadi V Group ("Harmony") are married women who, on average, are 20 years old and have two children. They live in polygamous families in Momina, one of the villages in the municipality of Massigui, prefecture of Dioïla (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice and groundnuts. This is their fifth loan with the institution.

Mamou, sitting in the middle of the front row, intends to use her new loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing and weeding. She has around 0.8 hectares of farmland to grow rice and groundnuts. The harvest will be sold in the city of Massigui to a clientele made up of men and women. Mamou expects to make an average profit of around 50,000 CFA francs until the end of the season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding, and buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Baljinnyam

texts.en:
Baljinnyam lives with her husband and two sons in a ger (a Mongolian yurt or tent) in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband is a driver who manages a taxi service business while her two sons, ages 2 and 4, attend kindergarten.

She manages a plant sowing and trading business in her town. She started her business in 2007 and her husband helps with the family business. At first she used to plant at her older brother's greenhouse. Since then she has been able to stabilize her business and bought her own greenhouse which has been built in her backyard.

Her husband's business earnings are used for the daily consumption needs of the family and her business earnings are used for savings. She is an open-minded woman who is planning to expand her business. She says, "I bought the plot of land where we live 2 years ago. However, individuals cannot get permission to live on this place, so I am planning to have another plot of land on which I can have permission to live."

She is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan to purchase seeds and to build one more greenhouse for her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and to build one more greenhouse

loans.name: Benkadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe Benkadi 6 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kantela, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz, le petit mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KADIATOU, qui est assise au milieu, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labours pour entretenir environs 0,7 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The seven members of Benkadi 6 Group ("Harmony") are married women who, on average, are 41 years old and have three children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Kantela, one of the villages in the municipality of Massigui, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice, small millet and groundnuts. This is their fifth loan with the institution.

Kadiatou, sitting in the middle of the front row, intends to use her new loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing. She has around 0.7 hectares of farmland to grow small millet and groundnuts. The harvest will be sold in the city of Massigui to a clientele made up of men and women. The group members expect to make an average profit of around 40,000 CFA francs per season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Sambuu

texts.en:
Sambuu is 29 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt or tent) in Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife is a pharmacist while his two older children go to a local secondary school. His youngest one, who hasn't reached school age, attends kindergarten.

He manages a transportation service business in his town. He started his business in 2010. In addition, he operates a car wash and tire repair service, employing his two sisters with a reasonable monthly salary.

He is a polite man who is planning to conduct an auto part selling business in the future. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts for his new business.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts

loans.name: Benkadi 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Benkadi 7 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et  en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kantela, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le riz, le petit mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MACHITAN, la première debout à gauche, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labours pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35.000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of Benkadi 7 Group ("Harmony") are married women who, on average, are 30 years old and have two children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Kantela, one of the villages in the municipality of Massigui, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice, small millet and groundnuts. This is their fifth loan with the institution.

Machitan, the first woman standing at the left-hand side of the photo, intends to use her new loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing. She has around 0.5 hectares of farmland to grow small millet and groundnuts. The harvest will be sold in the city of Massigui to a clientele made up of men and women. The group members expect to make an average profit of around 35,000 CFA francs per season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lhagvasuren is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Hovd province of Mongolia.  His two children attend the local secondary school while his wife is a tailor.  

He manages a taxi service business in his town. He started his business in 2006 and has gained much experience.  He is a kind man who is planning to continue his business in the future.  He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to repair his car.

loans.use: To repair his taxi car

loans.name: Sergio

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Maputo Sul de Moçambique, tem 23 anos de idade é solteiro e não tem filho. Encontra se a frequentar a 9ª classe, não concluiu antes, devido ao horario do seu trabalho, responsabiliza se pela sua mãe que vive na cidade de Maputo. Consegue poupar 500.00mt mensalmente.

Muda se para o Distrito de Namaacha alegando que ia passar ferias  escolares em casa do tio, por ventura o seu tio consegue aranjar um emprego e ele começa a trabalhar e deixa os estudos. Hoje é funcionario permanente ha mais de 3 anos trabalha como fachineiro auferindo mensalmente 2.700.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa, mas também tem feito trabalhos de instalação electica nas casas ainda em construção.

Este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar  material de construção para dar continuidade da sua obra. Os anteriores de 4.000.00mt e 10.000.00mt foram para a mesma finalidade. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um outro para concluir as minimas partes da sua obra.
texts.en:
Sergio was born in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  He is 23, single, and doesn't have children.  He is currently taking ninth grade classes.  He didn't finish school before due to his work schedule.  He is also financially responsible for his mother who lives in the city of Maputo.  He saves 500 meticals each month.

He moved to the district of Namaacha to spend a school holiday at his uncle's house.  Luckily his uncle arranged employment for him and he began to work and stopped going to school.  Today he has worked full time as a cleaner for more than 3 years.  He makes 2,700 meticals a month that he puts towards his home's expenses.  He also does electrical work in houses that are under construction.

This is his third loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 10,000 meticals that he will use to buy construction materials to continue work on his house.  His previous loans were for 4,000 and 10,000 meticals that also went towards his home.  He is confident that he will pay back his loan on time and ask for another one to finish the final details of his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Lorta

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Inhambane tem 61 anos de idade é solteira mãe de 4 flhos dos quais três  já falecidos. Actualmente vive na casa própria com seu filho mais novo já casado e com seus 3 netos estes que vão a Escola.   

 Muda se para  o Distrito de Namaacha no tempo da guerra apos ter perdido seus 3 filhos, após sua chegada começa a trabalhar como empregada doméstica. Com o fundo colectado ela inicia  seu próprio negócio e constroi sua casa com o rendimento ganho nos negócio, tem vendido 2 vezes por semana (Quartas e Sabados) no Mercado Informal onde há intercâmbio de produtos vindo de paises fora, tem de lucro 5.000.00mt que gasta nas dispesas da casa.

 Este é o seu quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku.Os anteriores de(8.000.00, 10.000.00 e 15.000.00)mt foram para o comércio, e este ultimo de 15.000.00mt e para compra de fardos de(calças, camisolas camisas)  Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para concluir a casa do seu único filho.
texts.en:
Lorta was born in the province of Inhambane.  She is 61 and the single mother of 4 children, 3 of whom have passed away.  She lives in her own home with her youngest son, who is married, and also with her three grandchildren, who are in school.

She moved to the district of Namaacha during the war after she lost 3 of her children.  After she arrived, she began to work as a maid.  With the money she made, she started her own business and built her house with the earnings from her business.  She goes to the informal market twice a week where she trades for products from outside of the country.  She earns 5,000 meticals a month that she puts towards her home's expenses.

This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku. Her previous loans were for 8,000, 10,000 and 15,000 meticals, and they went towards her business.  This loan is for 15,000 meticals that she will use to buy bundles of clothing (pants, nightgowns, and shirts).  She is confident that she will pay back her loan on time so she can ask for another one to finish her only son's home.

loans.use: to buy and sell used clothing (pants, nightgowns, and shirts)

loans.name: Franco

texts.pt:
nasceu na Provincia de Gaza, tem 42 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é pai de 6 filhos de 3 aos 18 anos, 5 é que vão a Escola. Fez a 7ª classe nao continuou devido ao trabalho, vive na casa própria com sua familia e não responsabiliza se por ninguem.

Sai da Provincia de Gaza para o Distrito de Namaacha concretamente em Impaputo uma Localidade que dista 35km da Vila. Inicia seu trabalho de fabrico de blocos com o fundo que obtera no seu antigo trabalho de padeiro. Hoje é proprietário de um estaleiro que fornece blocos na região onde vive, tem gastado uma média de 20 sacos mensalmente tendo de lucro 6.000.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e da sua obra. Mas também tem um autocarro que tem feito fretes ajudando a comunidade nas compras dos produtos dos seus estabelecimentos e ganha 3.000.00mt. não consegue poupar nenhum valor mensal devido a sua obra.

Este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt para compra de material para o fabrico de blocos(cimento, areia, pó de pedra). Conhece a Hluvuku atraves dos vizinhos que também são clientes da instituição. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir outro crédito para reabrir a sua padaria que se encontra fechada do momento.
texts.en:
Franco was born in the province of Gaza.  He is 42, married, and is the father of 6 children who range in age from 3 to 18 years.  Five of them are in school.  He studied through the seventh grade but didn't continue because he went to work.  He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone else financially besides them.

He left Gaza for the district of Namaacha and the city of Impaputo, which is 35 kilometers from Vila.  He started a business making cinder blocks with the money he made working as a baker.  Today he the owner of a business that provides cinder blocks to the region where he lives.  He buys an average of 20 sacks of cement a month and make 6,000 meticals profit that he puts towards his home's expenses and building his home.  He also has a car that he rents out to help his community buy products for their businesses.  He earns 3,000 meticals a month through this.  He doesn't save anything because he is working on his house.

This is his first loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 25,000 meticals, and he will use it to buy materials to make cinder blocks (cement, sand, and stone powder).  He became familiar with Hluvuku through neighbors who are also clients of the institution.  He is confident that he will pay back his loan on time so he can ask for another one to re-open his bakery that is currently closed.

loans.use: to buy cement to make cinder blocks

loans.name: Marta

texts.pt:
nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha tem 63 anos de idade, vive na casa pròpria com sua familia, é mãe de 8 filhos dos 25 aos 42 anos de idade nenhum vai a Escola.  responsabiliza se pelos seus 2 netos que vivem com ela em sua casa. Fez a 4ª classe não concluiu devido a falta de condições, consegue mensalmente poupar 3.000.00mt na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca sai do Distrito, iniciou negócio na tentativa de aumentar a renda familiar. Anos depois da fixação do Mercado Informal que se encontra perto da sua casa, ela constroi quartos de aluguer para acomodar aos estrangeiros que vêem fazer intercâmbio de produtos naquele Mercado que funciona 2 vezes por semana(Quartas e Sabados) tem de lucro 10.000.00mt. Porque faziam refeições fora da sua casa, ela abre um estabelecimento em sua casa para satisfazer a necessidade dos mesmos fazendo refeições e vendendo produtos de primeira necessidade. Conta com ajuda da sua filha que se encontra na gerência do estabelecimeto e consegue de lucro 3.000.00mt e poupa 2.000.00mt no Banco. 

Este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos de primeira necessidade( farinhas, sumos, caldos refrescos e mais) para revenda. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto para aceder a outros empréstimos, conhece a hluvuku atraves dos vizinhos que são clientes da instituição
texts.en:
Marta was born in the district of Namaacha.  She is 63 and lives in her own home with her family.  She is the mother of 8 children who range in age from 25 to 42.  None of them is still in school.  She is also financially responsible for 2 grandchildren that live with her.  She studied through the 4th grade but didn't continue due to the lack of financial resources.  She saves 3,000 meticals a month in her bank account.

She never left Naamacha.  She started her business to try to help her family with their income.  Years later, since there is an informal market near her home, she constructed rooms to rent out to accomodate strangers that come to trade products there.  The market is held twice a week on Thursdays and Saturdays.  She makes a monthly income of 10,000 meticals.  Because her guests were eating their meals outside of her house, she started making meals to satisfy this need and also sells basic goods.  Her daughter helps her with the general management of her business and makes 3,000 meticals a month.  She saves 2,000 meticals a month in her bank.
