El prestamo que solicita lo necesita para comprar materia prima como harina, azucar, huevos, soda, leña, etc. Y con lo que venda ella podrá seguir sosteniendo a su familia y tambien podrá ahorrar un poco para responder ante cualquier emergencia. Su sueño es apoyar a sus hijas para que cada una de ellas tenga su propio negocio y puedan ganarse la vida honradamente. En la actualidad FAMA ha impartido a sus clientes cursos sobre Panaderia y Reposteria y Doña Maria asi como sus compañeras de grupo se han beneficiado, por tal razón ella iniciará a diversificar su negocio con productos como pasteles y otros tipos de panes.
texts.en:
Maria Concepcion is 43 years old. She is a single mother and has three daughters and one son. She lives in the San Nicolas village and is a member and coordinator of the Senda de Amor (Path of Love) Community Bank. Mrs. Maria started by selling nacatamales and used clothing, and for the past few years works making and selling rosquillas and quesadillas. She gets up very early in the morning to start her day's work. Two of her daughters help her mix the ingredients while she prepares the oven. Once the products are done baking, one of her daughters helps her deliver them. Through the sales of her products she is able to make a good living, but when it rains a lot she is not as successful because the firewood gets wet and the bread does not bake well and then gets overbaked. She learned this business by watching others do it and they also helped her practice. She needs this loan to buy supplies like flour, sugar, eggs, soda, firewood, etc. With the products she sells she will continue to support her family and also save a little for any emergency that may come up. She dreams of supporting her daughters so that each one has her own business and can earn an honest living.

FAMA currently provides its clients with courses in baking and pastries and Mrs. Maria and her other group members have learned from these courses. For this reason she will introduce more products to her business, such as cakes and other types of bread.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar, eggs, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Carmentina Lili

texts.en: Carmentina lives in the town of Danli in southern Honduras where she has made a living for the last 18 years by selling clothing and women’s cosmetics. She is a returning client and has maintained a punctual payment history. Carmentina is requesting a loan of Lps. 10,000 with which to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase pants, skirts, blouses, shirts, sandals, lipstick, eyeliner, moisturizer, and foundation.

loans.name: Juliana Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Juliana, de 61 años de edad, madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos , es comerciante, se dedica a elaborar y vender tortilla , ella es originaria de León, lleva 17 años en este negocio, sus estudios son básicos solo logro terminar el segundo grado de primaria. Esta actividad la inicio por medio de un familiar cercano quien le ayudo y la motivo a poner su propio negocio de venta de tortillas. Con el paso de los años ha venido adquiriendo clientela y ha sobrevivido por medio de este negocio además de que sus hijos le ayudan a ella y también de las remesas que recibe.
Solicito el préstamo para reparar el techo de su negocio, realizar mejoras al piso y reparar la estufa donde cocina las tortillas y comprar materia prima como maíz.  Con esta inversión quiere poder darle una mejor apariencia a su negocio, tener suficiente materia prima almacenada para elaborar tortillas pues el precio del maíz tiende a incrementarse.   Su próxima meta es hacerle mejoras a su vivienda, hacer crecer su negocio para en un futuro dejárselo de herencia a su hija menor.
texts.en:
Juliana, 61, is a single mother of three children.  She’s a merchant.  She makes tortillas to sell.  She’s originally from León.  She’s been in this business for 17 years.  Her schooling is basic; she only completed second grade.  She started the business thanks to a close relative who helped her and motivated her to start her own tortilla business.  As the years have gone by she’s been acquiring clientele and has survived by means of this business.  Her children help her and she also receives money that’s sent to her.

She asked for the loan to repair the roof, the floor and the stove that she makes the tortillas with and to buy raw materials like corn.  With this investment she wants to give her business a better appearance and to have enough raw materials stored to make tortillas because the price of corn tends to increase.  Her next goal is to do some home improvements, to make her business grow to pass it down as an inheritance to her youngest daughter in the future.

loans.use: to repair the roof in her business, repair the floor and the stove where she makes the tortillas and also to buy raw materials like corn.

loans.name: Dania Maria

texts.en:
Dania lives in the town of Danli in southern Honduras where she makes a living by selling freshly prepared food. Her business has done well over recent years due to its convenient location near a gas station as well as thanks to Dania’s hard work. 

Due to the increase in business, Dania now employs an assistant to help her with the food preparation. Dania is requesting a loan of Lps. 10,000 to purchase ingredients for cooking.

loans.use: This loan will be used to purchase chicken, beef, eggs, cheese, rice, beans, plantains, cornmeal, butter, cooking oil, carrots, onion, tomatoes, and lettuce.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay off some personal debts.

loans.name: Las Alondras Del Creston Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Las Alondras del Crestón" tiene este nombre porque el lugar de donde se reúnen pasa un rio y bajan a bañarse las aves (alondras). Esta ubicado en el estado de Hidalgo en México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes. La señora Eusebia es integrante del grupo. Ella vende antojitos mexicanos desde hace 30 años. Solicito el préstamo para invertir en insumospara su negocio. Los clientes dicen que les agrada comer porque la señora es muy amable. En este momento se siente contenta y con muchas ganas de trabajar, ya que solicita el prestamo para mejorar su negocio y seguir brindando un buen servicio, quiere continuar mejorando su negocio e incrementar el número de clientes para expandirse y ser una de las mejores vendedoras de la zona. Con las ganancias que obtenga quiere ahorrar para seguir invirtiendo y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Alondras del Crestón” (Crestón’s Larks).  It has this name because a river flows past the place they meet at and birds (larks) alight to bathe.  It is located in the Mexican state of Hidalgo.  It has 9 members.

Eusebia is a group member.  She’s sold Mexican fast food snacks for the last 30 years.  She asked for the loan to buy ingredients for her business.  Customers tell us that they enjoy eating because the lady is very kind.  

At present she feels very happy and with much desire to work since she’s asking for the loan to improve her business and to continue to provide good service.  She wants to continue improving the business and increasing the number of her customers to expand and be one of the best sellers in the zone.  She will use profits obtained to save and continue investing and to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make fast food snacks.

loans.name: Delio Ramón

texts.es: Delio, es un productor de 35 años de edad, originario de la comarca de La Lamilla, ubicada a unos cinco kilométros de Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Esteli. Esta casado y tiene un hijo de catorce años de edad el cual se encuentra estudiando. El señor Delio desde muy temprano edad inció sus labores en la actividad agrícola como es la siembra de hortalizas, compra de granos básicos, y actualemte tiene cinco años de trabajar en la producción de tabaco con ayuda de  su papá. Comercializa su producto (Tabaco) en el municipio de Totogalpa, lo cual solicitó este crédito para tres cosas importantes para su producción como el es Transporte, moñado (Pacas de hoja de tabaco) y construcción de una nueva galera para el secado del mismo. Su mayor propósito es comprar un motor de riego y una casa para darle una mejor vida a su familia y garantizar asi un mejor futuro para su hijo.
texts.en:
Delio is a 35 year-old producer who is originally from La Lamilla region, which is located five kilometers from Pueblo Nuevo, in Estelí.  He is married and has a 14 year-old son who is in school. 

Delio started working in agriculture at a very early age, growing vegetables and buying basic grains.  He has been producing tobacco, with his father's help, for five years.  He sells his product (tobacco) in the town of Totogalpa.  He requested this loan for three important things he needs for his production: transport, 'moñado' (bundles of tobacco leaf) and to build a new barn for drying the tobacco leaf.  His biggest goal is to buy an irrigation engine and a house so that he can provide his family with a better life and thereby guarantee a better future for his son.

loans.use: to buy transport and bundles of tobacco leaf, and to build a barn

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.en: Rosa is lives in the town of Danli in southern Honduras where she earns a living by making women’s clothing as well as offering seamstress services. Rosa has been engaged in this line of work for the last 38 years and has a reliable customer base made up of teachers and students in the area. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 8,000 to purchase materials needed for making and repairing clothing.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, zippers, buttons, thread, pins, and sewing needles.

loans.name: Cristo Vive 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Gladis is the coordinator of her group, Cristo Vive 4 & 5 (Christ live). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their four children. She says that her biggest challenge is to give her kids the best education she can. After this first loan, she is planning to invest in her small food stall. With the commitment to develop her business and a good investment plan, she will be able to grow her business. Her future plan for her business is to have an improved and bigger business, something like a grocery store.

Gladis plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying different goods like fruits, vegetables, chicken, green peas, beans, etc. With the profits, she will expand her business by adding other goods like rice, flour, sugar, and many other goods especially for daily meals.

Gladis' group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana. Her community is a batey (a company town), where most of the citizens are Haitians who emigrated to work in different industries in the Dominican Republic. This group is composed of 10 Haitian businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, chicken, green peas, beans, etc.

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es: David, un joven de 27 años de edad, de la comunidad de la Hermita, San Rafael del Norte - Jinotega. Actualmente  con su esposa se encuentran con la bendicion de esperar un bebé, a sus seis meses de embarazo. Incio sus labores en la agricultura a la edad de doce años, con el apoyo de su papá, por lo tanto éste fue un impedimento para no terminar sus estudios llegando hasta el Sexto grado de primaria, donde aprendio a leer y escribir, sin darse cuenta la importancia que traeria la culminación de sus estudios para su futuro. Él solicitó su credito KIVA para el mantenimiento de seis manzanas de frijoles que abarca la compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra, lo cual comercializa su producto en la zona de Jinotega y Estelí con la ayuda de su hermano. Además de comercializar frijoles se dedica también a la compra y venta de ganado generándole ésto otros ingresos. Él desea seguir trabajando con la siembra de frijol durante Dios se lo permita y asi mejorar su cultivo cada dia. Entre sus metas se encuentran primeramente tener a su bebé saludable y comprar una motocicleta que le permita movilizarse para  mejorar sus gestiones para promocionar su producto.
texts.en:
David is a young man of 27 who lives in La Hermita community, in San Rafael del Norte, Jinotega.  He and his wife are currently blessed as they are expecting a baby.  His wife is six months pregnant.

David started farming when he was 12 years old, with the support of his dad.  This was an obstacle to him finishing his studies.  He reached sixth grade, and learned to read and write, but he did not realize the importance that completing his studies would hold for his future.

David requested a Kiva loan to maintain six 'manzanas' (one 'manzana' = 1.68 acres) of beans.  He will buy supplies and pay laborers.  He sells his produce in Jinotega and Estelí, with the help of his brother.  In addition to selling beans, David also buys and sells livestock which makes him additional income.  He would like to continue growing beans for as long as God allows and improve his crops every day.  His goals include, firstly, having a healthy baby, and buying a motorcycle so that he can get around and improve his ability to negotiate and market his produce.

loans.use: to maintain six 'manzanas' (one manzana = 1.68 acres) of beans, buying supplies and paying laborers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Esperanza De Jesus

texts.es: Esperanza De Jesús tiene su negocio que es un cafetín. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Esperanza obtuvo este negocio por su Mama ya que, tenía que mantener a su familia por lo que no tenía el apoyo de sus padres y decidió luchar, con esfuerzo propio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de frutas, bolsas, pajillas, azúcar, galletas, pan, entre otros. El deseo de ella es lograr que negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en: Esperanza De Jesús has a business that is a cafe. She has been dedicated to this activity for more than five years. Esperanza obtained this business from her mother since she had to support her family for which she did not have the support of her parents and decided to fight with her own efforts. The loan  that she is requesting is for the purchase of fruit, bags, straws, sugar, cookies, bread, among other things. Her desire is to see that her business continues growing.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, bags, straws, sugar, cookies, bread, among other items.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La señora Patricia es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad que esta en el colegio,patricia  vive en casa de sus padres,patricia recibe un dinero por parte de su ex pareja, para su hijo,patricia se dedica a la vender mazamorra, arroz con leche y dulce de camote, realiza esta actividad alrededor de la zona por donde vive, en el parque de comatrana, y en las afuera de la iglesia de comatrana, también vende sus productos a los trabajadores del hospital regional, los desafíos que enfrenta patricia es tener que dejar a su hijo  solo con su mama y así ella pueda dedicarse a trabajar para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida, el préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar insumos para preparar su productos como arroz, leche, maíz morado ,canelas y los embaces descartables para la repartición de sus productos, patricia como toda joven tiene muchos sueños uno de ello es tener un local propio donde ofrecer sus producto y así atender mejor a sus clientes, patricia esta muy agradecida con el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Patricia is a single mother and has a 6 year-old son who is in school. Patricia lives in her parents' home and receives money for her son from her ex-partner. Patricia's business is selling 'mazamorra', rice pudding and 'dulce de camote' (sweet potato candy). She carries out this business in the area where she lives, in Comatrana park and outside Comatrana church. She also sells her products to the people who work in the regional hospital. The challenge that Patricia faces is having to leave her son alone with her mom so that she can work in order to provide him with a better quality of life. Patricia is requesting this loan to buy supplies for preparing her products such as rice, milk, purple corn, cinammon and disposable containers for distributing her products. Patricia, in common with all young women, has a lot of dreams. One of them is to own her own premises where she can sell her products and better serve her customers. Patricia is very grateful for the support she has been given.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business such as milk, rice, purple corn and disposable containers

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa Maria es una mujer muy sabia, que conoce perfectamente que estrategias poner en marcha en cada momento de su vida, especialmente en lo que se refiere a su negocio como es la venta de cerdos con el paso del tiempo es que gradualmente fue atrayendo más clientes, generando la necesidad de aumentar la inversión, con los que ha logrado diversificar sus y mejorar su servicio. Aunque la competencia es su máximo desafío y siempre la obliga a recurrir a estrategias para permitirle sostener sus clientes. Con él préstamo comprará cerdos.  Su sueño de continuar siendo exitosa.
texts.en: Rosa Maria is a very wise woman who knows perfectly well which strategies to put into place at each moment in her life, especially as regards her business selling pigs.  Over time, she gradually gained more and more customers which, in turn, created a need to increase her investment.  As a result, she has managed to diversify her business and improve her service.  Her main business challenge is the competition which always forces her to implement strategies in order to maintain her customers.  She will use this loan to buy pigs.  Her dream is to continue being successful.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: this loan will be used to purchase fabric, thread, pins, and sewing needles

loans.name: Walter Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Walter Rafael  vive en la cuidad de Managua es una persona responsable es padre de familia.
El señor visito nuestra oficina para solicitar un crédito ya que necesita hacer unas mejoras en su vivienda el dinero lo va a invertir en la compra de zicn, perlines y el pago de mano de obra.
Don Walter  le agradece a ceprodel por que gracias a los prestamos obtenido anteriormente pudo mejoras su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Walter Rafael lives in the city of Managua.  He is a responsible person and father.  He visited our office to request a loan as he needs to make some improvements to his home.  He will invest the money in buying sheets of corrugated metal and beams, and paying labor costs.

Walter is grateful to Ceprodel because, thanks to the loans he has already received from us, he has been able to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: Martina es natural de un pueblo pequeño llamado Panti, ubicado al este de la ciudad donde radica desde hace más de 20 años, en la actualidad vive con la menor de sus 3 hijos. Fue muy duro para ella afrontar las carencias económicas tras migrar a la ciudad donde emprendió con poco capital. Entonces se dedicaba en vender diversos productos de acuerdo a la ocasión y temporada, en la época de invierno vende  frazadas y mantas, también cubrecamas de acuerdo al pedido de sus clientes; así como también elabora prendas tejidas a crochet. De manera paralela vende ovejas en la feria ganadera, así como su carne,  de acuerdo a la demanda de su cliente. Para martina durante estos años de experiencia vio la rentabilidad que le genera estas actividades por lo que no duda en continuar  trabajando de esta manera para mejorar siempre. A través de MFP solicitó siempre varios crédito que le han servido para crecer en su capital de trabajo donde siempre ha comprado más mercadería de la cual esta muy agradecida ya que considera que cuenta un buen aliado para el cumplimiento de sus objetivos personales. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en mantas y frazadas.
texts.en:
Martina is originally from a small village called Panti which is located to the east of the city where she has lived for more than 20 years.  She currently lives with the youngest of her three children (a daughter).  

Life was very hard for Martina who faced financial hardship after she migrated to the city.  She set herself up in business with just a little capital.  She sold a range of products according to the occasion or the season.  In winter, Martina sells blankets and also bedspreads depending on what her customers request.  She also crochets items.  In parallel with this, she also sells sheep in a livestock market, as well as their meat, depending on her customer demand.  Over the years, Martina gained experience and saw the profitability of these business activities.  For this reason, she doesn't hesitate to continue working in this way, so that she can keep improving.

Martina has requested several loans through MFP which have been useful to her in growing her working capital.  She has been able to buy more and more merchandise and she is very grateful for this as she believes she has a good ally who helps her in fulfilling her personal goals.  Martina will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying more merchandise (blankets).

loans.use: to buy blankets

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es: Elizabeth, una mujer de 45 años de edad, con tres hijos de 17, 19 y 21 años respectivamente,madre soltera, originaria de Condega municipio de Esteli, de oficio comerciante. Fue criada por una señora que vivía en la Costa Atlántica, la cual le enseñó a trabajar y valerse por si misma. Doña Elizabeth tiene su negocio de venta de comida en el parque municipal de Condega, lo cual ha solicitado su préstamo para invetir en su negocio como es la compra de verduras, carnes, entre otros productos perecederos. En un futuro ella quiere tener un kiosko con el cual pueda ofrecer una mejor condiciones de infraestructura  a sus clientes y ampliarlo un poco más, para que le genere más ingresos y sacar adelante a sus tres hijos.
texts.en: Elizabeth is a 45 year-old woman with three children aged 17, 19 and 21.  She is a single mother who is a native of the municipality of Condega in Esteli province.  She was a maid for a woman who lived on the Atlantic coast, who taught her to work and stand on her own two feet.  Elizabeth has a business selling food in the municipal park of Condega.  She is requesting a loan to invest in her business so that she can buy vegetables, meat and other food supplies.  In the future she wants to have a kiosk where she can have a better facility for her customers and expand her business a bit more.  This way she could have more income and get ahead with her three children.

loans.use: to buy meat and vegetables

loans.name: Maria Maricela

texts.en: Maria lives in the town of El Paraiso in southern Honduras, where she has run a small beauty salon for the past six years. Her shop enjoys steady business due to its central location in the town center. Maria is requesting a loan of 20,000 Honduran lempira (HNL) to purchase supplies such as shampoos, conditioners, and dyes for her salon. This will be her second loan with Prisma, and she had a punctual payment record over the course of her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, conditioner, lotions, styling products, and hair dyes

loans.name: La Unidad 2 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Dayrani is one of the members of La Unidad 2 & 4 (The Unit). They are micro-entrepreneurs dedicated to selling items such as clothing, natural products, and shoes in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area.

Dayrani is the mother of four children, and they live together with her long term partner in a rural village outside the town. This is her first loan from Esperanza. She will use this loan to expand her product offerings, and to buy more. She has had her business for approximately three years. Her future plans are to see her children grow up and become professionals. Her biggest challenge right now is to raise her little baby. She enjoys working and being at home with her family.

Dayrani is planning to use her new loan to purchase different women's accessories like rings, earrings, bracelets, necklaces, belts, watches, wallets, etc. In the short term, she is planning to buy silver jewelry and cosmetics. She is very thankful for your support!!!

Note: The extra woman is one of their community leaders who attended the meeting to learn more about the group and the program. She is interested in being part of the group and getting a loan.

loans.use: to buy women's accessories and jewelry

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials such as tiles and cement

loans.name: Edy

texts.es: Edy es natural de Huancayo, siempre ha vivido en esta ciudad,  tiene 37 años, es madre de 2 hijos y vive en una casa arrendada desde hace 6 años. Tiene su tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad que adquiere mediante sus proveedores que acuden a su tienda  para traerle los pedidos que cada cierto tiempo realiza. Pero cuando debe abastecer de verduras y frutas, éstas son adquiridas en el mercado central de su ciudad. Paralelamente se dedica a los bordados artesanales, es así como se desenvuelve todos los días, administrando su tiempo para así no descuidar de sus hijos. Son muchos años de trabajo donde Edy es el único sostén de su familia y ha demostrado ser muy valiente cada vez que emprende un negocio y ahora tiene proyectos de ampliar su tienda. Es la segunda oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP donde ha demostrado ser responsable en sus cuentas mejorando  siempre la calidad de su negocio y recuerda con agrado el momento que decidió apoyarse de los créditos y su empeño para avanzar en el crecimiento de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para su tienda, como gaseosas, así como arroz y azúcar en sacos.
texts.en:
Edy is from Huancayo; she has always lived in this city.  She is 37 years old, has two children, and has lived in a rented house for six years.  She has a grocery store where she sells basic needs products.  She gets the products from her providers.  They come to her store to bring her the orders from time to time.  However, when she needs to stock fruits and vegetable she gets them from the central market of her city.  

She also makes embroidered handicrafts.  That is how all of her days unfold.  She manages her time so that she does not neglect her children.  Edy’s work has been the only support for her family for many years.  She has shown herself to be very courageous each time that she takes on a business.  She now plans to expand her store. 

This is the second time she has had a loan with MFP.  She has shown herself to be responsible with her accounts.  She is always improving the quality of her business.  She fondly remembers the time when she decided to get support from the loans and her determination to advance and grow in her business.  She will use the requested loan to buy more merchandise like soft drinks and sacks of rice and sugar for her store.

loans.use: to buy carbonated drinks, rice, and sugar in order to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en: Maria lives in the town of El Paraiso in southern Honduras, where she runs a small convenience shop for a living. Maria operates the shop out of her home and has had the business for the past six years. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Honduran lempira (HNL) to purchase merchandise for her store. Aside from running the shop, Maria cultivates coffee on a small piece of land she owns.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, cornmeal, corn, milk, cheese, butter, chicken, beef, sausage, fruits, vegetables, soft drinks, snacks, candy, household cleaning products, and personal hygiene products

loans.name: Sarita Noemí

texts.es:
La señora  Sarita Noemi vive en la cuidad de Managua se desempeña 
Es madre de familia de dos menores doña Sarita visito nuestras instalación para solicitar un crédito para  ya que necesitaba el crédito para completar el dinero para la compra de un terreno. 
La señora agradece a ceprodel por el crédito que le dieron por que gracias a el va a poder hacer la compra de su terreno.
texts.en:
Sarita Noemi lives in the city of Managua.  She is the mother of two minor children.  

Sarita visited our office to request a loan.  She needs this loan so that she can pull together enough money to buy a piece of land.

Sarita is grateful to Ceprodel for this loan, because it will enable her to complete the purchase of this land.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth es natural de Huancayo, la ciudad donde actualmente radica al lado de sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Sus deseos de emprender la motivaron a tener su negocio en su misma casa. Desde hace 6 años vende productos de primera necesidad en un espacio que disponía en su casa, ahí brinda una atención cálida y amable a sus clientes que recurren a su tienda. Todos los días atiende en su establecimiento hasta los fines de semana y en ocasiones sus hijos la apoyan cuando tienen tiempo libre. Las ventas aumentan cuando son  fechas festivas por ello su deseo es mejorar su tienda con más mercadería. Es una de las socias con mayor trayectoria en su grupo solidario que actualmente se mantiene a través del tiempo, siendo ella una de las que promueve la perseverancia y la responsabilidad en sus pagos. El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería ya que ha planificado renovar la mercadería que dispone.
texts.en: Elizabeth is a native of Huancayo, the city where she now lives with her 2 children in her own home.  Her desire to launch a business motivated her to set up a store in her own home.  For 6 years she has been selling basic consumer goods from a space in her house.  Here she provides warm and friendly service to the customers who patronize her store.  She attends to the store every day, even on the weekends, and occasionally  her children help her with the business when they have free time.  Her sales rise during holidays, and so she wants to improve her store by having more merchandise in stock.  She is one of the more experienced members in her communal bank, which has been able to keep going over time; in the group she promotes perseverance and responsibility in making payments. She will invest this money in the purchase of more merchandise, since she has planned on renewing the merchandise that she has available in her business.

loans.use: to buy products to restock her store

loans.name: Adela

texts.en: Adela lives in the town of El Paraiso in southern Honduras with her husband and school-age daughter. She has operated a small bakery for 11 years, making and selling cakes, breads, cookies, and pastries. Adela is requesting a loan of 10,000 Honduran lempira (HNL) to purchase cooking ingredients.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, milk, butter, sugar, yeast, cornmeal, and flour

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: José Leonardo

texts.es:
En el municipio de Managua, el señor José Leonado es una  persona acompañado tiene bajo su cargo a tres persona, responsable, trabajador que ha sabido llevar el bienestar a su hogar y ha logrado mantener a su familia.

Actualmente ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar  un crédito para realizar una pequeña inversiones personales con este desembolso.
texts.en: In Managua municipality, José Leonado is head of a three-person household. He is responsible, hardworking person who has been able to raise his family's quality of living over the years. He is currently a client of CEPRODEL and hopes to obtain a loan for some small personal investments.

loans.use: to pay for personal expenses.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es: Blanca Asucena tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, y junto a su esposo y tres hijos reside en la Colonia Cofradia.  Ella es una persona muy luchadora que desde muy joven inició a ganarse la vida trabajando arduamente. Desde hace 10 años en una parte de su casa tiene una pequeña pulperia donde vende todo tipo de comestibles, la atiende desde las 6:00 am hasta las 8:00 pm. Su principal ventaja es que no tiene competencia pero sus clientes son pocos ya que reside en las afueras de la ciudad. Con el prestamo solicitado podrá surtir su negocio de mas y variados productos, asi su negocio seguirá manteniendose de pie, y algun dia podra cumplir su sueño de adquirir una vivienda, y lo mas importante seguir apoyando a sus hijos con el estudio. Su compañera de grupo Dulce Patricia se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano y realiza las ventas de forma ambulante por todo el casco urbano de la ciudad y sus alrededores. Ambas socias son muy puntuales en sus pagos, tienen 6 ciclos de trabajar con prestamos en FAMA y se sienten muy agradecidas con la institucion por el apoyo recibido.
texts.en:
Blanca Asucena, age 39, is married.  She lives with her husband and their three children in the Cofradia neighborhood.  She is a very tenacious person.  When she was very young she started earning a living by working arduously.  For ten years she has been selling all types of groceries in a small grocery store she has in part of her house.  She tends the store from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  Her greatest advantage is that she does not have competition.  However, she has few customers because she lives in the outskirts of the city.

With the requested loan she will be able to stock her business with more groceries and varied products.  That way her business will continue to stay afloat.  One day she will be able to fulfill her dream of getting a house.  The most important thing is to continue supporting her children’s education.

Her colleague in the group, Dulce Patricia, sells second hand clothes.  She does this in an itinerant manner in the urban area of the city and its outskirts.

Both members are very punctual with their payments.  They have worked with loans with FAMA for six cycles.  They are very grateful to the institution for the support they have received.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: Melania D. 53 años, resiD. en la localidad D. Palcamayo. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Héctor D. 51 años y su hijo menor Bryan D. 16 años, a quienes quiere mucho. Con mucho esfuerzo Melania ha logrado emprender el largo camino D. “la agricultura”. Todas las mañanas sale a trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, papas, arvejas, zanahorias y habas, las cuales luego lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Tarma, donD. las venD. al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos. Lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Además nos comenta que se dedica a la ganadería; donD. engorda a los animales para luego vender su carne, “siempre me va muy bien”, comenta. Ya que tiene el asesoramiento D. su esposo quien trabaja como ganadero en otras estancias ganando un dinero extra. Por ello para más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen María” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donD. espera D. su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Melania D. recibir sus apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. varias cabezas D. porcino que cuesta un promedio D. S/. 150 soles cada uno.
texts.en:
With a great deal of effort Melania has managed to take on the long road entailed in farming.  Every morning she leaves to work in her fields in order to make them very productive.  She grows potatoes, peas, carrots, and beans.  She later takes them to sell at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.  This is where she sells them wholesale.

Her crops have given her the income needed to support her family.  That is why she wishes to put all of her efforts into getting ahead in this business.  What she likes the most about her work is taking care of the crops.  She has been doing this for 30 years.  She feels that the most difficult part is transporting her products to Tarma. The bags she takes are very heavy, and they make her very tired.

She tells us that she also devotes herself to livestock.  She fattens the animals to later sell their meat.  “It always goes very well for me,” she says.  Her husband advises her.  He works with cattle on other farms, and he earns extra money.  

That is why, later on, she wishes to buy new fields in order to increase her production.

She belongs to the Virgen María Communal Bank.  This is her fifth loan with MFP, where she hopes for their assistance in order to continue on with her objectives.  She pledges, once more, to make her payments as she has done with the previous loans she has had.

Also, it pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.  Upon receiving your support she will use the requested money to buy several pigs that cost on the average of 150 soles for each one.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Zoila María

texts.es:
En el municipio de Managua, la señora Zoila María   es una  persona, responsable, trabajador con bueno valores morales, que ha sabido llevar el bienestar a su familia y  ha logrado mantener estabilidad en  su hogar.
Actualmente ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar  un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda, con este desembolso comprara materiales de construcción tales como cemento, bloque, hierro, estribo y pago de mano de obra, para poder reparar  su hogar  y poder dar una mejor condición de vida a sus familia.
texts.en:
Zoila María is a responsible, hardworking woman of good moral values, who has been able to provide for her family and who has succeeded in bringing stability to her house. She lives in Managua.
She has recently come to CEPRODEL to ask for a loan she will use to make improvements to her house. In order to have her house repaired and to offer better living conditions to her family, she will use the loan to buy construction materials such as cement, blocks, iron and buttress, as well as to pay for labor costs.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as cement, blocks, iron and buttress, as well as to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de 42 años reside en la localidad de Palcamayo. Como madre soltera se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable y muy dedicada que cuida de sus 2 hijos: Rocío y Anderson, a los que quiere mucho. Como mujer trabajadora y luchadora, todas las mañanas se dedica al cuidado de sus cultivos de arveja, espinaca y zanahoria, productos que cuida con mucha dedicación y esmero. En todo este tiempo pudo adquirir sus propios terrenos agrícolas, más la demanda que genera las verduras en el mercado de la ciudad; le obligan a alquilar otros terrenos para sembrar en mayor cantidad. Paralelo a esta actividad, se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de verduras a la capital del país donde viaja desde hace 12 años. Su trabajo consiste en la compra de diferentes variedades de verduras y hortalizas, los cuales en unión con su propia cosecha. Lo comercializa al mercado “La parada”, de la capital donde según sus propias palabras “termina de vender en 2 horas”, menciona. Ahora ha sembrado espinaca que cosechará dentro de una semana. Le va muy bien en su negocio y sus aspiraciones son mayores, pues quiere abrir una tienda de fertilizantes y abono en su localidad, donde la mayoría de sus pobladores son agricultores. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen María” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde agradece su colaboración, ya que le ayuda a seguir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Juana de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en completar sus ahorros para la compra de 5 bolsas de semilla de arveja de la variedad letrilla, que cuesta un promedio de S/. 850 cada una.
texts.en: Juana is 42 years old and lives in the town of Palcamayo. As a single mother, she is characterized by being a responsible and very dedicated person who takes good care of her 2 children, Rocío and Anderson, whom she loves very much. As a hard-working and persistent woman, every morning she works in her fields growing peas, spinach and carrots, which she cares for with great dedication and effort. Over the course of time she was able to acquire her own agricultural lands. With the current demand for vegetables in the city's market, she also needed to rent other lands to plant in greater quantities. Parallel to this activity, she works buying and selling vegetables in the country's capital, where she has been traveling for the past 12 years. Her work consists of buying various kinds of vegetables and produce, which she combines with her own harvest. She sells them at the market in the capital called "La Parada," where, as she mentions in her own words, she "is finished selling in 2 hours." Now she has planted spinach, which she will harvest within a week. Her business is going very well for her, and her aspirations are great: she would like to open a store selling compost and fertilizers in her town, where most of the inhabitants are farmers. She belongs to the “Virgen María” communal bank. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she is grateful for this support, since it helps her keep advancing toward her goals. At the same time, she is once again committed to fulfilling her payment schedule, as with the previous loans she had. She also appreciates being part of her communal bank, because all of its members are responsible people with a great sense of solidarity. When she receives this support, Juana will invest the funds she is requesting to add to her savings to buy 5 bags of pea seeds of the Letrilla variety, which cost an average of 850 Peruvian soles each.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of pea seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials such as blocks, cement, iron, sand and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Maira Arelis

texts.es:
María, de 28 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, es soltera, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Ella inicio en esta actividad hace  años por medio de sus hermanas mayores que también se dedica a este negocio .Ella vende al por mayor y al detalle viaja de Honduras a Nicaragua para traer mercadería como ropa y zapatos para vender, otras zonas en la cuales  comercializa su producto es en Managua, frontera con Honduras, también tiene un venta instalada en la casa de su abuelita y los demás productos los comercializa de manera ambulante. A ella le gustaría comercializar su producto en Chinandega. 
Solicito el crédito para compra de mercadería tales como ropa, camisas, pantalones, zapatos y sandalias. Ella tiene un proyecto el cual es vender camisas con dibujos alusivos a la cultura de Nicaragua, camisetas para ello necesita comprar materia prima para trabajar, desea expandir su negocio vender al por mayor, incluso quiere viajar a Panamá a comprar mercadería para vender en Nicaragua. Su próxima meta es comprar un vehículo para distribuir su mercadería, hacerle mejoras a su pequeña tienda.
texts.en:
María is 28 years old and lives in the city of León. She is single and a merchant by profession. She works selling general merchandise. She started this business several years ago, thanks to her older sisters who also work in this business. She sells both wholesale and retail, and she travels between Honduras and Nicaragua carrying merchandise such as clothing and shoes to sell. Other places where she sells her products include Managua and the border with Honduras. She she also has a sales stand installed in her grandmother's house, and she sells the rest of her products as a mobile vendor. She likes to sell her products in Chinandega.
 
She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise such as shirts, pants, shoes, sandals and other clothing. She currently has a project to sell shirts with designs related to Nicaraguan culture. For these shirts, she needs to buy raw materials to work with. She wants to expand her business selling wholesale, and she would even like to travel to Panama to buy merchandise to sell in Nicaragua. Her next goals are to buy a vehicle to distribute her merchandise and to make improvements to her little store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as shirts, pants, shoes, sandals and other clothing.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es:
Artemio de 58 años, reside en la localidad de Palcamayo. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida; vive solo en su casa propia y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. Los años le han enseñado a Artemio que tiene que trabajar muy duro si quiere que sus cultivos sean los mejores de su poblado. Es así que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado liderar la producción de papa, arveja, espinaca y zanahoria. En cada cosecha que tiene es muy solicitado en los mercados de la ciudad de Tarma, donde obtiene mejores ganancias. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, lleva 45 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es mantener sus terrenos limpios, ya que crece constantemente maleza entre sus sembríos. Además comenta que en sus tiempos libres trabaja como peón en otros terrenos de cultivo, donde recibe un dinero extra; como también en el trasporte de carga del campo a la ciudad mediante burros; lo cual lo denominan “aseminas”.  Ahora él se está preparando para su cosecha de papa de la variedad “andina” que dentro de la próxima semana terminará de madurar. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen María” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. 
Artemio de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja y 25 kilos de semilla de espinaca; con lo que podrá comenzar su próximo sembrío.
texts.en:
Artemio is 58 years old and he lives in Palcamayo. He is a man who has always struggled to get ahead in life. He lives alone in his own house, and what he desires the most is to have a peaceful retirement. Through the years, Artemio has learnt that he needs to work very hard if he wants his crops to be the best of his village; and so, with great effort he has succeeded in becoming a leader in the production of potatoes, peas, spinach and carrots. Every one of his crops is highly requested in the markets of the town of Tarma, which is where he gets the best incomes. He has been engaged in this activity for 45 years. What he likes the most about his job is harvesting his products, and he thinks the most difficult part is keeping his lands free form the weeds that constantly grow in his crops. He also says that in his free time he works as a farmhand in other farm lands, as well as by transporting products from the countryside to the city using donkeys, which is known as "aseminas". He is now getting ready to harvest his next “Andina” potato crop, which will be ripen by next week. He is a member of the Banco Comunal “Vigen María” (Virgin Mary Communal Bank), this is the ninth loan he has requested to MFP, and he hopes for its cooperation to keep on working towards his goals. On the other hand, he once more commits to complying with the repayments of his dues, as he has done with the previous loans he has requested. On top of this, he likes being a part of his communal bank because all of its members are very responsible and caring people.
Upon receiving the loan, Artemio will invest the money he has requested to buy a bag of pea seeds and 25 kilos of spinach seeds, and he will use them to start his next crop.

loans.use: To buy a bag of pea seeds and 25 kilos of spinach seeds.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: La señora María Eugenia de 36 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de León , es madre soltera, tiene a su cargo dos hijos, ella se dedica a elaborar y vender tortillas de maíz, su nivel a académico es básico solo curso hasta el cuarto grado de primaria. Desde los 8 años de edad comenzó ayudando a su mama a elabora tortillas de maíz, junto con su hermana con el paso del tiempo se convirtió en un negocio familiar del cual ha sobrevivido ella, su hermana y su mama, de esta manera es que ha criado a sus hijos y pagando sus estudios. Hoy en  día su negocio lo tiene en su casa, ella vender tortilla en el mercado de la terminal de buses de León. Requiere el préstamo para comprar materia prima, como maíz, leña, para hacer tortillas. De esta manera ella podrá suplir parte de los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, hacerle más propaganda a su negocio pues en lo futuro quiere hacer reparaciones al techo de su hogar y su cocina que lo tiene viejo y deteriorado.
texts.en:
María Eugenia is 36 years old, and she lives in the city of León.  She is a single mother, and she has two children under her care.

She makes and sells corn tortillas.  Her education is basic; she only went to school up to the fourth grade.  When she was eight years old, she and her sister started helping her mother make corn tortillas.  With the passage of time it became a family business.  Her sister, her mother, and she have survived because of this business.  Through the business she has raised her children and paid for their education.

Her business is currently located in her house.  She sells tortillas at the market at the bus terminal in León.

She needs the loan to buy raw materials like corn and firewood to make tortillas.  This way she will be able to fill part of the orders from her customers and make more advertising for her business.  

In the future she wants to make repairs to the roof of her home and her kitchen, which is old and deteriorated.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like corn and firewood to make tortillas.

loans.name: Elberto

texts.es: El joven Elberto, es soltero vive con sus padres, hermanos que esta en edad escolar,elberto tiene una pequeña bodega la cual funciona en la casa de sus padres ademas de ello, trabaja en los fundos cercanos de la zona por donde vive,siendo así que en las mañanas atiende el negocio su hermana menor y por las tardes  atiende el, ya que  elberto trabaja desde la 6 am a las 2 de la tarde en el fundo. su principal negocio de elberto  es su bodega que a podido surtir con mucho esfuerzo para poder ayudar a sus padres, y también ayuda en los ingresos familiares por  mas de 1 año, el dinero que esta solicitando es para compra productos de primera necesidad para su bodega tales como arroz azúcar aceite fideos leche entre otras cosa para brindar un mejor servicio a sus cliente,el sueño que tiene elberto es ser comerciante mayorista para que con ello le genere mejores ingresos y así mejorar su calidad de vida elberto esta muy contento con la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en: Young Elberto is single, lives with his parents and brothers, and is school-age. Elberto has a small bodega [grocery store] that he runs out of his parents' house. He also works at nearby farms. Since Elberto works at the farms from 6:00 a.m. to 2 in the afternoon, his younger sister tends the store in the morning and he does so in the afternoon. His main business is the bodega, which he has been able to keep stocked through great effort. For over a year, he has done this in order to be able to help his parents and to help with the family's income. The money he is requesting will be used to buy staple products for his bodega, such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles, milk, and other items, in order to offer better service to his customers. Elberto's dream is to be a wholesale merchant because this would generate more income and thereby improve his quality of life. Elberto is very happy about the trust placed in him by granting this loan.

loans.use: to buy staple products for his grocery store, such as rich, sugar, milk, and noodles

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es: Valerio nació en la ciudad de Yanaoca (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 28 años de edad. Actualmente, Valerio vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con sus dos hijos. Valerio tiene una pequeña agencia de viajes “AATPERU” pero el local donde funciona es alquilado.  Ya son dos años y medio que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo papeles, propaganda y otras cosas mas. El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Inti Quilla” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Valerio was born in the city of Yanaoca (Cusco, Peru) and is 28 years old. He currently lives with his two children in the city of Cusco. Valerio has a small travel agency called "AATPERU," though he rents his place of business. He has already been running his business for two and a half years and it is going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. At this time, he needs a loan to buy more work materials such as papers, advertising, and other things. Valerio is a responsible and hard-working person. Because of these qualities he was invited to participate in the "Inti Quilla" communal bank of Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy more materials for his travel agency

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 47 años de edad. Actualmente, Miguel vive en la misma ciudad donde nació junto con sus dos hijos. Miguel tiene un puesto de venta de comestibles en el centro comercial “Confraternidad”.  Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más. El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Inti Quilla” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Miguel is 47 and lives in Cusco, Perú with his two children. Miguel runs a small store in the “Confraternidad” Market, which he has managed for three years with good results.  He seeks this credit in order to increase his store's inventory of rice, sugar, pasta and other staples.  He is known to be a hard worker and is well-regarded in his community; for these reasons he was invited to participate with the communal lender “Inti Quilla” and Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to increase store inventory of rice, sugar, pasta and other food items

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es: Violeta nació en la ciudad de Arequipa (Perú) y tiene 54 años de edad. Actualmente,  Violeta vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su único hijo. Violeta se dedica a la venta de ropa, ella es mayorista y reparte a revendedoras. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo pantalones, blusas, faldas y otras cosas más. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Inti Quilla” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Violeta was born in the city of Arequipa (in Peru) and is 54 years old. Currently, Violeta lives in Cusco with her only son.  Violeta works selling clothes, she is a wholesaler and distributes to resellers.  She has been working at this business for three years now, and doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. 

At this moment, she is requesting the loan to buy more goods such as trousers, blouses, skirts and other things, for example.  The member is a responsible and hard-working woman, and it is because of these qualities that her friends invited her to participate in the communal bank "Inti Quilla", of the Arariwa Association.

loans.use: to buy more goods such as trousers, blouses, skirts and other things.
